campaign.story:
Why Loopio?
We have all faced that frustration when you misplace your keys or your phone and spend valuable time looking for them. Over the past year Bluetooth LE (low energy) technology, has unlocked entire new categories of tech gadgets, one of which are small tracking devices. We think this technology is really cool but we have yet to find a tracker that we would use on a daily basis. Inspired by the potential of this technology, we decided to design and create our own device. We know people appreciate great quality when it comes to personal items. So we created Loopio, the World's first all aluminium Bluetooth tracker and also Loopio Sport, which has been inspired by the comments we recieced from Kickstarters since we launched our project. Both trackers use our smart antenna design to maximise signal performance and functionality.
Our frustration with existing products
Here are the current products available. Most of them are cheap, badly designed pieces of plastic. The truth is the majority of these trackers simply don’t work well enough to be used in every day life. In tests we found the main problems were lack of signal and poor battery life. This is caused by failing to utilise the current low energy bluetooth technology to its full potential.
What we did
Taking all these factors into account we designed & developed a new device, something that's built for purpose. Loopio has been designed from the ground up to be stylish, high quality and functional.
What makes the Loopio design so unique?
The Loopio is made from aluminium. To make this possible we needed a new way to incorporate the antenna, so we decided to add the antenna in the form of a loop. This loop also doubles up as the key loop, or by which you can attach it to anything you like. Our smart antenna design combined with the latest hardware enables Loopio to achieve optimal signal stability for up to a 50m (164feet) range. We then packaged this into the smallest design possible.
How the Loopio works
Loopio is Innovation
The Loopio is small and compact
Thanks to its intelligent flexible loop design we also managed to make the Loopio very compact. This means that when you attach your keys to the Loopio, it folds with your keys taking up minimal space, making sure it fits perfectly in your pocket.
Super efficient
Thanks to the low voltage bluetooth technology the Loopio is super efficient. The battery lasts for one year and is easily replaceable by the user.
Designed to be tough
Made from aluminium the Loopio is designed to be tough. It's lightweight too, weighing in at just 13grams, It's also water and dust resistant.
Designed with attention to detail, we believe in the small details
The Loopio has been designed with care and attention to detail. We hope you like the design as much as we do.
 Loopio Colors
The Loopio is currently available in silver or black, we will be adding more colors and finishes based on stretch goals and your suggestions.
Tech Specifications 
Project Timeline
About us
Now that you've learned about Loopio, we'd like to take a moment to introduce the minds behind this project. The loopio has been designed and developed in the UK. The Loopio concept, including the antenna design, has been designed by myself and the development and prototyping stages have been a collaboration with a UK technology & research company. The manufacturing will be outsourced to China, to meet our quality and price requirements needed in order to make this project viable.
Why Kickstarter?
We are so excited to share Loopio with Kickstarter before anyone else. The reason we have chosen the Kickstarter platform is simple. We have put a lot of time, effort and money into the design and development of our product and we know kickstarter has the potential to give our project the momentum it needs to succeed. 
We recognise that kickstarter has an important community of gadget enthusiasts, innovators and creators. This is why we want to share our idea with you because we feel your opinions and suggestions can really help us make this product the best it can be.
Your funding means more than anything to us, and we hope you can all join our exciting journey. All of the funding will go towards vitally important aspects of making Loopio a reality. We truly believe that our product will be in a class of its own.
Thank You!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It has taken us nearly a year to get to were we are today with the design and development of the Loopio. It has been a great challenge to achieve such great performance in such a compact sleek design.
The (BLE) bluetooth low energy technology that powers the Loopio is tried and tested, this inherently reduces the amount of risk still involved during the final stages of our project.
The largest of our hurdles left is to fine tune and get the antenna design ready for production. To help us with this we have partnered up with a world-class manufacturer leading in implementation of bluetooth technology.
The last stages of our project involves final development of our app and then bringing all these elements together including tooling, testing and production. 
The last challenge will be shipping out the product to each of our kickstarter backers. We have already researched this and have found the right logistics partner to use. We don't anticipate any complications during this stage.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Jack Daniel's is a brand of Tennessee whiskey and the highest selling American whiskey in the world. Each year, millions of barrels of whiskey are produced and sold. As part of the distilling process, the whiskey is aged in oak barrels.
The whiskey is aged in these barrels for 4 years. The used barrels are salvaged, the steel bands are removed, and the staves disassembled. Finally, the staves are cut into over-sized (7/8in. x 7/8in. x 5-1/4in. minimum) pen blanks.
My great grandfather, Stephen Ernest Whidden, was a carpenter. He ran a carpentry shop along with Mr. Decatur and Mr. Smith on the northeast corner of Broad Street and Lincoln Terrace in Peekskill, New York back in the 1920s. My grandfather, Ernest Richard Whidden, built airplanes for a living, but in his spare time he enjoyed carpentry.
Inspired by their legacy, I decided in 2014 to begin learning about woodworking. I purchased a lathe and began to make woodturned projects such as pens, keychains, winestoppers, and bowls.
One of the motivating factors at our woodshop has always been using reclaimed, salvaged, and sustainable wood sources. For the most part, I collect my own wood or purchase it from local salvage companies.
The wood being used to create the rewards for this campaign is from salvaged whiskey barrels once used by the Jack Daniel's Distillery.
Initially, pen making started out as a hobby. It has grown from that and turned into a full time family business. We currently run an online Etsy shop and sell items locally, but that isn't enough to provide for our growing family of 6 (and 2 cats).
Kickstarter allows for global exposure and creates permanent relationships with people who are passionate about what we create and also with potential retail buyers.
Our goal for this campaign is to raise enough funds to fulfill all our rewards, purchase a new lathe and drill press for our shop, and to provide for monthly expenses for our family.
I enjoy creating unique projects with a story. Each of the rewards for this campaign include an authentic piece of American distilling history. Included with each reward is a certificate of authenticity and a story that you can share with your friends.
Remember each item is handcrafted and unique! There may be variances in wood coloring and grain. Your particular keychain or pen may look slightly different than the one in the picture. If you would like more or higher resolution pictures of the rewards, please let me know!

Rewards will begin shipping in July and continue until completed.
Level 1 - $8 Reward: Whidden's Woodshop Tote Bag
Level 2 - $18 Reward: Wood Keychain
Level 3 - $28 Reward: Ballpoint Pen
Level 4 - $43 Reward: Ballpoint Pen & Pencil Set
Level 5 - $48 Reward: Rollerball Pen
 Level 6 - $50 Reward: Bolt Action Pen
 Level 7 - $60 Reward: Fountain Pen
Level 8 - $200 Reward: Ultimate Handcrafted Bundle
Pens from left to right: Fountain, Rollerball, Pencil, Ballpoint Pen, Bolt-Action, Keychain on top.
All of our pens come in a display box with a magnetic closure. Our keychains come in felt bags.

Recent Feedback
This is our second Kickstarter project to feature pens made from reclaimed whiskey barrels. To see the feedback from our previous project click here.
Whidden's Woodshop in the Press
Whiskey Barrel Pens 2.0 Press Release
Exquisite Ink
Explore your Creativity with Fine Handcrafted Wood Pens
Give a Complete Different Feeling with a New Pen
Upgrades
Add $5 to any Level 2 or higher reward and get a Whidden's Woodshop tote bag included
Add $10 to any Level 3 or higher reward and get a Reclaimed Whiskey Barrel Wood Keychain included
Stretch Goals
UNLOCKED - Stretch Goal 1: All of the Whiskey Barrel pens come with black ink. If $3,000 is reached, you will have the option to choose black, red, or blue ink.
UNLOCKED - Stretch Goal 2: Chocolate Factory Pen Reward
Yellow Pine flooring reclaimed from the now shuttered Schafer's Chocolate Factory in Manayunk, PA. Memories of chocolate dust and machine oil encrust the lumber salvaged by the Philadelphia Salvage Company. Permeating the wood so deeply, it leaves dark butterscotch tones along the grain.
Once located on Krams Avenue in Manayunk, PA and run by local confectioner Harold Schafer until his passing, the Schafer Chocolate factory is providing a different taste of sweetness now.
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal 2.5: Beer Barrel Pen Reward
White Cedar salvaged from the Ortlieb's Brewery in Northern Liberties before its demolishing in 2007. This reclaimed lumber was once an integral part of the beer making operation; the brew barrel. The lumber was reclaimed by Manayunk Timber to save for making furniture and other pieces of art. Whidden's Woodshop has acquired a small amount of this malty wood and is making it available to you via this Kickstarter campaign!
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal 3: Lever-Action Pen Reward
The World's Only Lever Action Bullet Click Pen! Cock the Lever to both advance and retract the refill. The sides of the pen are adorned with an antique brass etched deer on one side and the entry slide for the bullet casing on the other! Antique Brass adorns the pen that is artfully etched with designs on both sides of the pen.
These pens will be available in both Whiskey Barrel and Beer Barrel wood.

campaign.story:
A lot of us have been frustrated by the traditional wallet, yet a perfect replacement is difficult to find. Urban Slim leather wallet is designed for people who love minimalism without having to make a sacrifice. This slim wallet can handle your cards, cash, receipts and more. It has a special flexible pocket design for easy access and handle lots of cards in a single pocket.
Product Highlight
Super Secure
Unlike other “slim” or “minimalist” wallets, which leave some or all of your wallet’s content exposed, we keep it all tucked away.
Super Durable
Made from the Premium genuine leather and high quality woven custom elastic, the Urban Slim Wallet was intently designed with longevity in mind, capable of enduring the tests of even the most extreme lifestyles.
Super Versatile 
This wallet is capable of holding as much or as little as you need. It securely holds anywhere from 1-15 cards, as well as cash, receipts, keys, or anything else you can imagine you’d need from your wallet.
Flexible Pocket
QuickDraw pocket
QuickDraw pocket
Easy access cash draw
      WHY Urban Slim Wallet IS BETTER: A WALLET DESIGNED TO FIT YOUR LIFE STYLE
small and Light weigh
Faster and easier access to your cards and cash 
Ultra slim profile won't be intrusive to your wardrobe
 
Urban Slim Wallet dimensions 
10.2cm(3.9"inchs) X 7.8cm (3.5"inch) X 0.7cm (0.28"inch) 
What's this Urban Slim Wallet made of ?
The wallet is made of high quality elastic and Premium genuine leather.
URBAN SLIM WALLET IS AMAZINGLY THIN
At only 0.7cm, Urban Slim Wallet is as thin as the iPhone 6 Plus.
URBAN SLIM WALLET IS EASY TO ACCESS
Urban Slim Wallet keeps the cards you use most at your fingertips. So helpful. 
URBAN SLIM WALLET IS COLORFUL 
We made Urban Slim Wallet in 3 colors. Black, Brown and Blue. 
OUR PRODUCTION PLAN
We have completed an intensive, 9 month-long prototyping process with our tailoring team to solve any durability problems and challenges we might face as we move into production. The next step is to place the order for materials and start the first production run of wallets.
Production schedule:
Celebrate the successful end of our Kickstarter campaign
Wait for up to 20 days for funds to clear
Week 1: Place order for materials and schedule production
Week 1: Place order for packaging
Weeks 2-4: Wallet production and print packaging
Week 4: Check every wallet to make sure they are perfect
Week 5: Package wallets for shipment
Ship! We expect to start shipping orders in Aug 20th 2015
JOIN OUR TEAM
This is where you come in. We need your help to get this product into your pocket. We are looking for people who are searching for ways to slim down and simplify their lives. Your support will help us cover the costs of our first production run. Thank you for taking the time to check out the project.

Spread the word
Share the Kickstarter video and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr,Youtube, Instagram to learn about any new announcements and more. 
Kickstarter link : http://kck.st/1K7sWyB 
Facebook Page : https://www.facebook.com/combocases 
Twitter : https://twitter.com/ComboCases 
Google+ : https://plus.google.com/+ComboCases_com/posts 
Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/user/ComboCases 
Tumblr : http://combocases.tumblr.com/ 
Instagram : https://instagram.com/combocases/ 
Website : http://www.combocases.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have spent significant time refining and testing the design. We've already selected the manufacturer and completed tooling. The samples you see in the photos and videos work great, feel great, and look fantastic. However, every project carries with it certain risks. The risks specific to this project would include shipping or production delays. While we feel like we have reduced these variables as much as possible, they can never be completely eliminated. We feel our experience and familiarity with our manufacturer and the product development process gives us a unique skill set in handling unexpected problems and we don't anticipate any significant roadblocks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal Added!!
If we reach 75k backers can upgrade to NSF-53 certified filters for chlorine, taste, odor, fluoride, lead and other volatile organic compounds (VOC's)! There are just a few days left, support now!
Introduction:
Hello Kickstarter Community! I need your help to create the future of the water bottle: a sustainable, sleek bottle that filters your water as you drink it. 
Standard reusable bottles are great for the environment and save you money that would otherwise go to over-priced and environmentally costly bottled water—but it’s still on you to fill them with pure, great-tasting water. 
It’s time for a better solution. 
I’ve designed the WELLY Bottle to be exactly that: an easy-to-carry, reusable, BPA-free water bottle with a built-in filter made from activated and carbonized coconut shells that purifies your water as you drink it. The compressible bamboo hand-panels on the front and back not only look and feel distinctive, but they also allow you to accelerate water flow when you need it most. 
Now I just need your help to get it off the ground! 
The Inspiration
WELLY’s story begins with my mom Ellen (my Dad called her 'Elly'), who passed away in 2012 from liver cancer after a life filled with philanthropy and community involvement in my hometown of Pittsburgh. I saw first-hand the impact that the impurities and toxins that saturate so much of our lives can have on a person—a person who also taught me a lifelong lesson in the importance of doing something good for the world.
As painful as this experience has been, it inspired me to make something that would help people purify their lives. I had already become frustrated with the incredibly wasteful bottled water industry and decided to create a bottle that is cleaner for your body and cleaner for the environment.
This inspiration comes together in our name. WELLY pays tribute to the wells that symbolize humanity’s long relationship with water, as well as the kinds of wells that charity: water builds in the developing world. WELLY also stands as a statement of the power of wellness in invigorating life. Finally, and for me most importantly, WELLY honors and continues the legacy begun by my dear mom Elly.
The Design: Purity Meets Usability
This starts with the highly absorbent filter, made entirely from coconut shells, that strips away chlorine, odor and other impurities that contaminate the naturally pure taste of clean water. Our filter is independently certified by the stringent standards of NSF International, which has collaborated for years with the World Health Organization on global water issues. Each filter provides two months (or 40 gallons!) of clean water, and you’ll be able to find replacement filters on our website individually or as part of a subscription plan.
We then designed our bottle to be a joy for someone who’s serious about staying hydrated while active and on the go. We know from personal experience what it’s like to crave pure water after a run, a session in the yoga studio or a long hike. That’s why we’ve built in a bunch of unique (patent pending) features such as:
A mouthpiece that is protected within the bottle’s cap, ensuring it stays clean, yet easily accessible by tapping the bottle’s trigger
Bamboo hand panels you can squeeze to accelerate water flow
A finger loop that makes carrying your bottle by hand or on a carabiner easy and secure
Feet on the bottle’s bottom for stability
An opening large enough to accommodate ice cubes
A slim profile to minimize the space required to carry the bottle in a bag or purse
And, of course, the entire bottle is absolutely BPA and phthalate free.
Our Commitment: Purification Beyond The Bottle
We’re delighted to put the ability to purify your own water supply in the palm of your hand, but we know that the issue of water purity is global in scope as 748 million people currently don’t have access to clean water. That’s why we’re humbled and excited to link up with charity: water, one of the world's leading organizations working on global water safety today. charity: water‘s work has already impacted over 5 million people in 24 countries, they operate with full transparently, and with their help, we can show you exactly what projects your money helps to fund (like this one).
$1 of every WELLY bottle sold, and a percentage of every future filter sold, will go straight to charity: water, where 100% of the donations will directly fund sustainable clean water solutions. 
Our Values: Sustainability At Every Turn
We crafted every element of our business model with a focus on sustainability. Our bamboo itself is one of the most rapidly renewable resources on the planet and a source of economic opportunity for over 800,000 people, and it comes only from suppliers using sustainable harvesting practices. Our filters are made entirely from coconut shells rather than the wasteful million-year-in-the-making coal filters found in many filtration systems today. Finally, all of our packaging is made with recycled content that dramatically reduces WELLY’s carbon footprint.
We’re done with the initial design and are excited to green light production—we just need you!
We need your help to bring this vision of a purer world to life. By helping to fund WELLY Bottle, you’ll not only be among the first to get this awesome bottle, but you will also be supporting:
A world in which we don’t need to settle for choosing either sustainability or water quality
A business model that views sustainability as mandatory, not just nice-to-have 
The fight against a major global humanitarian problem: the water crisis
Thank you for your support!
With sincerity and determination,
Ben and the WELLY Team
Connect With Us:
Other Pics:
Get Your Project Funded Today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our primary remaining challenge is to make sure all parts fit with extreme precision in order to optimize usability and performance. Currently, we have some fine-tuning to do in this area, but do not anticipate any major roadblocks.

We have taken every precaution to make sure our bottles meet strict quality standards. All materials are certified BPA-free and phthalate-free and our bamboo is sustainably harvested. We anticipate a production timeline of 10 weeks after reaching our goal, and then a shipping timeline of 6 weeks, which includes preparing the shipments at our fulfillment house in Massachusetts. From there, we will rely on USPS to ship our products domestically and around the world.

We are confident with this timing, plus or minus a few weeks. We have managed out the unknowns to the best of our abilities, but as people who care deeply about our product and reputation, we will communicate with you throughout the process so that you know exactly when to expect your shipment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
Please send your updated shipping address to support@wellybottle.com! If you are unsure if you already sent it to us, feel free to send it again :)
Our production run shipment is expected to arrive at the New York port on December 16th and is expected to clear customs and arrive at our warehouse by December 23rd-26th. It is currently just passing Cuba:

Hi Welly Backers,
Since many of you who backed Welly are interested in water purity, I wanted to share a really cool Kickstarter campaign that is live right now:

Hey Backers!
Reaching out to give you an update on our progress as well as our current production schedule.
A few weeks ago, I travelled to visit our manufacturers where I was able to help work out all remaining kinks in our assembly process. Working with a natural material such as bamboo can be difficult, but we put in procedures to make sure everything runs smoothly during production and assembly.
Production Samples

Hey Backers,
Reaching out to get your updated shipping address as Welly Bottles and Filters are scheduled to arrive at the New York port on March 10th with delivery to our Brooklyn warehouse around March 18th (depending on customs clearance)!
Only provide your address if you have moved since the close of the Kickstarter campaign or if you have not yet sent us your updated address.

Hey Backers!
Just a quick update to let you know that all bottles have been assembled, packed and shipped out to the shipping vessel! The vessel will be leaving on January 24th and arriving at the New York port on February 28th. It will then take 5-7 days to go through customs and be shipped to our Brooklyn warehouse where we will be fulfilling orders immediately.

campaign.story:
The basis for the branding, WINK, was derived from the concept of using “wine as ink” but the pen can be loaded with virtually any liquid that possesses a staining property.
The idea of using raw inks was something I thought of while working on a concept for a sustainable printer, during which I learned that inks—even those made with vegetable and soy—used in traditional printers are not 100% biodegradable. From the printer project, I re-evaluated my approach toward product design as a whole and began taking into consideration the full cycle of products; everything from how materials are first sourced to the manufacturing processes, as well as environmental foot prints pre and post-consumer use. Being inspired I ran with the idea of integrating alternative inks leading me eventually to the creation of the WINKpen!
In essence, the WINKpen was born from the desire to create a sustainable alternative to something that many of us use in our daily lives. Traditional pens are, more often than not, disposable products; once the pre-loaded ink stem is exhausted, they essentially just become empty plastic cases that inevitably wind up in a land-fill somewhere. With with the WINKpen, however, an ink reload can be found right there in your kitchen.
Reusable, sustainable, and long-lasting. Helps mitigate “throwaway” culture and there's also the added benefit of having inexpensive ink available virtually anywhere!
Everyone! My goal with WINKpens was to create an innovative and simple product people could use and re-use in their daily lives. In many ways, this pen can be a new addition to your creative arsenal, allowing individuals to experiment and express with untraditional mediums. It can be a unique purchase for the creative in your life or just as easily serve as an elegant and customed promotional gift for your business. It is a “low-tech” product that marries modern aesthetics and environmental awareness with traditional function.
Over the last year and a half, I've devoted the majority of my spare time outside of work to the creation of the WINKpen. Like the creation of anything worth-while, it wasn't exactly easy! There was a lot of sleepless nights spent sketching, designing, and just tinkering in the shop; utilizing everything from 3D printing, sanding mock-ups, jumping on the lathe, using saws, sourcing various materials that were within reach, and reverse engineering. There was a lot of back and forth with sketching, prototyping, and testing. Whenever a prototype failed to meet expectations, I'd start again from square one. While I've poured a lot of my time, and personal finances into the project, I wasn't without support. I contracted others on board when necessary—such as my engineer, who explained to me what was feasible and what wasn't—all of which have aided me into bringing the best solutions into constructing the most user-friendly product possible. Thank you to everyone who's encouraged, advised, and helped me along the way... because without each and every single one of them, I certainly would not be where I am today.
The WINKpen is built to be as modular and user friendly as possible. All components fit snuggly together with the use of rubber o-rings, and can be easily pulled apart and pushed back together for ease of cleaning.
A double-sided glass nib features an angled tip for calligraphy and also a conical tip for finer penmanship. The glass replaces the metal tips and ball-points in traditional pens, removing the risk of corrosion and making it easy to clean. Spiraled grooves in the glass nib elegantly feed ink to paper while also boasting a beautiful aesthetic.
The interior of the coupler is lined with an elastomer which acts to hold the glass nib securely in place. The elastomer lining, in combination with the fine feeding tube also aids in the steady flow of ink.
Diplomat's piston design allows for a simple twist refill and ink release system, making it a simple process to controllably unload and load the pen with various inks of your choosing.
Our logo will be beautifully etched on the outside of the glass housing. Customizable options will be available in the near future however, as part of this kickstarter you can get yours personalized NOW!                              
** see pledge perks for details**
Check out WINKpens rewards for contributing! The connection I have to this product and startup is something I would love to also share with my supporters, thus I will happily be spending time sketching with beer and wine myself for some unique perks! 
** International Backers - YES I can ship to you!:)  However in order to cover this cost, please add on $25 to your pledge - contact me with any questions**
After getting the first version of this product into the world for people to use, plans for the future of the product include sketch pads, inks, and customizability options; such as cosmetic sleeves (wood, metal, etc.), colored glass nibs, business logos, and personalized names.
- WINKpens' vision of an innovative new tool that will open up new avenues of creativity.
- Upfront tool cost and materials. 30k is needed for tooling alone!
- Allowance for large-scale production.
- The very first order and run of our product!
- Continued support for business development, strategies for production, growth, and order management.
- A few hours of shut-eye for the designer!
Hi, my name is Jess! I'm an industrial designer and contemporary artist located in Portland, Oregon. Creativity made its way into my life early on in a number of ways. Growing up, there was so much in the world that inspired me: nature, colors, and objects that provoked my natural desires to express and problem solve. It wasn't until very recently did my career of choice really begin to emerge to combine all of my experiences into my current path of becoming an entrepreneur.
My diverse background from teaching martial arts and personal training to business marketing, customer service, construction, freelance and design--has all contributed to the creation of product that I'm beyond passionate about. Martial arts instilled in me the fighting mentality to relentlessly pursue my goals, business provided the applicable knowledge, construction gave me the hands-on experience, and freelancing as an industrial designer and artist taught me how to better manage and deliver quality products. In a way, each major experience has been a stepping stone to who and where I am now.
For me, design is all about solution and utility, while art is expression – together, they provide endless opportunities and create stories of growth all their own. The potential to touch another person, to ignite that spark in them that might blossom into something great, and the daily opportunity to just provide new experiences is what eternally fuels the love for my craft.
From the very bottom of my heart, THANK YOU for your support and sharing this project with your friends and family! 
AN EXTRA SPECIAL THANK YOU to this awesome crew for your expertise and support! 
Matthew Malone - Engineer 
Kurt Rassos - Graphic Designer 
Donald Chan - Editor
Blacklist Media - Film
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the creation of any product that includes manufacturing processes and hand-made glass components, there can be a number of unforeseen risks and obstacles. As of the kickstarter launch, I have working prototypes and all of the technical drawings ready and approved by manufacturers. The current models are 3D printed to provide a functional dimensioned proof of concept; however, this funding will allow us to incorporate injection and overmolding, cover the costly upfront tooling costs, and utilize all the correct quality materials.

When I first began this project, I set out to design the WINKpen with integrity. I've put my best foot forward since day one and adamantly refuse to compromise quality. I've hand-selected excellent companies and am constantly learning from mentors and other experienced professionals in an effort to maintain product progression and business growth. I will personally review each pen to ensure that it is the best possible product and will not ship them to you until the pens are at its best.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The umbrella has been around for over 3000 years yet it has remained flawed in its design...Until now:
The KAZbrella is a revolutionary umbrella. Through many years of research and engineering we have redesigned the mechanics of the umbrella whilst maintaining the familiar look. The KAZbrella is a patented, reverse folding umbrella.
KAZbrella: reverse folding umbrella
Opens to look like a conventional umbrella
Drip free. The KAZbrella opens inside out - Think of it like a flower opening. This leaves the wet side of the canopy contained on the inside when closed. The KAZbrella is dry to handle. It won't drip on the floor or soak anything it touches. 
Opens/Closes in confined spaces. Getting into your car, you can close the KAZbrella into the smallest gap of a car door, whilst remaining dry. Now you can even put the KAZbrella on your car seat without soaking it! 
Easy to open and close in a crowd. KAZbrella opens up and over the user avoiding poking in the eye! Perfect in a crowd.
Strong in the wind. As the KAZbrella is double spoked, it is extremely strong. In the unlikely event that the KAZbrella is blown inside out, it's not a problem. A click of the button and the KAZbrella will restore back to its open shape. 
How the KAZbrella opens.
KAZbrella Closed
KAZbrella Opening
KAZbrella Opening
We understand an umbrella has to do more than function correctly. It needs to look good too. There are many gimmicky umbrellas on the market and that's not what we're about. We believe in engineering and intelligent design. We want you to be proud to carry a KAZbrella.
Having a successful career as an aeronautical and offshore engineer, Jenan has applied his knowledge to his invention. Precise engineering and mathematical equations have been used to ensure the KAZbrella outperforms a conventional umbrella whilst keeping its familiar aesthetics and usability. This has not yet been achieved by any other umbrella designer.
Prototype Detail
Our technology and designs are protected by a number of patents and trademarks.
We believe in quality and have used high standard materials, from the aircraft-grade aluminium shaft to the lightweight fibreglass spokes. 
The premium double canopy is made from breathable fabric. It has hydrophobic coating, causing water to bead and roll off the canopy rather than being absorbed into the material.
Bespoke Textile Design for our printed lower canopy:
Our in-house design team have created a unique textiles design. With tessellating shapes incorporating the KAZ logo, the geometric print reflects an Escher painting.
All the top canopies are classic black. Part of the beauty of the KAZbrella is when closed, the inside colour or print will be revealed on the outside.
Where applicable we will email you for your colour choice. 
International Shippers: Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.
NB: Pledge funds are being managed by BDL Engineering for and on behalf of KAZ Designs.  
"I think this is brilliant because getting into a car with my hair when it's raining I've often wished it would go the other way." Kelly Hoppen (Interior Designer)
“The ‘inside out umbrella’ was one of my favourite inventions. It came together with a moment of mechanical inspiration and works beautifully well!” Jem Stansfield (Presenter of Bang Goes the Theory)
"You've made me feel like a complete idiot for using a normal umbrella." Ben Redhead (Buyer for Firebox.com)
"It's a superb example of some reverse engineering" Angus Rankine (Entrepreneur)
"I really really want one." Duncan Bannatyne (Entrepreneur)
We have manufacturers on board which we have been working with for over a year. We have working production samples. Now, all that we need is your help to get the KAZbrella on the production line. Our Kickstarter funding will be used for the manufacturing process. This will include:
Tooling - as this is a unique product every component has been specifically designed and will require special tooling to make them. 
Manufacturing - setting up production line, quality control and testing of the product. 
Logistics - To ensure the delivery is quick and efficient. 
Should we go beyond our target funding for manufacturing, we will use the excess for further prototyping, 3D printing and advancement of the KAZbrella. This will include the development of a range of KAZbrella sizes, handles and canopy designs. 
Kaz Designs is a family owned business which draws on the strengths and expertise of its members. 
Jenan with a background in Aeronautical and Marine Engineering is the brains behind the mechanics of the patented KAZbrella. 
Wendy has sold textile designs to the likes of John Lewis and Liberty of London. She has run her own greeting card company and has an eye for aesthetics and design. 
Riann is a 3D designer and can turn her hand to many jobs. One being translating Jenan's vision into 3D drawings. Not an easy task when you see the inventors' sketches and scribbles! Riann is also a great administrator.
Max, our talented videographer is responsible for our videos and promotion. 
Tony, last but not least, is our skilled Graphic Designer.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Product
We have a production sample which is working well and looking beautiful but we are not done yet. We are working on further improvements. The samples have been manufactured using 3D printed parts to prove the concept and identify the tooling requirements.

Due to the complexity of making a KAZbrella, there is a small possibility that the final specification may change. We will keep you informed on any modifications. 

Manufacturers
Over the last 12 months, we have established a close working relationship with our manufacturers who have 20 years experience in producing innovative, quality umbrellas. Together with the expertise of the manufacturers and Jenan's engineering experience we are confident that we can overcome any technical difficulties that may arise. 

Delivery
We will of course do our upmost to ensure that we hit delivery dates. However, this is a new and revolutionary product and we will want to be true to our ethos of innovation, creativity, quality and integrity. We will not be taking half measures, please be patient with us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
December News, Competition Details & Christmas Delivery Dates.
It's been a fantastic year here at KAZbrella! Once again we'd like to thank you all for your support, we've come a long way and we wouldn't be here without you all! Our online store is now up and running! - www.kazbrella.com
PLAY

To all our backers in Asia, Australia and New Zealand, 
We have had some comments asking about the status of your delivery. 
Your order is currently being dispatched or is currently in transit on its way to you! 
We greatly appreciate how patient our backers have been and we want to reassure you your KAZbrella will be with you soon :)

Hi all, 
We have now dispatched the vast majority of Kickstarter pledges. If you have not received yours yet please do not worry it will be with you shortly. 
We have personally packed and dispatched the pledges for Europe and USA. However, as much as we would like to personally send out all the pledges, we are unable to do so. Therefore, we are using a fulfilment company based in Hong Kong to deliver to the following countries:
Check out our demonstration video of the best way to open and close your KAZbrella!
Video Update:

To all our supportive backers, 
Yesterday was an exciting day for us as we took delivery of thousands of KAZbrellas here in the UK.

Good News! 
As per our last update we are still on schedule for an end of March delivery. The shipment is at the port for custom clearance before departure to the UK. 
Happy Chinese New Year!  The year of the Monkey. 
KAZbrella Team

Hi,
We hope you had a good Christmas and Happy New Year.
News from the factory
Jenan has been in China since the beginning of January overseeing the final production stages of the KAZbrella. The frame production is now in full swing and rapidly coming off the line for Jenan to check. The canopies have been made up, the logos for the business packages have been printed, the bespoke canopy design has been printed and the initials for the personalised KAZbrellas have been embroidered. Now, as the frames come off the production line, the canopies are being sewn on and the final assembly of the KAZbrellas is being completed.

I get this is the Kickstarter version, but the velcro strap is quite the oversight.

campaign.story:
The campaign is over but you can still join us on this adventure... 
Thank you to all our amazing backers. The future is bright because of you!
If you missed out on our campaign don't worry, check out our website to see how you can grab a GOBAG.
www.wearegobag.co.uk
#PackSmallThinkBig
The GOB∆G is a carry-on sized duffel bag designed so you can travel compact with all the gear you need. Its killer feature is the Max Pack Bag, which allows you to vacuum compress your soft items. This enables you to carry enough for a long trip in a 35 litre bag.
GOB∆G’s simple and robust design is engineered to last a lifetime. The outer bag is constructed from only two pieces of TPU coated ballistic nylon, a material commonly used to make inflatable boats. This ‘less is more’ design approach is continued throughout the product.
The Full Edge Zip is a 2 meter long, durable YKK zip that runs along the outer edge of the front and side panels. This means more of your gear is next to the zip; you'll never have to dig around at the bottom of your bag again.
More zip. Less hassle.
This feature doesn't need much explanation. It's the perfect size for 95% of the major airlines' carry-on, even Ryanair!
The Max Pack Bag is the GOB∆G's killer feature. It's a welded bag made from TPU coated nylon with an integrated vacuum check valve to compress all your soft goods. Just throw your gear into the bag, seal it and compress it. You can compress the bag by either using a vacuum cleaner or compressing it by hand.
Pack. Vac. Go.
The Max Pack Bag is fully removable. Just unscrew the check valve, release the attachments inside the GOB∆G, and pop the cap on, then you're ready to go.
We've had enough of those disposable plastic bags you get at the airport. Our integrated wash bag means an end to wasting time at airport security – your liquids and pastes are ready to go from the off. Just rip off the wash bag from its velcro attachment and you're good to go.
We've also designed an adaptable laptop harness that holds your notebook securely away from the edges of the bag. It can take care of everything between 11-15 inches. One less thing to worry about.
Shhhh... we've added a hidden pocket to the bag. Who doesn't love a secret pocket?! It's also quite useful for your money, passport and other secret stuff. 
Here's what some of our early testers have been saying about the GOB∆G.
Its about to get a little detailed here, so skip this bit if you trust that we've used the best.
1000d Codura Nylon is the ultimate in abrasion protection. We have placed it over the maximum wear areas like the base.
TPU Coated Ballistic Nylon the ultimate waterproof material. This is the stuff that inflatable power boats are made out of.
Carbon Steel G Hooks Forget those flimsy plastic buckles that you get on some bags. All of ours are made out of Carbon Steel. 
Monkey Fist Zip Pulls Made from high tensile strength para cord. A knot that a salty sea dog would be proud of.
YKK Zippers Everyone knows that all the best gear uses YKK zips not some rubbish imitation. Zips matter!
Due to the initial costs and high minimum order quantities for the first production run, we need your support. Here’s how you can support our campaign and be the first to own a GOB∆G.
James came up with the idea for the GOBAG two years ago. He was traveling a lot between London and Scotland for weekend trips on Easyjet flights and was frustrated that he couldn't take everything he needed as hand luggage. His budget but functional solution was to pack all his clothes in a bin bag, vacuum the air out and zip tie the end. He thought "There's got to be an easier way to do this..."
The GOBAG was born.
A picture of James' trusty Singer Sewing Machine, bought for £20 on Gumtree.
Over the last two years we have put the GOB∆G through rigorous testing. Here are a few shots from our most recent wear trials.
GOBAG Wear Trial; Loch Tulla, Scotland
GOBAG Wear Trial; Rannoch Moor, Scotland
GOBAG Wear Trial; Salisbury Plain, England
We have sourced and secured a great manufacturer in China whose other clients include some big outdoor brands.
If (*ahem...* when) we secure the funding for the first production run we plan on having a member of the GOBAG Team go to China to supervise the manufacturing and oversee the quality control, ensuring that you get a great quality product. 
We've got it all planned out.
    Backers: kickstarter@wearegobag.co.uk
Business Enquiries: business@wearegobag.co.uk
Press Enquiries: press@wearegobag.co.uk
Thanks for taking the time to check out the GOB∆G! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.
#PackSmallThinkBig
We want to thank some fantastic people that have helped us out on the way.
ZZZONE BRISTOL Thanks Jonny for shooting the GOB∆G pictures. If you live in Bristol, you need to go down and say hi (or just check out his website zzzone.co.uk)
MATT ALANI who has worked on the audio for the videos. Check out some of his other work at shifted-sound.com
FRED INGLEBY braved the weather on a cold London afternoon to shoot the video. Thanks Fred!
CHRIS SLEIGH also helped us out in some wintery weather in the Scottish Highlands to get some great shots of the GOB∆G. 
Get Your Project Funded Today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Designing and manufacturing new products always involves risk. We've spent over two years refining the GOBAG design and taking advice from UK based experts to minimise these risks.

If we find opportunities for improvement we will address them immediately with updated and improved design solutions. We will let you know if any improvements and alterations are made. These improvements will then be verified in the final testing stage in July 2015 when the first product articles from the production line will be tested. Final tweaks will then be made before the full production run in August 2015. We are experienced in sourcing and manufacturing in Asia and are therefore well prepared to deal with any potential issues.

When the volume production run commences we will be present in China supervising all aspects of the production and the quality assurance. We are completely committed to ensuring that the GOBAG lives up to our high expectations of functionality and craftsmanship.

We have kept our reward tiers as simple as possible to ensure fulfilment goes smoothly. We know this is where many Kickstarter projects have slipped up in the past and we do not underestimate this stage's challenges. We have already teamed up with a fulfilment company to ensure you get your GOBAG on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Backers,
We've got some great news! We've been nominated for the Best Carry-on Bag by Carryology. We couldn't have got here without your support. Thank you!

updates.update_userinfo: GoBag 2.0 | Thank you for your support!
updates.update_content:
Hey!
Thank you so much to everyone who made our latest campaign an incredible success. We couldn't have done it without your support. We're beyond stoked!

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing the new GoBag 2.0 in 44 seconds
updates.update_content: We made a video that show's you the new GoBag Backpack in 44 seconds. Check it out.

updates.update_userinfo: Our new Carry-on Backpack is Live on Kickstarter - Save 37%
updates.update_content:
Hello,
The moment is finally here. Our new Carry-on Backpack is now available on Kickstarter.
Here’s the good news, team: the remaining GOBAGs will start to ship this Thursday.

2016 is going to be one of those momentous years because, and it’s so great to say this, we are delivering your GOBAGs to you – our amazing backers. Thanks for joining us on this journey. There’s no way this would have ever been possible without each and every one of you.

Today is a great day. The GOBAGs are being loaded into their container and are bound for the high seas!
Everything is still looking good for shipping in January. We’re now at the mercy of Davy Jones and the Port Customs Authorities.

Hi you awesome bunch,
Fantastic news. We’ve started sending out the shipping address surveys today. You’ll receive an email from a company called CrowdOx. Inside, there’s a link that takes you to your pledge. All you need to do is enter the address you want the bag shipped to in January 2016. If you like, you can add an additional bag to your pledge for the same kickstarter offer.
The production run is going very well. The factory has just finished the cutting process, where all the patterns are cut from rolls of fabric. The next step is the sewing, which is already underway.

The zips have arrived.
It feels pretty great to type those words. They. Have. Arrived. Who knew it was possible to get this excited about zips! We think that it was worth the wait.
Now we can finally start talking about delivery dates.

Ahoy Team,
Check out some pictures of the golden sample. We’re all really happy with it and we can’t wait to see what you get up to on your first adventure!

That said, does anyone have recommendations for small, manual deflation/vacuum pumps? Something I can unobtrusively fit in the bag itself with minimal loss of useful space.

Joe- the shoulder straps are easier than they look at first. Check out this post: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1116395139/gobag-a-vacuum-compressible-carry-on-bag-for-any-a/posts/1347772. On the top side, you just put the entire strip of webbing (including the clip) through the metal loop, fold it over, and clip in the loop on the shoulder strap (optionally using the velcro to hold it in place). On the bottom, slide the clip through the smaller pieces of webbing on the very bottom of the bag (the bigger pieces are for the waistband). There are actually two layers of webbing there, but they're pretty tight, so it helps to pry them apart a little before sliding the clip through.

campaign.story:
Bronxton Wallets: Minimalistic, Functional, and Fashionable
Ever since the invention of paper money in the 1600s prompted the development of the wallet, men have been in search of a way to carry their essentials in slimmer, lightweight, but secure wallets. For four hundred years, wallet designers have strived to balance design, functionality, and sleekness. The invention of the credit card in the 1950s gave rise to the modern wallet with its multiple slots to carry cards. Until 1996, wallets remained unchanged until the development of the first evolutionary bi-fold wallet, which reduced the bulkiness of its predecessors by nearly half its size. Many wallets have numerous pockets that are great for storing necessary items, but can also allow people to accumulate a lot of junk very quickly.
Here at Bronxton Designs, we eliminate clunkiness by creating wallets that are minimalistic, fashionable and, most importantly, functional—and we do so in a range of styles. Our focus: design accessories that help you carry all daily essentials in true minimalist style. We develop two types of leather wallets: the “1222 Rule” wallets and the Stasher wallets. The 1222 Rule wallets carry the recommended essentials: one ID, two credit cards, two insurance cards (car and health), and two $20-dollar bills for emergencies. The Stasher wallets are for people who prefer or need to carry more than the essentials.
With all our wallets we never rush, taking time to carefully design each wallet with our vision in mind. Using only the best materials, our products are designed and handcrafted from beginning to end in Park City, Utah, under our control. We have been successfully funded three times on Kickstarter since we fired up in 2014. With the help of our backers, we were able to purchase all the tools required to produce our wallets. Having our own tools allows us to keep everything in house from design to fulfillment. To expand our brand with new product lines, we need more tools for the job. That’s where backers like you come in. Your pledges make it possible for us to get the equipment we need to grow our company with new, innovative products and to create and keep jobs in the United States.
 A Brief Understanding of Your Leather
When purchasing a wallet or any other leather article it is important to understand what you are paying for; many companies sell genuine leather for the price of full grain. We use the only leather good enough for our wallets: full grain leather. The leather we use comes from the best tannery in the world, Horween, which has supplied quality leather hides for over 110 years.
Full grain leather comes from the top layer of the hide, which has ALL of the grain, therefore, FULL grain. The natural surface of full grain leather burnishes and beautifies with use. Full-grain leather refers to hides that have not been sanded, buffed, or snuffed to remove imperfections or natural marks on the surface of the hide. This means each wallet will be naturally unique. No two wallets are alike! The grain remains, giving the fiber strength and durability. The grain also has breathability, resulting in less moisture from prolonged contact. Rather than wearing out, it will develop a patina over time. That means your wallet will wear beautifully and it will actually look better as it ages! This might be the last wallet you will ever need since it will last for many, many years to come.
Top grain leather, the second grade of leather, is a split from the top layer of blemished hide, then sanded and refinished. This is how manufacturers get rid of scars and scrapes and light cow brands. Top grain leather does not age nicely with use.
Genuine leather, the third grade of leather, is produced from the layers of hide that remain after the top is split off for the better grades. The surface is usually refinished (spray painted) to resemble a higher grade.
The tannery

Our Wallets: We have One for You 
We create all our wallets with careful design and craftsmanship; there’s one for you in our line-up. The 1222 Rule wallets include the Entry and the Prospect; the Stasher Wallets include the Briber, Tri-fold and Main Street.
The Entry
Even when filled with cards and cash, this wallet is so comfortable, that you won’t feel it in your front or back pocket. The Entry is perfect for going out at night, walking long distances, simplifying your life, and carrying the absolute bare minimum. Though The Entry is minimalistic and affordable, we kept the elegance and quality of well-designed wallet made with Horween leather.
The Entry
At $25 ($20 for early backers) The Entry is the most affordable, minimalistic, handcrafted, full grain leather wallet you’ll find. While we managed to make it very inexpensive, we did not cut any corners. The main difference from other wallets in our line is that The Entry is not hand-stitched; it is laser-cut, engraved, and machine sewn. Thanks to the backers of the previous project, we were able to buy a sewing machine!
Specs:
Full grain Horween leather.
Two card pockets. Each pocket stores up to 3 cards, for a total of 6 cards per wallet.
Cash slot (in between card pockets) stores up to 6 bills folded in half.
Optional Custom Engraving (add $10 to your reward).
Due to how minimalistic this wallet is, it is not offered with RFID protection.
Machine sewn.
Offered in Dark Brown and Black.
Measurements:
 2.25" High by 3.9" Wide
The Main Street
The Main Street wallet is made with leather and high-quality elastic. The elastic expands as needed while the leather keeps the wallet classy and elegant. The Main Street wallet offers 4 pockets: 2 front pockets, 1 middle pocket, and 1 elastic pocket. The front pockets are designed to hold ids and credit cards; the middle pocket is perfect for business cards, but can also be used for any cards or cash. The high quality, low-profile elastic pocket expands so it can hold from 1 to 10 cards.
The Main Street
Specs:
Full grain Horween leather.
Three card pockets. Each pocket stores up to 3 cards, plus some cash.
Elastic pocket holds 1 to 10 cards or anything else you can think of storing in there.
Optional Custom Engraving (add $10 to your reward).
Optional RFID Protection (add $10 to your reward).
Hand-stitched.
Offered in Black with Black or Red Stitching and Brown with Brown or Tan Stitching.
Measurements:
2.75" High by 3.9" Wide
The Tri-fold
The Tri-fold is not your grandpa’s wallet! While it has a traditional look, it is not old school! Similar to The Briber, the main advantage of The Tri-fold is that all your cards are fully protected inside the wallet.
The Tri-fold - Closed
The Tri-fold - Open
Traditional EMPTY Bi-fold vs. Bronxton's LOADED Tri-fold (as seen on the intro).
 Specs:
Full grain Horween leather.
Tri-fold.
Four pockets. Each pocket holds up to 3 cards, for a total of 12 cards per wallet.
ID Slot (stores up to 2 IDs).
Bronxton Signature Cash Strap (holds up to 12 bills folded in half).
Optional Custom Engraving (add $10 to your reward).
Optional RFID Protection (add $18 to your reward).
Hand-stitched.
Offered in Black with Black or Red Stitching and Brown with Brown or Tan Stitching.
Measurements:
Folded - 3.9" High by 3" Wide
Unfolded - 3.9" High by 8.6" Wide
The Prospect
The Prospect wallet was the first wallet we designed. We’ve sold a few hundred of these and received great feedback! We now offer the Prospect with the new logo!
The Prospect
Specs:
Full grain Horween leather.
Two card pockets. Each pocket stores up to 3 cards, for a total of 6 cards per wallet.
Bronxton Signature Cash Strap (holds up to 12 bills folded in half).
Optional Custom Engraving (add $10 to your reward).
Optional RFID Protection (add $10 to your reward).
Hands-stitched.
Offered in Black with Black or Red Stitching and Brown with Brown or Tan Stitching. 
Measurements:
2.75" High by 3.9" Wide
The Briber
The Briber was funded in our previous Kickstarter project. We’ve sold several hundred of the Briber and have not received a single complaint or suggestion to improve it. The feedback has been overwhelmingly positive. The Briber is a minimalistic bi-fold wallet made in vintage Americana style. The Briber at full capacity is skinnier than any of the other EMPTY bi-folds out there.
The Briber
The Briber: Open and Closed
 Specs:
Full grain Horween leather.
Bi-fold.
Four pockets. Each pocket holds up to 3 cards, for a total of 12 cards per wallet.
ID Slot (stores up to 2 IDs).
Bronxton Signature Cash Strap (holds up to 12 bills folded in half).
Optional Custom Engraving (add $10 to your reward).
Optional RFID Protection (add $15 to your reward).
Hand-stitched.
Offered in Black with Black or Red Stitching and Brown with Brown or Tan Stitching.
Measurements:
Folded - 3.9" High by 3" Wide
Unfolded - 3.9" High by 5.7" Wide
The Complete Family
The Complete Family
Color Options
Leather:
Currently we offer 2 choices of leather color:
1. Black
2. Dark Brown
Thread:
1. Black
2. Brown
3. Tan
4. Red
Thread options
Optional Add-ons
Engraving
We recommend that engraving be placed in the front/back right corner on the bottom of the wallet; however, during the survey process, you will be given the opportunity to add notes and can request a different placement for your engraving. The engraving size varies with the word or initials that you request; we will ensure that it is proportional with the size of the wallet.
Font Choices:
RFID Protection
What is it? Radio frequency identification (RFID) is a system that transmits the identity (in the form of a unique serial number) of an object or person wirelessly, using radio waves.
Almost all of our wallets now come with optional RFID protection! Most banks and credit card companies have been moving away from swipe card technology and issuing RFID-enabled cards and many places in Europe even have them embedded in personal identification documents.
The RFID Problem.
Unfortunately hackers and others use technologies that can pickpocket that information from you without ever touching your wallet! Sometimes from several yards away! To keep your information safe, our optional RFID protection is made with 2 layers of anti-RFID materials that ensure no access to the information stored in your credit cards and documents. And as you can see in the video it works every time!
  PLAY

Past and Current PR and Blog Coverage:
Bronxton Coasters – Unlocked!!!
Everyone with a pledge of $70 or more (before shipping for international backers) will receive a free pair of Bronxton coasters! If your pledge is $140 or more, you will receive 2 pairs of coasters, and so on. 
For those who pledge less than $70, we’ve got your back too! You can either bump up your pledge amount to $70 or add $14 to your pledge—whichever is less money for you. 
For those who simply want to support the project and what we stand for, there is a new $14 pledge to get the coasters. They will serve you well for many years to come and give your furniture a little extra protection while drinking in style.
The coaster manufacturing process: it takes nearly 4 thousand laser passes to make each one of the coasters. They are then dyed with a natural aging solution, left to dry under UV light, and then given 2 coats of clear satin to seal the coasters from moisture. Just like our wallets, the coasters are made in-house. 
The coasters will ship at the same time as your wallets, at no additional shipping cost. 
Bronxton Woodies - Unlocked!!!
Bronxton Woodies—We’ve kept this one under wraps. It’s something that we‘ve been working on for a long time. Like all our products, these sunglasses are handcrafted. We’ve been stress testing them for some time now, making all the necessary adjustments to ensure that, unlike other cheap wood sunglasses, these will not break easily. 
The Wolf Creek:
Made with two-tone Wood. Weighs only 0.9 oz (26g).
Measurements:
Lens Width: 54 mm  
Bridge Width: 21 mm
Lens Vertical (Frame Height): 49 mm
Frame Width: 140 mm  
Temple Length: 144 mm
The Deer Creek:
Made with Zebrawood. Weighs only 1oz (28g).
Measurements:
Lens Width: 54 mm
Bridge Width: 12 mm  
Lens Vertical (Frame Height): 49 mm
 Frame Width: 140 mm
Temple Length: 140 mm
Additional Features 
Unisex.
Handcrafted.
Designed with stainless steel spring hinges offering more comfort and flexibility. 
Come with grey polarized lenses that help reduce glare. Glare is caused when light from the sun is reflected off of water or a solid surface. By neutralizing glare, polarized lenses help you see objects more clearly, and also help reduce the harmful effects of UV light. Polarized lenses are especially beneficial if you practice water sports including boating, fishing, etc. 
400% UVA/UVB lens protection. 
Anti-scratch lens coat. 
Made with 3 custom wood layers for extra durability. 2 horizontal layers and 1 vertical layer in the middle. 
Carved from natural woods, so no two pairs are the same.
Hard paper case and microfiber cloth is included.
Come with one-year warranty against manufacturing defects, something that other vendors do not offer.
If you are already pledging for a wallet and would like the sunglasses as well, all you need to do is increase your pledge by $60! Bronxton woodies will ship in September, separately from the wallets, at no additional shipping cost to you. You will be able to choose the style during the survey process at the end of the project.
Anyone, who just wants the sunglasses, there is a special $75 reward for you!
Social media sharing contest
For all those who have shared our project already, we want to say thank you! We appreciate your support more than you can imagine, and we want to reward you! We are launching a contest that will award a $235 wallet kit to the person who has the most amount of shares and “likes” at the end of our project.
The rules are simple:
To participate, just share the link to our project (http://kck.st/1JOoDYM) on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Instagram, etc. Shares descriptions must contain the hashtags #Bronxton #Kickstarter “Likes” must be organic; they need to come from your own list of followers, friends or groups you might belong to. Submit a list of all of your shares between June 3 and June 5 to info@bronxton.com Winner will be announced on June 7th after all shares and likes are verified.
The Kit Includes:
1 Entry Wallet
1 Main Street
1 Prospect
1 Briber
1 Trifold
Colors will be assorted between Black and Brown.
What's next?
We’re developing multiple product lines, but to ensure our products meet our quality standards, we are releasing products in the order they have been created and properly tested. We hope to release another line of leather products within a few months, but we will not announce these product launches until the new products have passed our rigorous testing.
.
FEEDBACK
We value feedback, both positive and negative. Positive feedback gives us assurance that our processes are in place and our creativity is producing products that are wanted. Negative feedback gives us the chance to remain humble and improve in areas where we need to. Check out what people are saying about us and the quality of our products. Below is the link to our previous Kickstarter:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bronxtonvault/bronxton-minimalistic-horween-leather-wallets/comments
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If our entire team gets hit by the same garbage truck, we will not be able to deliver the pledges and you should apply for a refund! Nah, just kidding: we are all terrified of buses and trucks and stay as far away from them as possible. 
The only real risks are delays that may be caused if the tannery is out of our leather. It has not happened yet, but if it did, it would delay the project by almost four weeks. We stock a lot of leather in anticipation of projected production and order demands; so as soon as we obtain our project funding, off to work we go, crafting and shipping wallets.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,

We know it’s been a while and we wanted to give you all an update on our wallets! We’ve made hundreds of all of our high-quality leather wallets over the past few years and we are excited to show them off. Check out our cool video on how we continue to craft and create each wallet in house in Salt Lake City. We have loved your continuing support for our quality wallets and look forward to keeping you all updated with our new and exciting designs and products. You can look at all of our wallets and other Bronxton items on our .

Hey Guys,
Once again, we appreciate all of your questions, concerns, suggestions and comments, 87% of all pledges have already been shipped, as you know our humble goal of only 2k turned into a pleasant surprise of over $35k worth of pledges, we decided to push ourselves to our max limit and attempt to deliver all pledges within the timeframe originally requested.  We believe that if it wasn't for the 2 weeks down time due to a broken laser tube we feel that we would have made it by today, at this point we believe that we can have the entire project fulfilled by the 15th of September.
It's been a great project, fantastic challenge and we really appreciate your support and having faith in us, I read many comments of people who have already received their pledges and the comments are incredibly encouraging, but please, positive or negative, keep the comments coming, send us public comments or private messages and we will keep responding to all of you.

updates.update_userinfo: No News not always bad news :)
updates.update_content:
Hello Guys,
By popular demand, we are posting a quick update, we have been keeping our heads down working as fast as we can to process all pledges and addressing all messages individually and within the shortest amount of time we can possibly do, believe us when we say there is nothing more important to us than the support you gave us.
#1 question we receive is: When will my pledge ship? unfortunately there is no easy answer to that one question, we are a very small but dynamic team, we follow a process that rotates batches and we fulfill pledges as quickly as possible, so far we don't foresee any major delays, we had a problem with the early birds because of a laser tube that broke 2 thirds of the way into processing those early pledges, but they have been shipped 100%.

Hi Guys! 
Quick update for the early birds: we promised to ship all those early pledges by July 1. We have shipped almost all of them, but 2 weeks ago we had a set back. The tube of the laser cutter broke down. Even though we had all of the leather pre-cut for the early birds, some of you ordered more than 1 wallet and some wallets simply didn't pass the quality check. The production was stopped since we couldn't cut anything.

Hi guys,
Hope your week is going great! We just wanted to send a quick update on where we are at with the production. 
We have shipped 95% of brown entry early birds, some brown main streets and about half of tri-folds in both colors. We are working around the clock to get everything finished within the timeline we promised. So if you are an early bird backer and have not gotten the tracking number yet, you will get one in the next 12 days, we promise.

updates.update_userinfo: STATUS UPDATE AND SOCIAL MEDIA CONTEST WINNER
updates.update_content:
Guys,
Thank you for your patience on answering all the questions and announcing social media contest winner! We are dealing with a balancing act between manufacturing products to fulfill the pledges and answering all of your questions.
We were in Chicago, IL for a few days working with Horween Tannery. Thanks to John, who has been working in the tannery for 25 years, and has been going there since he was 5 years old because his dad was the CFO of the tannery, we always learn something new. After we handpicked additional leather needed for this project, we got some cool ideas and some new colors for the upcoming projects!

updates.update_userinfo: Social media sharing contest - Time to send us your shares! :)

Guys,
Only a few hours left! This has been such a great month! THANK YOU ALL for making our dream come true! Bronxton will be able to start producing belts after all the pledges of this project are fulfilled.
Just a quick reminder: Don't forget to upgrade your pledge to $70 (before shipping) or increase it by $14 if you would like to receive a pair of Bronxton Coasters! Interested in Bronxton Sunglasses? Just add $60 to your (wallet) pledge. Details are on the campaign page!

Remember, our ultimate goal is $32k and every share helps us to get the word out and get closer to that goal to start producing Bronxton belts that will last at least 25 years!
