campaign.story:
We want to THANK Richard and Lauren Hearn for their generous pledge of $7,000 to go to Haiti and deliver a box of SolarPuffs to the girls at the orphanage!!!! 
Lauren is Richard's 14 year old daughter who selected this pledge!!!Lauren!!!We are INSPIRED by YOU!!!
THANK YOU!!!! Richard and Lauren you are HUGE HEROS to us!!!!
        A little lantern with a HUGE impact.
Video by Fredric King of Fountainhead Transmedia, Fountainhead.com
The SolarPuff is the ideal product. It's a patent pending solar lantern that packs flat and easily pops open into a charming cube of light. Beautifully designed with Origami technology to appeal to everyone from the most discerning design conscious hipster to a hermit living in the hills.It's perfect for emergencies, camping, hiking, boating, around the pool, in the pool, as a night light, in your car... You get the picture, its uses are endless, and it makes for a fabulous house gift.  
Simply Put
Designed with sustainable and high-performance fabric specifically engineered for durability, flexibility and water resistance, and structured for adaptability and recyclability.
It's light weight, just 2.5 ounces.
It floats and can withstand complete immersion under water.
For as many hours as you charge it in the sun, it will provide light for just as long. For example, 5 hours of charging in the sun will provide illumination to light up a 10 X 10 room for 5-8  hours. Charge it for 8 hours and it will light for 8-12 hours.
It has a shelf life of over three years.
How It Works
SOLARPUFF how to Open and Close
PLAY

Add-On: Option
To add on to your pledge go to the top right of the page and under the green button, "You're a Backer", click the blue button "Manage" 
-If you add $25 to your pledge you can donate 1 SolarPuff to Nepal. 
-If you add $50 to your pledge, you can donate 2 SolarPuffs to Nepal.
We will send a survey at the end of the campaign, asking you to clarify what you want for your pledge. Just make sure what you want adds up properly, corresponding to the rewards listed.
  It's Different
Our  lantern distinguishes itself from other solar lanterns because of its modern flatpack pop-open design. The purpose of the SolarPuff's design component is fostering our belief in good design for all, in both the first world and third world countries. 
The SolarPuff looks stunning traversing poolside to camp side to Subsaharan huts. Our product is engineered to flatten and then pop open into a clean, beautiful, modern cube lamp which is a critical distinction for transforming poverty into dignity. 
This little light flat packs to 0.25 inches and can fit in any back pocket. It boasts 100 lumens and can fully charge in the sun in 8 hours lasting for 8-12 hours of light. If you only get to charge it for 5 hours, it’s ok, it will still last for 5-8 hours of light. 
The circuit contains a photovoltaic solar panel, 10 bright white LEDS and a lithium-ion polymer battery. Although the circuit is made in China, the special fabric of the expandable bladder which is the light disfusing element, is made in Connecticut. 
It is specifically engineered to withstand extreme outdoor environments. This product is revolutionizing the way we light our world. It is a formidable champion of beautiful, mobile, modern, and sustainable lighting, simply using the limitless renewable awesomeness of our sun.
AWARDS + PRESS
A Little History
Background
This light was first developed by Alice Min Soo Chun for emergency relief after the Haiti earthquake. In 2010, while teaching at Columbia University, Alice returned from Haiti and converted her architecture lab into an innovation center for disaster relief. Alice shared her years of research on integrating thin film substrates with photo voltaics and the idea of an inflatable solar light with the goal of creating sustainable solutions for disaster relief. The first prototype for the SolarPuff, along with all other inflatable solar lanterns currently on the market, were born in her lab.  Alice holds four patents for the inflatable solar lantern and solar light assembly.
Where we are Today 
It took quite a few prototypes to find the right fabric, best components and the unparalleled design.  We wanted to make sure the fabric was non-toxic (PVC free) to the environment and full recyclable. We finally produced the perfect combination this past summer (2014). 
In September 2014, we signed a licensing agreement with a distributor in Japan who received their first order for SolarPuffs in December 2014. All have sold and they are awaiting their next shipment.
In March 2015, we signed a distribution agreement with a Caribbean distributor and we are currently speaking with other distributors in India, Belgium, UK, Korea, Thailand, Tunisia, Nairobi, Singapore and Hong Kong for starters.
Who "WANTS" A SolarPuff?
This superior solar inflatable light is great for the home, gardens, pools, boating enthusiasts, camping, hiking, corporate premiums and military applications. It is also the most ideal lantern for emergency and disaster relief, due to its light weight and it's the most hygienic since there is no need to use your mouth to inflate.The light weight design makes for lower shipping costs and its foldability allows for dense packing of 80+ units per box. The high tech fabric creates a delightful dispersion of light. Every household on the earth would benefit from owning a SolarPuff. It's the perfect gift for everyone.
Who "NEEDS" A SolarPuff?
The IFC (International Finance Corporation) estimates that globally, over 1.6 billion people – possibly as high as 3 billion – are living without access to reliable electricity. 
 According to figures from the International Energy Agency, at least 20% of the planet's inhabitants are still without the simple luxury of a light switch.
So how do they light their homes and cook their food? They are using kerosene, wood, crop waste, charcoal, coal and dung. Worldwide, over 500 million households use kerosene, for lighting.
According to studies conducted by Dr. Evan Mills, founder of the Lumina Project, an initiative that promotes low-carbon alternatives to fuel-based lighting, "kerosene (or as he refers to it, "dirty lighting") consumes 77 billion liters of fuel worldwide, costing its predominantly impoverished end-users a total of $36 billion annually."Kerosene costs 25 to 30 percent of a family’s income — globally. The poor do not use kerosene because it is cheap — they are kept poor in significant part because they must rely on expensive, dirty kerosene. .
What We Want to Do  
With your help, we can revolutionize how people are lighting their homes. We want people to be prepared with a SolarPuff in their home for when the next Hurricane Katrina or Sandy hits and we want to provide clean sustainable lighting to those that need it most. 
Calculated from research, if everyone in the United States used a SolarPuff for one hour a day instead of a regular light bulb, it would save over 11 BILLION tons of CO2 emissions from going into the air each year!! 
In the United States 75% of the air pollution in urban areas is due to energy consumption from buildings. Solight Design wants to design and manufacture beautifully architected solar solutions that people will want in their homes and, at the same time, help eradicate pollution, poverty and excessive energy consumption!  
We don't want to stop there! We want to change the reliance on dirty fuels to light the homes of people living off the grid. Globally there are at least 1.6 billion people without reliable access to electricity. This lack of access to efficient energy becomes even more apparent in rural areas of developing countries where most lighting is fueled by kerosene, which is not only toxic but extremely expensive, creating a vicious cycle of poverty.
The HELIX vs PUFF:
Many of our supporters have been asking how the Helix and Puff are different. Well the Helix is a Twist and a little more compact than the SolarPuff. It is made from recyclable TPU, a thermoplastic that has a unique memory for shape retention. you can see in the video here that a slight push will start the deflation process in motion and it will remember to flat pack back to a square. Also the light is more uniform than the SolarPuff since the SolarPuff has more a a spectrum of light. The SolarPuff has a ziplock pouch for packaging and the Helix has a paper packaging. The SolarPuff  light diffuser is made from a Sail Cloth Fabric that is made in the USA and the Helix light diffuser material (TPU)is made in China. Hope this helps!
PLAY

Helix
Helix
SolarPuff packs into a Polygon
SolarPuff
Who Are We?
Alice Min Soo Chun and Stacy Kelly, Co-Founders
Alice Min Soo Chun is a Co-Founder and CEO of Solight Design and the inventor of the Solar Inflatable Light: SolarPuff. She is  Professor of Design and Material Culture at Parsons the New School and was the Director of the Materials Resource Lab. She was Adjunct Assistant Professor of Architecture at Columbia University and at the University of Pennsylvania. After many years of research in integrating solar photo voltaics with thin film substrates, she developed the first prototype for the solar inflatable light in 2009. When the Haiti earthquake happened, she turned her studio at Columbia University into an innovation studio for developing solutions to help Haiti, and then the application of the solar inflatable light became the Solarpuff. She has built award-winning community outreach projects; her work has been published in the New York Times, Architectural Record, Dwell, and The Journal of Architectural Education. Her book entitled GROUND RULES in Humanitarian Design, published with Wiley Press in 2015, is about design principles for the long-term sustainability.
Stacy Kelly is a Co-Founder and Chief Operating Officer of Solight Design. Stacy has the dual role of being responsible for managing the manufacturing and shipment of our products while also developing strategic business relationships. Solight Design is Stacy’s third entrepreneurial venture. She sold her first to American Health Magazine. In 2007, Stacy founded her second venture, Mobile Previews, a mash-up of mobile video streaming, SMS alerts, sharing and polling in one mobile application. In between start-ups Stacy worked as a publisher for some of the largest media companies in the world such as ABC, Disney, Reed Elsevier, Entrepreneur Media and Advanstar across a variety of markets and digital platforms, including. entertainment, toys and licensing. It was as publisher of Entrepreneur’s Business Start-Up that she realized that her real passion is in helping new businesses find their markets and build out their sales and business development strategies. Stacy received her MBA from San Francisco State University and her undergraduate degree from the University of Connecticut.
Alison Thompson is the First official Ambassador to the Haiti Ministry of Environment.  On September 11, 2001 Alison was a first responder at Ground Zero and volunteered there for nine months. In 2004, Alison flew to Sri Lanka after the Asian tsunami and remained for two years operating a field hospital and rebuilding a village. There she was named the Angel of Galle by the Sri Lankan people where she founded the first Community Tsunami Early-warning/Disaster Center in Sri Lanka. Alison helped manage a 65,000 person IDP camp and field hospital. Alison then Co-founded WeAdvance, an organization combating gender-based violence throughout Haiti. Alison created The Third Wave volunteer Disaster aid command center in The Rockaways, NY after the Hurricane Sandy disaster in New York, and another Third Wave chapter in the Philippines after Typhoon Haiyan. Her Random House book "The Third Wave" is about inspiring others to volunteer. In 2010, Alison was awarded the 'Order of Australia' by Australian Government and Queen Elizabeth II for her contribution to mankind. She was also awarded the 'Medal of Excellence' by US Army General Simeon Trombitas. Alison lectures on volunteering, women's rights and CSR via the American Program Bureau to colleges and corporations worldwide.
Why Kickstarter?
We need capital and your support to:
Scale inventory 
Lower COG
Build Infrastructure 
Build-out worldwide distribution
Marketing, advertising and PR
Bring the Helix from prototype to reality
Product development & research 
REWARDS
Just added to aid Nepal
Pledge $25 or more  
NEW NEPAL EARTHQUAKE RELIEF: GIVE ONE. To aid the Nepal people we've added a new reward. Give one (1) SolarPuff to Nepal Disaster Relief. Thank you. Estimated delivery: May 2015  
Pledge $50 or more  
NEW NEPAL EARTHQUAKE RELIEF: GET ONE, GIVE ONE. To aid the Nepal people we've added a new reward. Give one (1) to Nepal Disaster Relief and get one (1) for yourself. Do good, feel good. Thank you for your support. Estimated delivery: May 2015 Only ships to: Canada, United States, European Union  
Pledge $1,900 or more  Limited reward (2 left of 2) NEW NEPAL EARTHQUAKE RELIEF: GIVE ONE FULL BOX: To aid the Nepal people we've added a new reward. Give an entire box of SolarPuffs to Nepal Disaster Relief. You'll be sending useful aid to those that need it most right now. Estimated delivery: May 2015
(l to r) Origami star, SolarPuff, SolarHelix Prototype, Haiti
What's the difference between the SolarPuff and the SolarHelix?
The major difference between the two products is that the Helix is made of recyclable TPU which is a translucent ThermoPlastic and the SolarPuff is made of recyclable PET(Polyethylene terephthalate).
The other differences include: 
Light dispersion - The Helix disperses the light uniformly. Whereas the SolarPuff, has a spectrum of light dispersion and is prism-like as the light transfers through the high tech fabric material. 
Folding technology - Both use origami principles yet the Helix is a twist fold and pack motion. The SolarPuff has a pinch and fold motion. 
Costs  - TPU is less expensive and allows us to produce a economical version of the SolarPuff.
In all other components and functions, they are the same. They both float as the solar circuit is completely protected in a vacuumed sealed bladder. They both recycle. They charge the same and have the same lumenosity. They have equal lighting and will last just as long. And, finally, both have three settings, low, high and flash.
Check out the video at the top of the page to see how we demo the SoalrPuff vs the Helix,

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have the challenge of getting the SolarPuff into the market with as much vigor as possible. We need the capital to invest in larger orders, to drive down our overall COG, to build out our distribution network and for marketing and product development. Every light we sell at retail will help us to provide clean, sustainable and affordable lighting for those in need. 

Thus far we have sold all that we have manufactured. Your support will allow us to scale our inventory and to market and distribute the SolarPuff and the Helix worldwide.

Together we can make a huge difference.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'd like to add in again as well, the SolarPuff in MoMa's catalogue is not new and was brought up earlier in comments when a disgrunted backer flagged the creators online listing on MoMa. As I mentioned in that instance, SolarPuff is not a new product and as described, the campaign is for upgrading materials in SolarPuff for mass production. The original SolarPuff has been selling through MoMa since 2011. This is not the same product that is in the hands of backers that have and will be receiving them.

Sarah Walker's response is certainly articulate and thoughtful. On the subject of MoMa I can only speculate that if one were trying to launch a product, receiving an offer to having it sold - a marketing coup - would be irresistible. I can certainly understand why someone might feel some rancoeur upon seeing a creation at the MoMa store while pledgers are still waiting. If someone is able to raise capital through Kickstarter, and part of their project is to launch a successful business that doesn't make pledgers customers or shareholders. I certainly didn't intend to suggest that having a successful creation on kickstarter bestows some sort of transcendant virtue that renders all criticism petty. But the process of realizing goals belongs to the creator, and I find too much focus on criticizing timelines, missed targets, etc.Drains attention away from the opportunity projects represent.

I know people are nagging you about their puff not arriving. I just want a rough estimate when I should receive it in Australia? If you say end of September or even October that is fine, I just want to know the time when I should be concerned that something had gone wrong. No stress, I have electricity down here in Kangeroo country.
But, this has been a nice project for me, others maybe not so nice.

Humanitarian efforts and interesting product development were, indeed, the reasons I joined this campaign. Now I wonder if I primarily subsidized a later-stage marketing-outreach campaign. That's my concern. It's all essentially water under the bridge at this point. Glad to have an estimated ship date. Good luck with the remainder of this endeavor.

I understand peoples' frustration when they are expecting something and it doesn't arrive when they were hoping. But I think some have lost sight of the point of this project and its vision. The creators are not titans of manufacturing. They are not Apple or General Electric. They have no doubt experienced the usual challenges in managing factory orders, with everything ranging from quality control to environmental and labour standards. I didn't support this solely to "get my lanterns", but because I found it was a compelling and worthwhile project that deserved support from as many people as possible. Of course I'm looking forward to receiving one and using it the next time I go "off grid", and to giving one to my family to be amazed with, but honestly, aside from those who are really going far away to deliver pledges as part of humanitarian missions, we should chill and be grateful our support has born fruit - even if it turns out to be late fall or winter.

I guess that I am going to be one of the 'Scrooges', because I am disappointed about this also. I specifically bought these for a camping trip in July (and I barely have time to go camping even once a year), and now I'm not sure if I'll get any use out of them. And they would have been SO PERFECT for the trip, too. Charity should be voluntary, you shouldn't be forced to do it. You told us about the 4000 you already had in stock and you promised it to us as soon as the project ended. The way I see it, as soon as the project ended, we Kickstarter backers owned those units you had in stock, you were just holding them for us until you could ship them. Now, you have decided to donate OUR units, and COMPLETELY go back on your delivery promises without even asking us how we felt about it. So, we are being forced to donate our units to charities (in exchange for later deliveries) instead of giving us the option to do it willingly (and from the comments, A LOT of people would have done it willingly). The LEAST you could have done is have a poll to see if your backers would agree to do this before you just decided to do it on your own. I'm sure it's true that the people in Nepal need it now more than any of us, but that will still be true months from now when the next shipments come in. So if we are going to make sure that the needy get it first before the backers, we will NEVER get our pledges because there will ALWAYS be someone more needy (Nepal, the orphanage, the next natural disaster, etc.). I know that this will probably be one of the more unpopular comments, but before you flame me for being greedy and uncaring, just know that I added an extra $50 to my pledge just so that I could send 2 more units to Nepal than I was already sending because I actually do care. I just don't think it was right for the creators to make this decision without our input first.

Alice Min Soo Chun is colleague and dear friend of fifteen years. She is ingenious, generous and humble as a practitioner and as an educator. Unfortunately, in our culture, kindness and humility may be mistaken for weakness and preyed upon. I also know Andrea Sureshta and Anna Stork as they were students in a first year design studio that I taught at the Graduate School of Architecture at Columbia, and, I sat on the review of the Haiti studio when they presented large scale umbrella lights before Alice shifted the scale of the studio projects to smaller realizable designs. I am very disappointed in the way success has been sought at the expense of others and at the vindictiveness of Anna's campaign against Alice Chun. Andrea and Anna fit the model of the start-up and the focus on youth and ingenuity in design fields and the culture at large. Alice has been reluctant to tell her story as a single mother, as inventor, as designer at multiple scales, as an educator... Unfortunately, in the United States, the general populace seems to believe the "those who can't teach" ethos. As someone with a successful practice sustained simultaneously while a dedicated educator, I write to refute this. Architecture design problems require craft and uniquely reflect their creators. A well-crafted problem or program contains inherent possible solutions. Without the well-crafted problem and the nurturing of the instructor the design project as such would not be conceived. For a student to claim sole authorship of a design work in the contemporary design studio is not accurate in most cases. Further, instructors run the risk of having their ideas co-opted without credit should they share their work too freely. The situation in design studios is more complex and cooperative than is admitted. I am so happy to see Alice clarified the facts regarding her relationship as a patent holder of LuminAid and posted the patents. As a self-inflating structure, "SolarPuff & SolarHelix are a unique little lights" that were designed with a mission to help those in need and they are also beautiful well made objects. Based on how well this Kickstarter campaign has done despite slander, it seems the market and populace believe in the ability of these little lights to Power On.

Alice Min Soo Chun was one of my first professors in architecture nearly 20 years ago and she has been steadfast in her support of my career. I could not name of a more generous and talented design instructor and the product reflects those characteristics. I am so proud to support this project.
Keep up the good work and Good Works! We are both eager to get these and put them to use. Thanks a bunch.

Its rare to see an innovative idea being use to make the world a better place for all its inhabitants, while still respecting the planet we live on. I believe if your cause, and wish you nothing but success on your endeavors.

I was an intern of Alice's in 2009 whilst I was a student at Parsons, I also had her as a professor in the graduate program. Alice is one of the most brilliant, generous and giving professors I have ever had. As an intern, I helped Alice research and make prototypes using LEDs, and small solar panels, She taught me how to make simple circuits to connect the LEDs to a lithium battery and solar panels. During this time we made variations of small scaled origami forms made from high tech fabric to thin clear plastic sheets. One of the prototypes was an inflatable, others were origami shapes.This is a life changing product that is so beautifully designed. It resonates the ideals and values that she has instilled in many, including myself.
The backstory as played out in the comments made interesting reading. Is Alice is on the patent for luminaid as well since it was through the university?

As a student who participated in the course mentioned in the comments below, I feel the need to state what I remember. I have no recollection of an inflatable light as a research option presented at the onset of our class. I do remember the development and presentation of the idea by Anna and Andrea. It goes without saying that all of our projects were developed in collaboration with each other. This dynamic is at the heart of how we learned in school, and how we continue to work as professionals. The legitimacy of a professors role as a participant in the development of their students ideas is clear and unquestionable. The pursuance of those ideas apart from the students who developed them is not. I wish the best for everyone and hope that your hard work continues to benefit you and those whom you serve.

I was once a student of Alice's, (and later a collaborator and co-teacher) and I was a student in the studio Alice taught in which she claims to have asked students to work with inflatable lights - this never happened. Anna and Andrea began to develop the LuminAid from their own independent research, LuminAid was completely their design and Alice started presenting the idea of the SolarPuff as her own only after Anna and Andrea made it clear that they would continue to develop LuminAid beyond their initial work in the studio. Its unfortunate to see that this misrepresentation has continued and the SolarPuff is being passed off as something it is not - there is certainly room in the world for many great designers to be working on behalf of the public good - but this seems like a good old fashioned case of intellectual theft and crafty marketing. It should be fine for a teacher to admit being inspired by their students without having to rewrite history to claim influence for the work of others.

campaign.story:
+++ Gizmodo UK calls out Kickstarter´s most innovative campaigns - we are in the club! http://www.gizmodo.co.uk/2015/05/the-20-most-innovative-kickstarter-campaigns/ +++ BTW: We were within the first day campaigns of the Kickstarter Germany launch on 12th May 2015 and submitted our ready-made campaign (click here) already end of April. Here we go now! +++

The clou is inside.
This magnetic usb cable is the ideal design for mobile cable solutions. It´s perfect for your keyring, but the real invention is INSIDE the cable: This cable communicates with your charging source and allows your phone to be charged with up to 200% speed!
So if you depend on a working smartphone at any time, the USB ChargeDoubler is for you, because it is the world´s first charging cable which provides:
It allows to charge at highest possible speed from a computer usb port or other usb chargers. This means that your device will regularly be charged with full current of 1 A (1.000 mA) instead of 0.5 A (500 mA). Save 50% of your time and charge twice as fast as with a standard usb cable!
An “Always by your side” design
Tangle-free with a magnetic lock and its 2.35“ (6cm) overall length it is predistined to be carried on your keyring without compromising comfort while charging.
Protection of your private data
DataProtectedCharging (DPC) blocks data transfer while connected to a computer. This prevents data hacking and any risk of malware being loaded onto your device while charging from an unknown usb-socket or charging while being in a public network (e.g. wifi hot spot in a cafe, hotelroom, airport etc.).
Availibility and colours
The USB ChargeDoubler cable is available as:
• (1) Lightning™ compatible cable for Apple® iPhone®
• (2) microUSB compatible cable for Android™ and Windows Phone®
Colours: Please select from light blue, orange, lime green, pink and grey. Any cable type can be ordered in any colour listed! Just select your USB ChargeDoubler cable type. Your fave colour(s) can be selected after the campaign´s end! We will contact you concerning details.
If you have already a USB-C equipped computer as charging source, the USB ChargeDoubler cable is now also available as:
• USB-C to microUSB comp. cable for Android™ and Windows Phone® devices
• USB-C to Lightning™ compatible cable for Apple® iPhone® devices
Please choose the 16 EUR perk only!
Engineering and quality
The USB ChargeDoubler is well-engineered and doesn´t sacrifice reliability and function for bells and whistles. We have tested cable length and have carefully chosen exact 2.75" (7cm) between the plugs. The reason is simple: Whereas shorter cables compromise comfort and tend to break, this length effectively avoids the risk of cable break and makes it easy to use. The safe lock is equipped with strong custom-sintered neodym magnets.
The cable folds smooth as a teardrop.
Specifications at a glance
• charging acceleration with up to 200%
• portable (60mm effective length) through small & smart design
• data protected charging (DPC)
• magnetic lock with N50 neodym magnets for strong adhesion
• spray water safe
• plug & play (universal operation system support)
• works with every usb charger (also wall- & car chargers), power banks
• flexible 2.75" (7cm) cable avoids risk of breakage
• two pair 24AWG conductor for low resistance
Use every usb charger you like, or just your power bank.
How does it work
As soon as the USB ChargeDoubler cable is connected to your device and the charging source, both communicate via the cable´s internal circuit board and supply the maximum charging current. In contrast to standard usb cables, the USB ChargeDoubler cable demands full (and also compatible) charging current of about 1 A (1.000 mA) from your PC while denying to establish a data connection. Important for you: You don´t have to care about anything – just plug in and charge-up with double speed now.
1.07 A (USB ChargeDoubler) versus 0.43 A (standard usb cable)
Why do we need your support for this project?
The USB ChargeDoubler cable is manufactured from lots of custom-made components: N50 neodym magnets, circuit boards and mouldings for the connector housings - nothing comes from stock. To make it a viable product, we have to raise funds for initial costs and meet minimum order quantities for all components. Now we need your support to get the USB ChargeDoubler cable in the hands of energy-hungry smartphone users everywhere.
Please help us a to spread the word!
Fulfillment, shipping & insurance
Timetable
• mid of June: end of campaign
• till end of June: production of custom magnets and custom mouldings
• July: pre-production sampling, production & assembly of cable
• till mid of August: quality check in Germany
• mid till end of August: packaging and contributors shipment
Estimated world-wide delivery is August 2015.
Shipping & insurance
Valued friends, supporters & customers: We want everyone (including ourselves) to be happy with our USB ChargeDoubler and this campaign. As experience has shown, valuable goods often get lost or broken when shipped untracked and without insurance. For this reason we decided to offer most of our pledges including insurance and a basic tracking. We applied a lot of effort to offer you a fair and well-priced solution and included the expenses to absolute original costs. So these are terms of shipping:
Pledges marked with **:
Pledges includes free worldwide shipping WITH insurance and tracking. (Recommendation)
Pledges marked with *:
Pledges includes free worldwide shipping WITHOUT insurance and tracking on contributor´s risk. No replacement for lost or broken consignments.
Thank you.
Thanks for taking the time to look at our project. We really appreciate your support! If you should have any further question, don´t hesitate to contact us.
Kai & Jorg
USB ChargeDoubler:
200% power, 50% charging time, 10% volume.
Copyright notice Apple, iPhone and Lightning are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and in other countries. Android is a trademark of Google Inc. Windows Phone is either a registered trademark or trademark of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As soon as our campaign is successfully funded, we are going to make sure everything is happening according to our plan. The supply chain, manufacturing, operations and logistics are set up and ready to go. Although we do not see any direct risks or challenges, there might always be unforeseen tasks that may present itself during the process of production. We are committed to do everything in our power to deliver your USB ChargeDoubler cable on time and keep you informed about all processes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

And we are more than happy to have a crowd of backers by our side that was waiting much longer as expected on their reward without wishing us hell. Thank you all. Never thought to need that much time to get finished and we hope that our gift is a compensation for your patience.

Hi Nathan - like Fabian said, they have long gone. However, this has been a good lesson though on Kickstarter. As they say, this is not a pre-order site. There are literally no guarantees on the quality of what you get during the transaction, or that you get anything delivered at all. I went off and read some of the entries on Google under "kickstarter failures" - 9% of projects fail to deliver anything at all (according to Kickstarter themselves!). So the lesson to take away is this - never invest money in a project that you're not prepared to loose. It's a gamble. Although to better the odds, never invest in any team that doesn't have a background in production or evidence of previous successful projects. It's too easy for a team to sell a good idea but fail quickly once they get to the production stage. Maybe when they discover it's more complicated than a quick surf through alibaba.com. This project is a classic example.

It seems that this project was a bit beyond your capabilities. The money is not significant enough to spend time sending back cables and arguing about refunds - I expect this is the case for other backers. It's a pity the cables are not branded - it lends weight to the charge that you picked up some generic Chinese stock, as can be found online in several places (i.e. http://www.ebay.ca/itm/Short-Magnet-Sync-Micro-USB-Data-Charger-Cable-For-Android-Samsung-MOTO-iPhone-/361373955164?talgo=origal&tfrom=361373955164&tpos=unknow&ttype=price). Expecting German quality, I was disappointed with the result, they do not seem worth the price paid. There is leftover flash on the plastic pieces, these remnants from the plastic mould are usually removed on higher quality products. One friend had a small electrical shock when plugging in, which was worrying. Maybe static but odd to happen, and certainly had never happened with another cable. The cables do not fit into many cases. Finally - and rather damningly - these cables do not charge iPhones any faster than a normal and much cheaper option. Significantly misleading people on the key benefit. So in all, not a great buy for the backers, especially considering the timescales involved. As a lesson, you seem to have massively underestimated the audience on Kickstarter. Sure, we will pay more for a product but we do have high expectations, as you can see from the comments you are now receiving.

Beate oder bestimmt auch noch viel mehr ( ich habe nicht alle Kommentare durchgelesen, aber die haben mir schon gereicht ;) )- nicht umsonst heißen diese Firmen StartUps - hier wird nicht wie bei Amazon bestellt und am nächsten Tag geliefert, sondern die Entwickler hinter diesen Innovationen schlagen auch persönlich einen riskanten Weg ein, da es sich hier nicht um etablierte Firmen mit allem drum und dran handelt - da kann nun mal alles aus 1000 Gründen länger dauern oder schief gehen - und btw. wenn der Charger noch dieses Jahr geliefert werden sollte, wäre es bei mir das erste Mal, dass ich weniger als ein Jahr darauf gewartet habe (obwohl jede Firma ein shipping date innerhalb der nächsten 6 Monate voraus gesagt hatte). Aber eben genau dafür stehen wir doch alle da - investieren, abwarten, hoffen, dass alles gut läuft und sich letztendlich freuen, wenn dem so ist (für sich selbst und die Firma) - denn wenn die Produktion einmal läuft, durch unsere Vorabhilfe, dann brauchen die Nächsten nicht mehr so lange warten. Und ganz ehrlich, hier handelt es sich um ein paar Euro - nicht euer Ernst sich darüber aufzuregen, dass alles etwas länger dauert - ohne die Herren gäbe es so etwas in der Art bisweilen immer noch nicht...

campaign.story:
These are 8 stickers that you’ll be able to stick to any surface, like all Magnetic products. We hope you share our passion for this fun way of communicating! It doesn’t matter which reward you choose - we will put these stickers inside your package no matter what, as long as we reach $250.000 CAD goal. There are only several days left, so hurry up to spread the word to reach it quickly!
Statically Charged
Meet the Magnetic family: Magnetic Notes, Magnetic Pads, Magnetic Boards, and Magnetic Sheets. All Magnetic products are based on stable static charge, which lets them stick to any dry surface. Magnetic has no glue, so it's completely movable and replaceable. Enjoy visualizing your ideas, brainstorming in teams, and leaving messages. Now THAT'S a convenient and fun way to communicate!
Any Surface
Magnetic can stick to any dry surface, including wood, plastic, metal, leather, glass, textile, paper, and more. No glue means no traces. Magnetic is fully charged. It can even stick to the ceiling! 
Ideal Handwriting
Magnetic in not actually paper. It's better than paper. We created it with the idea of getting enjoyment out of writing on it. With Magnetic’s unique smooth surface, you will be amazed that your handwriting is more beautiful than ever, regardless of whether you use a pen, a pencil, or a marker.
Reusable Back
Magnetic can save you lots of money that you would otherwise spend on sticky notes. Not only can you stick Magnetic notes from either side, you can also write on the back with a marker, erase it, and write all over again! It's like always having an erasable surface with you.
The Magnetic Family
Magnetic Notes that come in 3 sizes in 9 different colors, including transparent and black for white markers
Magnetic Pads that are larger options for painting, classifieds, and many other office and home uses
Magnetic Boards that you can stick and write on with markers, erase, and write again.
Color Range
Magnetic Notes and Magnetic Pads come in 9 colors. We will ask you about your color preferences as soon as Magnetic is successfully funded.
Magnetic Standards
We’ve conducted hundreds of experiments to come up with the best product possible. We set strict quality standards and refuse to compromise on them. We love the environment, so we made all Magnetic products fully recyclable.
What Next?
Now we have peerless technology and perfected product. We want everyone in the world to be able to enjoy convenience of Magnetic. To do this, we need to set up cost-effective mass production, which will guarantee good prices and the best quality. But we can only do that with your support! We need about $30,000 CAD. We commit to pledge half of that by ourselves. For the other half, we invite you to participate in this awesome challenge. We'll be thrilled to have an army of backers behind us to help us write Magnetic's story.
Let's Make the World a Better Place
We want children in the poorest African schools to enjoy the comfort and convenience of whiteboards that they don’t currently have. So for every $1,000 we raise, we will be able to equip one school with 10 Magnetic reusable boards, 3 maps, erasers, and markers. This campaign will last throughout 2015, and we will post reports on it all over social media with the hashtag #AfricanEducation, as well as through updates to our backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been working really hard for several years to ready Magnetic for its broad public appearance. We have gone through all the stages of the production process, and we know exactly what issues are hidden under each step. Our senior engineer has more than 30 years of experience in the paper industry. We already have substantial experience manufacturing Magnetic on our small production line. All we need now is to scale it to mass production. However, as with any product, there are risks and challenges related to delays. Supply chain logistics can potentially impact product delivery. Additionally, delays may result from testing procedures. We will do our best to choose the best shipping option possible, but we cannot guarantee their fulfillment on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Crystal Wash is already something we are very proud of.  It is an amazingly efficient way to do laundry.  It is clinically demonstrated to be as effective as detergent and lasts up to 1000 washes!  Our goal now is Crystal Wash 2.0, the “connected” version, which will make it even easier to use than it is already and give you a set of tools & features that will help you do your laundry better.
These days everyone and everything is looking to “get connected” to make things easier, provide greater vision and insight into the task at hand.  We know that doing laundry is not exactly exciting, but lets face it… everyone has to do it!  Crystal Wash is something that works and the truth is we really can make doing laundry easier for you, save you money and be better for the environment.  We will give you a brief explanation of how the current version of Crystal Wash works and then we will get into the details of what we want to accomplish with our Patent Pending Crystal Wash 2.0…
Background on Crystal Wash
Crystal Wash is a proven technology that literately lasts for at least 1000 loads of laundry.  It uses the power of Bio Ceramics from the earth, which naturally clean your clothes as effectively as laundry detergent.  It is better for your skin and more gentle on your fabrics.  It is also better for the environment because it reduces contaminated waste water filtered back into the water supply, saves water by lowering required rinse cycles, and effectively reduces CO2 production by requiring less energy than a traditional detergent based wash.
These special Bio Ceramics were developed using various minerals with very effective antibacterial and anti-oxidant properties.
The pH level of laundry water impacts the wash greatly. If the water is overly acidic or alkaline it can damage delicate clothes and fabrics, cause colors to fade and cause clothing to still seem dirty even after washing.  Most detergents on the market are a pH level of 6.5 – 9, but they use chemicals to achieve these levels.
The key to Crystal Wash is the Bio Ceramics:
As the Bio Ceramics collect odors, dirt and waste from your laundry, they need to be ‘recharged’ in order to make sure the pH levels of the laundry water continue to be raised.   To recharge Crystal Wash you simply put them in the sun for an afternoon.  You only need to do this approximately every 30 days (or 30 laundry loads).  There is nothing else you need to do… Just a little sun and they will be just as effective as their first wash.   Lets face it, this process is simple but easily forgotten and if not done the effectiveness of Crystal Wash is decreased.  It would be nice, if there was a way to be reminded that it was time to recharge them.
By embedding a state-of-the-art pH water sensing chip and a micro-controller with Bluetooth capability inside the current Crystal Wash, we can give users accurate recharge alerts so that they don’t have to remember when it is time to put them in the sun.   And while we are at it – why not give users several other tools and features right on their smartphone that will help make doing laundry easier & more effective…
With the Patent Pending Crystal Wash 2.0 we will be able to illustrate the effectiveness of this great device and show the user the real time pH level of their wash.  We’ll be able to give the user recharge alerts, wash cycle tracking stats, wash complete alerts and many additional metrics and tools to help each Crystal Wash user become a “LaundryNista.”
  The Crystal Wash App Features:
Real-time Wash pH Levels
Recharge Alerts
Wash Complete Alerts
Wash Cycle Tracking Stats – Graphs, Counters, Social Sharing
Savings Tracking
Crystal Wash – Wash Cycle Counter – Time to order new Crystal Wash
Stain guide
Label decoder

  Our development process has gone through a few prototyping phases.  Our biggest issues were figuring out how to engineer a miniaturized version that would allow us to fit all the necessary components inside the current Crystal Wash form factor.  And how to create a module to best withstand the harsh environmental factors present inside a laundry machine... like water, shock, and temperature exposure.
Using some of the most current prototyping tools available we have made good progress after a few versions, but we still had some major obstacles to overcome.  Below are some pictures of the prototyping and miniaturization progress we have made.
Prototype v1 Addressed:
pH Reading & Calibration Control From Simple Mobile App
Electrode Sensitivity Testing & Protection
Enclosure Testing
Currently in the testing phase, our miniaturized prototype v2 is sending back pH data to a mobile device via Bluetooth and showing us first-hand the impact Crystal Wash has on laundry. We've developed an enclosure that is impact resistant. And have begun focusing on the temperature resistance aspect of the enclosure.  Addressing the rigors of a normal load of laundry gets us closer to a final module design then we ever were before. 
Prototype v2 Addressed:
Electrode Miniaturization
Prototyping Board Miniaturization & Simplification
Wash Basin Bluetooth Connectivity Testing
Waterproofing
Shock Resistance
The v2 submerge tests show successful waterproofing and connectivity and we now look forward to moving on to our final module development.
We reached a milestone in our R&D process when we realized we could potentially do away with the traditional electrode.  Building on the idea of “lab on a chip” and “micro-fluidics” we began to see the possibility of engineering our own solid-state sensor, which would allow us to miniaturize the electrode and effectively eliminate the need for calibration.  Our team went to work researching the feasibility of this and found some really great resources for how to use these cutting edge techniques to bring our idea to reality.
By engineering our own sensing chip we will be able to minimize calibration requirements, reduce power consumption, and come up with our own compact logic board all designed to fit within the Crystal Wash form factor.
The response at CES was huge... with interest from the press, to retailers, to investors, and distributors...
Our Next Steps: 
 We’ve come a long way.  We have a miniaturized prototype and are starting to get back real usable laundry data.  Now we need to refine the pH sensor design, work out our power consumption goals, build out the final mobile app.  We already have our manufacturing Vendor for the final product, but we still need to source our final vendors for the connected components.
We’re close but need your help to bring this exciting, innovative device to fruition.  Help us get there Kickstarter, lets all help the environment, save money and become LaundryNistas!
Laun·dry·ni·sta  /,lôndrēni-šta/ noun one who has mastered the art of laundry and has obtained a sense of “laundry enlightenment.” 
The Crystal Wash Team:
The Crystal Wash team has combined a unique selection of expertise. Pooling resources from engineering, marketing, software development, art, and design backgrounds the Crystal Wash team has the technical, design, and entrepreneurial savvy that has already brought the current version to the market.  We are capable and ready to bring this exciting and innovative Version 2.0 to market.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any new innovative project there are inherit risks and challenges...

With Crystal Wash 2.0 the biggest challenge was how do we engineer the components to be small, efficient and robust. Traditional pH electrodes are large, expensive, fragile, and require constant recalibration. We needed to address all the above mentioned electrode issues and make a cost effective module small enough to fit into a 105mm x 19mm form factor.

Supply and Logistics

Luckily we have already developed many of the necessary supply and logistic relationships required to bring the original Crystal Wash to market. For Crystal Wash 2.0 our biggest hurdle is making sure all the new "connected" components are sourced from the best and most reliable vendors. We only want consistent and on time delivery allowing us to reach our production goals and distribute rewards to our loyal backers.

We have established relationships with experienced manufacturers and fulfillment vendors and are confident we will be able to reach our goals. 

Through multiple prototypes we have come to a clear path of how to bring our vision to reality. We definitely see the light at the end of the tunnel. We are very close. Help us get there Kickstarter… We look forward to sharing this exciting project with all our backers and the great Kickstarter community. Thank you for being a part of the Crystal Wash 2.0 journey…
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
We're days away from being ready to launch the Crystal Wash app for Beta testing. In the next few days, the final rounds of Alpha testing will be complete and we'll be ready to move on to the next step - getting real feedback from you, our users!
We're planning to have Beta testing tracks for both Android and iOS.
Once our app has gone through the required Beta testing approval process for each platform, we will be able to invite users to download the app on their device and start testing.

Our last update was part 1 of our focus on the Crystal Wash app. We got a lot of great feed back and suggestions and are excited to share a bit more about our Crystal Wash app in the part 2 update.
It was a tight race, but version 2 of the design came out ahead by about a 3 to 2 lead. But all is not lost for those of you that liked the "lighter" colored design. We've listened to suggestions and comments and are happy to announce that we've added a few new features, one of which being the option to run the app in a dark (default) or light theme. You'll have the option to switch themes in the settings tab of the app.

Hi Backers!
Things are still whirling along over here at camp Crystal Wash.
We've made good progress with our app, but need your help to make the final decision on the UI and design.
Please check out the 2 versions below that we have been going back and forth on. Let us know, in the update comments section, which you like better.  Suggestions and any additional feature requests are always welcome.

updates.update_userinfo: Crystal Wash App Beta Testing Needed.
updates.update_content:
Hi Crystal Wash Backers!
It's been another busy month over here... we've been working to refine our concept design, moving forward with our app development, discussing connection protocol options with vendors, going over production schedules with our manufacturing partners and trying to find a little bit of time in-between to rest. Oh and we needed to find time to update you all too!

Most of Round #1 Rewards have Shipped.  And we're starting to get some great feedback from satisfied users.  Keep'm coming!   Hit us up on facebook or share your testimonial on our website!
We're still waiting on a few survey responses. If you have yet to respond to your survey please take a moment to do so, so we can make sure your rewards are sent out correctly and in a timely manor.

Hi Crystal Wash Backers!
First Round of Rewards are Going Out!

I just wanted to point out that when they say that Crystal Wash "shrinks water molecule clusters," it's a fancy way of say it's a surfactant, which means that it is "a substance that tends to reduce the surface tension of a liquid in which it is dissolved." That's basically what laundry detergent does so that water can soak your clothes more easily.

campaign.story:
The team at feoart and avooq set out to design a kitchen accessory that makes coffee making more convenient and fun.  Our creation, the Abacus Pod Rack, a wall mounted holder that conveniently stores and dispenses Nespresso coffee capsules.  As you may have guessed, the design was inspired by an abacus child's toy which evokes childhood memories of play and fun.  
The Abacus Pod Rack kitchen accessory is manufactured from an aluminium composite material with a strong plastic core and alluring powder coated aluminium exteriors.  Mount the Abacus Pod Rack inside cupboards, under cabinets and on splashbacks (mounts vertically and horizontally).
To install the Abacus simply remove it from its packaging, remove the label and the film from the adhesive strips.  Adhere the Abacus in your desired location by pressing the holder firmly against the mounting surface. The Abacus is 35cm in length, 20cm width and will hold up to 36 pods.  
Get in early to make the most of our specials
PLAY

 Follow us on
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The team at Feoart and Avooq have worked closely with a local fabrication shop to ensure that the products can be manufactured on time and on budget. The products have been prototyped by the same method that will be used to manufacture the final products which eliminates any uncertainties related to tooling, quality and the manufacturing process. With this in mind the risks are minimal
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to all our backers so far…Stretch Goal of 20K added.
Our Stretch goal of £20,000 will give us the opportunity to produce another colour option (As well as Sea Blue). Vote in comments section for your favourite  2 colours …. the most popular will then be produced and offered to all our backers to choose from at no extra charge.
Colour Options:
Bacrac development
During my 24 years in Osteopathic practice I have treated thousands of back pain sufferers with all types of problems and successfully designed/marketed several unique solutions.
One of the most significant factors in the outcome of a patients problem is exercise. If the correct exercises are performed well and frequently, the back problems become far easier to treat and far easier to prevent.
With this in mind, my colleagues and I set out to develop a simple prop to enhance the exercises we prescribe in our clinic here in the UK.
After many hours brainstorming we agreed on the need for a prop/support that would actively align, mobilize and decompress the joints of the lower back in a safe controlled form.
Countless props were designed, built and assembled in a variety of materials before being tested within the clinic by our understanding patients.
During the past 2 years, the original design has been continually altered by patient feedback and our clinical evaluation.
To date, our in house research & development has produced a highly effective back pain device that we intend to develop further by developing new sections for Bacrac users to add to the base model and so personalize and enhance the experience.
Bacrac components/assembly
 The modular design and simple assembly means that sections can be removed for smaller framed users, it takes a few seconds to undo the retainer and slide out the extra section.
PLAY

Bacrac use/protocol
Using Bacrac is easy. However to get the best from this remarkable device we suggest you use it as often as you can. If work, family, studies prevent you getting 5 minutes during a busy day, then use it after work when your back can really benefit.
PLAY

1. Simply place on the floor (preferably on a carpet or rug). 
2. Lay down next to bac rac. (You may find a small head cushion more comfortable). 
3. Draw both knees up, raise your pelvis and slide bac rac under your back with one hand. 
4. Lower onto the support and ease into position. (This may need minor re positioning up or down). 
5. After a few seconds of adjustment, slowly rock your knees from side to side. This movement only needs to be in the 10-2 range. Continue for 5 minutes then relax in position. 
6. Finish by rolling off either left or right. Move onto your hands and knees before bringing one leg through to stand upright.
N.B. Our Bacrac timeline has been edited to account for an unfortunate delay now resolved. 
N.B. Our Bacrac target has recently been revised from £25,000 to £15,000 to account for reduced tooling costs. 
Kicking it Forward
We'll commit 5% of profits towards getting future Kickstarter projects funded! Learn more about the Kicking it Forward initiative at; http://kickingitforward.org
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have taken advice from experts in design, engineering and materials to ensure the bac rac you receive is exactly the unique, highly effective device we intended.
Taking Bacrac from prototype phase to volume production may involve issues we met in building previous versions. So working with our highly skilled and experienced engineering company, any future challenges with tooling, pressure casting and material technology are minimized and will be confidently resolved.
Specifically the contact between PU and ABS components will be closely monitored in production, as easy assembly and handling is vital. 
Initially, to ensure quality and function we will assemble bac rac ourselves before fulfilling orders. 
We are motivated and well placed to complete the bac rac project on time, as promised, and surpass our backers expectations.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WE DID IT !! THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE SUPPORT GUYS !!!
------------------------------------------
The Perfect Sketchbook
(60 pages of Artist Grade 100% Cotton, watercolor paper) 
by Erwin lian & Bynd Artisan

The Story
Over the past 14 months or so, I have been traveling around the world and sketching... France, Germany, Spain, Italy, across Asia and the list continues to grow. The term "sketch-hunter", coined by Robert Henri, describes me best. I sketch almost daily, noting down everything from interesting people to the places I have visited. Whether it is in a moving subway cabin, a car, a bus or on a Tut-Tut, I sketch.
http://cherngzhi.tumblr.com/
me, my sketchbook and world travels

My passion has led me to try out numerous sketchbooks and I have tried using everything available in the market. With the need to perfect my watercolor sketches, I began to search for that perfect sketchbook. One that should be hardbound, compact, binds well, opens flat, and filled with  Artist Grade 100% cotton paper (makes it strong but pliable). Unfortunately, I couldn't find such a sketchbook out there... so, I decided to make one.
I went on and searched for quality sketchbooks manufacturers and discovered Bynd Artisan®; a premium leather and paper label in Singapore. The people behind this brand have been in the book-making business for more than 70 years, and were very receptive of my ideas on a sketchbook. They agreed to collaborate on this project, and their sincerity & earnestness to create the Perfect Sketchbook moved me beyond words.

The Perfect Sketchbook is a top-of-the-line sketchbook made with quality materials sourced from around the world.

Stay updated with our Facebook page:
https://www.facebook.com/theperfectsketchbook
_____________________________________________________________
      PLAY

photography by Erwin Lian
The ability to assess + establish correct values are two of the most important skills required in painting. Chroma inherits values and this is why many painters will first complete an under-painting (with only values) before applying chroma. Having a value chart with you, allows for you to place it against the subject to properly assess values.
Most artists hold their sketchbook in a certain way to keep it flat. The value chart was designed for ease of use for both left- and right-handed Artists. So if you are a left holder, you may flip to the left for the value chart and if you are a right holder, you may flip to the right for it. While this could be more user-friendly with a portrait- format book. The decision for a landscape-format was strictly based off reliable data which informs us that users who use a book of this size would prefer the landscape-format. Of course, given a chance in the future, I will release a series of different sizes and formats
Locating the right value with a value chart
You may be able to upgrade the existing value chart by punching holes on each step. As seen in the image above, I managed to pick the right value for the grass by hovering my value chart over it. Squinting your eyes helps a little with the assessment process. However, this would entail that your sketchbook be less aesthetically pleasing, and this is why The Perfect Sketchbook that you will receive will not come with these punched holes.
___________________________________________________________

GRAIN DIRECTION IN PAPER.
The Perfect Sketchbook requires up to 3 full sheets of watercolor paper. Why so many for such a small book? Well, that’s due to proper grain direction.  
Why paper grain is important?
If the grain is wrong, many undesirable things will happen:
1) The book will not open very well. 
2) The paper will crease and buckle (due to paper expansion) 3) Stress is put on the stitching and could even break it; 
An illustration to the utilization of paper with proper grain direction:
As there would be more paper wastage when we consider grain direction, I am working on possibly re-cutting the waste to create paper swatches that can be inserted into The Perfect Sketchbook's inner pocket. The Artist can make use of these inserts to test their colors prior to actual application. This suggestion has yet been finalized, and I will keep everyone updated.
Many sketchbook-makers may not consider the grain direction in order to reduce cost of production. However, this will result in poor quality.
                                                          Please note that Singapore-based backers will also enjoy the free shipping offered to America-based backers. Simply back the reward at the amount without international shipping charges. Free shipment is ONLY for Singapore and U.S. based backers. Thank You
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PLAY

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Team
Erwin Lian | Artist / Educator/ Designer
Me, sketching in the kingdom of Bhutan
My name is Erwin and I am an Artist from Singapore. I received my Bachelor of Fine Arts in Time-Based Media Studies from the Columbus College of Art (2004) and completed my Master of Arts in Design Development from The Ohio State University (2009).  I lecture at the Film Media Studies department in Ngee Ann Polytechnic, Singapore.

I travel extensively with my sketchbooks, recording the visages of the people who I meet, places I have been to and cultures that I have personally experienced. Through my craft, I hope to inspire and share the peace and joy I feel whenever I create and paint.
I painted all the paintings,shot all the photographs and did part of the computer animation featured in this kick starter project. The entire project was completed by me and two students, Jason Yong and Jacon Lim from DVFX, Ngee Ann Polytechnic

(www.cherngzhi.com)
BYND ARTISTAN | Partner & Manufacturer
The Goy Liang Book-Making Company had its first true home in 1945 when it was set up in a little shop house along Mohamed Sultan Road. It was a family-run business that served a genuine need and it gradually grew beyond the boundaries of Singapore and Malaysia.
Through the intervening years, the business of book-binding has moved inexorably with the progress of technology. Yet at its heart, each and every book had its beginning much like in the days of old - hand-designed and prototyped by a small band of craftsmen who grew up in the trade.
Bynd Artisan was conceptualized to celebrate the joy of traditional paper and leather making.  Bynd Artisan hopes to write its own history through the remarkable output of Singapore’s greatest practicing craftsmen.

The Company has manufacturing facilities both in Singapore & Malaysia.
(http://www.byndartisan.com)
Grandluxe is the parent company of the Label Bynd Artisan
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Estimated Time Schedule
The thicker the arrow = more funds goes there

This really is a project derived through an impulse based on personal need. Due to the requirement of new materials that was unavailable at the manufacturer, the cost of materials would be very high if I only made enough for personal consumption, so I decided to open up the availability of this pet project so that supporters may enjoy the same high quality that I personally demand while driving costs down for all of us. Kindly note that funds are subjected to 5% commission from Kickstarter and 5% from Amazon for credit card transaction fees. I have made most of the graphics and shot the photographs myself. The computer animation was completed with help from two students of mine (Jason & Jacob) and a stipend was paid to them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risk: 
1)Since this book is constructed with quality materials from all over the world, shipment may run into delays. Prices and availability of raw materials may also fluctuate. We have cushioned our budget with a modest amount to account for such events. In the event that raw materials have to be replaced, I will update everyone accordingly (very unlikely).

2) Bynd Artistan has more than 70 years of experience in book-making. I have visited their manufacturing facility and am confident that we can produce this sketchbook. I will update the manufacturing progress accordingly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backers,

I hope this email finds you well. Last year, we successfully launched The Perfect Sketchbook 2017 and they sold out within two weeks. For the past few months, I have received numerous requests to issue new sketchbooks. Knowing that I can’t turn The Perfect Sketchbook into a sustainable business, I reserved some books from 2017 and invited 20 prominent artists from our campaign to a group show. Dear Backers,

We received more than 450 orders within the past 24 hours and we are now left with just 443 copies of The Perfect Sketchbook B5 2017. If you missed our previous campaign, this is definitely a good time to secure your copy.

campaign.story:
Updates
Cable Length: Now you can choose between a 3 & 5 ft. cable for your MOS Reach! We'll ask which you want when we send out our survey at the end of the project.
45º Plug: In our pictures you'll notice a 90º power plug. We've upgraded the plug to a 45º so you can plug in two MOS Reach into adjacent power outlets.
 The MOS brand is all about creating elegant solutions to everyday problems. You’ve probably seen us here on Kickstarter—we brought you MOS, the Magnetic Organization System keeping cables within easy reach since 2012. We also brought you the pint-sized MOS Menos and the indomitable MOS Spring cable to help you reduce cable clutter and tidy up your life.
We’re excited to bring you the next labor of love in the MOS family...
What is Reach?
Basically, I live in a small room and I don’t have a single power outlet that isn’t hidden behind furniture. I have a lot of devices that require charging including my laptop, phone, Bluetooth speaker, power bank, and camera batteries. In the case of my laptop charger and camera batteries (things I need to take with me every day) I have to crawl under my desk or slide behind my nightstand to retrieve them.
My daily routine of plugging and unplugging helped me realize that the traditional wall outlet model was due for a redesign. While there are plenty of USB wall adapters on the market, none of them address the problem of power outlets being obstructed by furniture. First and foremost the power simply needed to be relocated to allow for easier access.
This allowed for power to reach ABOVE nightstands and desks and entertainment centers, the things that were causing me so much trouble, but the redesign didn’t stop there. I wanted to create a flexible power solution with multiple mounting options that could twist and bend and contort around any kind of furniture or obstruction and mount horizontally and vertically to get power EVERYWHERE.
Of course this would all be pointless if we didn’t give Reach the capacity to charge and power every kind of modern device: two USB ports with enough capacity to charge an iPad, as well as a three-prong power outlet for laptop and other tablet chargers.
I wanted to create a power solution with tastefully understated aesthetics so Reach could blend into its surroundings: an inconspicuous rectangle in both black and white to elegantly fit into any decor.
Finally, it wouldn’t be a true MOS product without magnets. By adding two super-powered neodymium magnets into the sides of the MOS Reach we could achieve the same organizational benefits of the MOS which keeps cables tidy, accessible, up off the ground, and ready for use.
 Each Reach comes with a pair of MOS cable ties so you can keep all your cables tidy, including the ones that are light on metal.
With this set of features in mind, we worked diligently to produce the product we had envisioned. There were bumps in the road that required a lot of attention. We had to do a lot of wrestling with our design in order to fit two 3.1 amp USB outlets, a three-prong 110 volt outlet, and magnets large and powerful enough to do the job. Persistence paid off in the end though, and our Reach prototype is as svelte as we could have hoped for while retaining all the functionality we initially imagined.
The cable also posed a challenge because we knew that we needed something much more flexible and attractive than the typical PVC commonly used. We vetted cable samples until we found a soft-touch TPE jacket that met our criteria. It definitely feels nicer than the more common options, but it also has some safety benefits which will help us secure UL certification for the Reach. This process is expensive, but it’s a corner we’re not willing to cut.
Because we like to obsess over materials, we went through a similar selection process to pick the ABS/Polycarbonate combination for the head—it’s a polymer most commonly used in the automobile industry, but we think it’s perfect for the Reach.
NOTE: The new design will now feature a 45º power plug instead of the 90º plug featured here, so you can easily plug in 2 MOS Reach into adjacent outlets.
Once we had the materials all locked down, we terminated the cable with a compact 90-degree plug (now a 45º power plug!) which gives the Reach a lot of leeway even in tight quarters. A lot of these choices were difficult to make, but it was worth the trouble to see our initial vision come to life.
Features:
Reach gives you easy access to power outlets that are otherwise obstructed by furniture—no more crawling under desks or shimmying behind dressers to charge your devices.
Reach has been designed to be as unobtrusive as possible and its compact size ensures that it’s never in the way whether you use it on your desk, your nightstand, or your wall.
Reach consolidates your power outlets and USB wall adapters into an attractive moveable all-in-one power solution.
Reach helps you cut down on cable clutter by making clever use of Neodymium magnets in conjunction with MOS cable ties to keep out-of-use cables out of the way until you need them.
Reach works well even in tight quarters thanks to its slim 45 degree angle power plug.
Reach is composed of premium materials so it looks and feels great.
Reach gives you a choice of two mounting options: AirStick microsuction tape lets you give your MOS Reach a semi-permanent home on any flat surface. Foam adhesive tape works great if you want to give your Reach a more permanent station horizontally or vertically. The Airstick™ microsuction tape can be cleaned with a damp cloth if it ever loses sticking power to bring it back to full strength.
Applications:
Office Desk
Home Desk
Nightstand for overnight device charging.
Bedpost/frame for convenient phone/tablet/laptop use.
Couch foot/frame or coffee table for convenient phone/tablet/laptop use or for game controller charging while playing.
Workbench/hackerspace for convenient power tool switching.
Craft/sewing bench
Entertainment center (Xbox One/PS4 controller charging station)
Reach is great for travel since it can convert any single outlet at your hotel or airport into a mobile charging station. Don't let anyone tell you otherwise.
Specs:
USB 5V 3.1A total charging power (2 ports)
1x 80-250V/15A power port
175 Joule Surge protection
Standard NEMA-5 compatible plug and receptacle for North American outlets
Head composed of a premium ABS/Polycarbonate compound
3-foot power cable with soft-touch TPE sheath
Comes in either White or Black
Don't Worry! We've got you covered. Included in the cost of international shipping we are including 2 region-specific power converters with each Reach. We'll get pictures of the power converters as soon as possible. We want everyone to enjoy the benefits of the Reach.
Wrap Up
Thanks for taking the time to read through our pitch. We’re confident that with your help we can add Reach to our growing line-up of clever solutions to everyday problems. As a quick recap, MOS Reach lets you tastefully relocate your power outlets to places that actually make sense: whether you affix Reach to your work desk, your nightstand, or your craft bench, you’ll always have easy access to a 3-prong outlet, to USB ports, and to the organizational benefit of powerful magnets. MOS Reach has helped us tidy up our work and living spaces—please back us so Reach can do the same for you. Please check out our reward tiers below. We’re sure you’ll enjoy using your Reach as much as we enjoyed creating it.
$100,000 – 45º Angle Plug & Longer Cable – UNLOCKED!
The addition of a 45º plug allows the Reach to be used in more places. For example, with the cable exiting the plug at a 45º angle, you can use two MOS Reach in one power outlet at the same time.
The longer cable will be an as-yet-to-be-determined length between 4-6 feet. We received a lot of good feedback from our backers that the 3 foot cable in the original design was too short for some applications. We'll let you know as soon as we decide the length of the cable. You can voice your opinion in our survey.
MOS Spring cables are the perfect accessory to the MOS Reach. At 3 feet long they make it easy to manage a charging station on your nighstand or desk when used with the MOS Reach. The MOS Spring cables feature anodized aluminum heads, metal spring strain relief to prevent shorts, and our Exoskeleton™ hyper-durable cable jacket.
All MOS Spring cables are covered by our lifetime warranty. If your MOS Spring cable fails for any reason just send it back and we'll give you a new one, no questions asked.
 Find out more about our popular MOS Spring Cables.
1. Pledge for a MOS Reach Reward tier. Add-ons are only available after backing for a MOS Reach.
2. Click the blue "Manage your Pledge" button at the top of the project. This button is only available after your initial pledge.
3. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total number of add-ons you'd like to add. For example, add $40 to your initial reward level for an additional Reach ($25) and Spring Lightning Cable ($15). 
You can change your pledge amount at any time to add as many Add-ons as you'd like. We will ask for which colors of Reach and which type of Spring cables you want after the completion of the project.
4. You then need to confirm your new pledge amount and you will be sent to Amazon to finalize the checkout process.
Production Schedule
This is our estimated production schedule. The longest part of the schedule will be the UL Certification, which we have been told can take 8 weeks to complete. We are hoping it is much faster.
Prototyping and Production
Handmade Prototypes
Handmade prototypes, foam models, and cable samples.
A nerd drawing early concepts.
Main Video and Sketchfab Rendering by Hector Caceres
Music: Scope by AudioTreats.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As you can probably see we’re really close to getting Reach out there to the masses. We learned a lot throughout the process of fulfilling our previous two projects, and you may have noticed that we like to see things through. We’ve already addressed a lot of the hairier challenges to get to this point. Aside from the general technical and logistical challenges of bringing a new product to market, we are faced with one main challenge: the expensive UL certification process. We’ve engineered Reach with safety and quality very much in mind at every step, so we’re confident that the certification process will reaffirm and reward our efforts.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
