campaign.story:
Kickstarter was just the beginning.
Our Kickstarter campaign may be over, but you can buy Stiicks on the Well Made website! We also have a lot of other wonderful products with many more to come, so be sure to stay in touch:
wearewellmade.com
Facebook
@wearewellmade on Instagram
Pinterest
Stiicks, a new way to think about quality framing.
Their minimal construction makes them perfect for any room.
So what exactly are... Stiicks?
Incredibly simple by design, even easier to install
Made by expert craftsmen in Chicago, IL
They use sustainable materials, sourced regionally and responsibly
Swap artwork easier than any frame out there
Made properly, to last forever
Stiicks are a patent-pending frame composed of 4 thin strips of sustainably-sourced American hardwood – No set of Stiicks will ever be made from a tree that was cut down for lumber. Each Stiick is embedded with several super-strong magnets that sandwich whatever you're hanging firmly in between.
Rare-earth magnets hold your artwork right where you want it.
Two of the four pieces come pre-drilled which makes mounting significantly easier, with a more stable result, than a traditional frame. In fact we recommend just putting a single screw in the wall and using your smart phone as a level.
Stiicks work smarter, not harder.
Simply center your artwork and drop the other Stiick into place.
Available in 4 Sizes and 5 Finishes.
We have designed Stiicks in four standard sizes, but the great thing about a floating magnetic frame is that they can fit literally dozens of sizes, at virtually any length, without batting an eye.
Small – 12" long, designed for 11"x14" prints
Sorta-Big – 17" long, designed for 16"x20" prints
Kinda-Big – 19" long, designed for 18"x24" prints
Large – 25" long, designed for 24"x36" prints
Pick your reward NOW, and your finish AFTER the campaign ends.
Cherry – An amber-red American hardwood.
Bright-White – Coated with 2 coats of premium paint before finishing.
Maple – Blonde in color, excellent in appearance.
Flat-Black – This finish also receives 2 coats of premium paint.
Oak – This tan colored hardwood is also the most common.
* Lacquer Finish * –Whether left natural or painted, each and every Stiick is finished with two coats of matte lacquer for a long-lasting and durable finish.
Shipping
Everything is in place for Stiicks to go directly into production the moment we meet our goal. Our first priority is to get the initial production run into the hands of our US backers with enough time to get them under the Christmas tree. Please read carefully as many of our Rewards have sold out for Christmas delivery, but all sizes are still available.
Early Bird Special – SOLD OUT
Small – January delivery available
Sorta-Big – January delivery available
Kinda-Big – Christmas delivery still available!
Large – Christmas delivery still available!
Buy1, Give1 – January delivery available
Full Set – Christmas delivery still available!
Collector Pack – January delivery available
ALL Rewards include US shipping.
Our Schedule
Monday, December 2nd at 11:59pm – Campaign ends the evening of Cyber Monday.
Tuesday, December 3rd – Backer Survey is sent out.
While we ask that Backers reply as quickly as possible, you will have 2 weeks to reply to your survey.
Monday, Decmber 16th – The initial round of rewards ships from Chicago, Illinois all around the world.
International Shipping – While we are committing to domestic delivery in time for Christmas Day, we cannot guarantee the same for international shipments. If you purchase one of the first 50 of any reward tiers and supply all necessary shipping information on time, your package will ship Monday, December 16th. International shipping is additional for ALL rewards levels.
About Well Made
We would love to share more about what we do, and why we do it, but why don't we head over the the Well Made website for that conversation.
Thank you for checking out our project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our largest challenge lies in fulfilling everyones rewards by the Christmas holiday. While production represents a significant task, we have confidence in our final product and have streamlined our production process. Which is why in order to ship rewards within a pretty tight window, we are asking that our supporters remain engaged and are prompt with their survey responses so we can deliver on time, potentially even a few days early.

In addition, Well Made is committed to using sustainable sourcing for its lumber, which can have a slightly more irregular availability than commercial lumber. However, we have several partners able to provide quality material on time while aligning with our ethical vision.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
First, thank you for all your support. Today marks the launch of our new campaign and latest product – Visible Vinyl

Hello you lovely Backers,
We've been hard at work to formally launch our second product, the Rackless key rack and we wanted to be sure you were invited to help support the campaign personally.
You can see the project here – magnetickeyrack.com
We created Rackless because of these little things called "Keystone habits". They're simple habits that influence other habits – like when you go to bed. We thought that if a key rack were simpler to use and more fun to interact with, we might make a habit of not losing our keys as often.

Hello everyone,
It's been several months since the end of our campaign, but I just wanted to take one last moment and thank everyone for their support. You helped launch a more responsible, longer-lasting vision of what a handmade product company can be. Thank you for that.
It is in that same vein that I wanted to let you know we have partnered with a really great team out of Europe as their official framer. We are proud to make you aware of the folks over at Awesome Maps for their new kidsmap Kickstarter campaign - the world's first (analogue) interactive world map for kids.

Good morning/afternoon,
I hope this finds you all well. This update does not apply to the vast majority of Backers, but for those of you who were promised holiday delivery and didn't get it, this update is specifically for you.
If you were promised holiday delivery and live in the US, your package was in fact shipped on time or ahead of time. We chose to give our shipping business to the USPS, but from the sound of things, it didn't matter who was chosen. The news is saying this shopping season started 9 days late, was 19% higher in volume and had 10% higher online sales. Combine that with bad weather in large regions of the country and several other factors and its no wonder a small percentage of you have not received your Stiicks.

updates.update_userinfo: USPS still catching up on shipments
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
I hope everyone is getting some much needed rest and relaxation with family and friends. We just wanted to post a quick update and let everyone know that if you were lucky enough to pick up a pair of Stiicks with holiday delivery, filled out your survey and live in the United States, your order has shipped! Our last shipment was this past Friday, December 20th and everything in that order shipped via USPS 2-day Priority.

updates.update_userinfo: 100% of domestic holiday rewards are in the mail
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, for those of you outside North America, this Thursday marks one of the United States' most beloved holidays. Thanksgiving. Its a time to relax, enjoy the company of loved ones and most importantly, give thanks.
One thing I am very thankful for this year is having your support as I lean into the winds of uncertainty to launch not only Stiicks, but the Well Made brand. I've received a LOT of emails asking about purchasing additional sets of Stiicks so as a thank you to you, the Backers, I've decided to offer each and every one of you first dibs on a pretty sweet deal.

campaign.story:
The Finex 12" Cast Iron Skillet is a long overdue redesign of a true American classic. 
WOW! Thanks to you, our backers, we have reached an amazing 800%+ of our goal! 
 The Finex team and I will strive to live up to the level of confidence you have shown for us and the product. 
 Please stay in contact by going to www.finexusa.com to continue to get information, and sign up for our newsletter. 
Again: THANK YOU! 
Mike Whitehead
                                                                       A NOTE to the media: A full press page (with full resolution images) is available at www.finexusa.com/press-resources
    Why did I start this?
I love cast iron skillets but the well-finished ones are commanding an outrageous premium on Ebay, and they still have the old-school integrated handles that are too hot, too flat, and too small to use effectively. 
You see, the newer skillets are just quickly cast and then tossed out for sale.  The insides (where the action happens!) are rough and build up a kind of gross burnt-food surface -- completely different than the wonderful carbon-based, inherently low-stick surface that a great cast iron skillet gains as it seasons.
You see, the inside of the newer cast iron skillets are NOT machined - they are left rough and rugged, which is a problem for serious cooks. They just don't release the food easily (leading to 'fractured foods'), nor do they allow that wonderful crispiness that forms on the bottom of skillet-cooked food to be picked up by a spatula and be transferred to your waiting plate. 
I decided that I needed to machine the inside of my skillets - despite the cost - because the surface finish on the skillet equaled the finish on the food.
Re-designing a classic can seem brash
I've completely re-worked the design. But, fear not! I've kept the best parts and then carefully added just the features that were really needed to upgrade this classic.  And, I got to use the best of current casting and machining technologies to really put it a 'step-above'!
Made in the Pacific Northwest
Sourcing locally:
One design goal for me was to source everything in the US and to keep the sources close to my home city of Portland, Oregon. 
This allowed me to use my existing sources of supply from my 'day job' (the ones I knew could, and would, perform well), and it let me keep a close eye on things and intervene with an on-site visit when needed (or when I wanted to watch industry-in-action!)
Portland is known as a design and food-lovers destination - perfect for this skillet!
It's really hard to not love food when living in Portland. We've had the highest ratio of restaurants to population for decades. And, we were one of the earliest places for startups in the micro-brewery industry.
Innovative Octagonal Shape
The octagonal shape lets you put the skillet on its side (like for drying it after washing) and it won't roll around like those 'other' skillets.
Plus, it gives 6 directions that you can pour from, because each 'corner' becomes a pour-spout - it's a little bit like magic.
Those flat sides also allow a spatula to slide in easily for getting under pancakes, fried eggs, etc.
Spring Handle for Cooling and Comfortable Grip
There are three problems with the old-style skillet handle:
They are too small
They are too thin for comfort
They stay hot too long
Finex has solved these problems!
The Finex spring handle harks back to the classic woodstove handles that kept us from burning our hands when stoking the fire. The spring design is both tried-and-true and brilliant.  
The spring handle has lots of air space so it cools quickly after being used in the oven or on a gas-burner stove-top.  
Plus, its naturally curved shape fits in your hand giving a secure and comfortable grip, which is important when pouring or moving it around the kitchen with food in it. 
And, of course: it looks great!
You'll see that the handle is heavy-duty - it's made from 1/4" diameter stainless steel. That makes it solid and easy to grab, yet open enough to cool quickly. 
The bronze end-cap is a signature part of the skillet. It will also put up with anything you can throw at it in a kitchen environment. Bronze melts at 1,742 °F so unless you cook like my friend Charles, you'll be fine. (just joking about Charles' cooking!) :-)

Here's a video of the prototyping prove-out run that we did at the spring house:
CNC Machined Smooth Interior
The inside of the FINEX Skillet will be CNC machined. What this means for you is the inside will be very smooth - this makes it naturally less-stick, and easier to clean.
Plus, it won't build up that scary-looking burnt-food 'ruggedness' that cheap import skillets grow over time - instead, it will season to a beautifully smooth carbonized surface that will cook like nothing else in the world.
This is what separates the great cast iron skillets from the 'cheap-os'. It adds cost and complexity to the manufacturing process but the results are stellar!
Manufacturing the Finex Skillet:
The Finex skillet will be cast using the oldest method around: SAND CASTING.  It may be the oldest method, but it's still the best for short-runs like this skillet! 
The first-article pour will be streamed LIVE!
Of course, over the last 2000+ years, sand-casting has improved dramatically, as have the alloys of cast iron. I'll be using one of the Northwest's premium sand-casting houses to pour these beauties, and I'll be on hand for the first pour, which we'll be streaming live as it happens. 
Here's a quick overview of how sand-casting is done:
First, the design must available in digital form. Since the skillet was designed in CAD, that's already done.  
Then, the CAD file is turned into toolpaths for a CNC vertical machining center to mill the pattern from a solid block of aluminum. 
UPDATE:
The Finex Skillet mold is being made from a polyurethane block that will then be embedded in an aluminum plate. Willamette Pattern chose to use the polyurethane board because it machines more easily and for the skillet it is a better choice.
Here's a video of the mold being machined on Nov 5, 2013:
After it is machined, the finished pattern mold is placed between two casting frames (called the flask, consisting of the the cope on top and the drag on bottom) and has the sand rammed in around it. The aluminum becomes the negative space that the molten cast iron is poured into.
Project Timeline:
The Finex Coaster - a 'Thank You!' for our supporters
With over 90 craft breweries in the Portland area, it's hard for us not to appreciate a great coaster, and cork is the classic material, just like cast iron is the classic material for skillets.
I offer these as a 'Thank you!' for supporting this project at $25.
 This cork coaster will be offered ONLY through Kickstarter for our backers.
YES!  All Finex skillets will be lightly pre-seasoned
Since launching the project many people have asked: "Will it be pre-seasoned?" The answer is "Yes!":
Your Finex skillet will arrive lightly seasoned and include instructions for maintaining or re-seasoning it at any time.
The Finex skillet is seasoned with nature's ultimate oil - organic flaxseed oil that is cold-pressed and unrefined. Flax seed oil is fantastic at creating a hard, slick surface on cast iron that is the essence of cast iron's naturally low-stick cooking surface.
If you burn something in your skillet or a guest scrubs it with steel wool and soap (yipes!) - DON'T WORRY. Just use a little extra oil the next time you use it. When the cooking surface is this smooth it really takes the mystery out of seasoning the surface - that's one of the reasons we will be CNC machining the inside!
How much will the Finex Skillet weigh?
This is another question we've been getting and it points out that the (all-too-common) cheap import skillets are heavy! 
Why? Because they use inferior alloys of cast iron, less fine-grained sand for casting, and don't machine the inside.
All of those bits of extra attention to detail and specifications will make the Finex Skillet weigh in at around 6 to 7 pounds vs. a 'cheapie' skillet at 8+ pounds.
We don't have exact numbers yet because the first round of actual cast iron casting will take place (with YOUR support!) in mid-November. But we can assure you that the Finex will be much easier to handle and work with on a regular basis than the cast iron skillets you can buy off the shelf currently.
We can tell you that the CAD system calculations say the skillet is right about 6.75 pounds and we've weighed the prototype spring handle at 1/2 pound, so that's a total of 7-1/4 pounds without the bronze knob at the end of the handle. 
That's comparable to the weight of the best old-style skillet ever made, the Griswold 12" (which has the problematic handle).  So, the Finex with that lusciously large handle will be a breeze to maneuver!
Is a lid being planned?
Yes! A Finex skillet lid is being planned and we will announce it sometime after the first of the year.
We are making absolutely SURE that we do a great job of supporting our backers on this skillet before we take on more projects! 
However... we are excited about the lid as the Finex 8-sided design allows the lid to out-baste our competition with it’s almost air tight fit and it doesn’t have any air gaps where traditional pour spouts leak steam. 
Many people have asked about it scratching a glass stove top...
Cast iron is absolutely wonderful on smooth top ranges (glass and inductive heat).
That said, you are working on glass so I recommend minimizing how much you drag, slide or drop any cookware on glass topped ranges.
 A little bit about the team behind the Finex Skillet:
David Lewin - Finex Industrial Designer
David Lewin
Mike Whitehead approached David Lewin (http://www.lewindesigns.com/) with a gift of probably the hardest challenge an industrial designer could ask for -- create the ultimate functional product, using natural materials and local labor. Something that will literally last forever. 
David undertook shaping the skillet with respect to the traditions, added skillful insights and empathy for the everyday user. The result is a skillet that is elegant, versatile and a practical contribution to chefs everywhere.
Thank you, David!
.
Kip Buck - Finex 3D modeler and drafter
Nike, Adidas, Keen, FILA, Lewin Design,Specialized, I Generator, ARIAT, Leupold are companies that Kip has had the pleasure to work with. Design, engineering, CAD, RHINO, RP are all in his quiver ready to be deployed at a moment's notice.
Now he's conquered the FINEX challenge!  
Kip can be contacted at bluewolves4@yahoo.com 
.
Aaron Draplin - logo designer for Finex
Aaron Draplin
Raised in the Michigan Northwoods, schooled at the Minneapolis College of Art and Design and currently hunkered down in the mighty Pacific Northwest, Aaron Draplin proudly rolls up his sleeves on projects related to Print, Identity, Web Development and Illustration. 
His client list includes: Coal Headwear, Union Binding Co., Field Notes, Richmond Fontaine, Nike, Wired, Timberline, Ford Motor Co., Viva Voce, Hutchco, Patagonia, Chunklet, Incase, Giro, Cobra Dogs, Burton Snowboards, Hughes Entertainment, Megafaun and even the Obama Administration, if you can believe that. 
He prides himself on a high level of craftsmanship and quality that keeps him up late into the wet Portland night. www.draplin.com/
.
Charles Waugh - Kickstarter guru for Finex Skillet
Charles Waugh
He's the guy that set up and ran the complete Finex Kickstarter campaign. Including buiidling this entire page - the videos (writing the script, doing the videography and editing, and voice-overs when needed), the graphics, the product photography and retouching, plus writing most of the copy on this page (including writing this entirely self-serving, but true, blurb).
As a fine art portrait photographer for over a decade, engineer, designer, sculptor, videographer, copywriter, calligrapher, and general maniac, Charles really does it all.  Having a portrait studio in Portland, a shop-to-die-for at his house, plus fine woodworking and design engineering in his background, Charles thinks sleep is highly over-rated.
This is Charles' third successful project on Kickstarter (www.woxom.com, www.simplepen.com), with two more in the works currently (keep your eyes peeled for them!)
Charles can be contacted at cw@charleswaugh.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been an engineering manager and product designer in Northwest industries like Boeing for decades. I have overseen projects in aerospace, consumer goods, and optics, so I understand how to design the product, select the vendors, and manage the process to generate the specified results. Of course while keeping it all on-time, on-spec, and within budget (plus having fun!)

As of the launch of this project, the CAD modeling is done, the 3D printed prototypes have been proven out, the prototype mold is soon to be machined, the spring house is selected and prototypes have been run, and the foundry is selected. The preliminary marketing is beginning to be put in place, and the packaging and sales support materials are shaping up.


The entire value stream has been carefully selected within the Northwest U.S., to keep things close to home, in the USA, and largely within my existing manufacturing relationships. I haven't just grabbed the lowest quote and hoped they might deliver - I know many of them, have worked with many of them before, and have visited and grilled the others to verify their credentials.

I've run the numbers of the business plan and we are right on track at this point: ready for a Kickstarter launch! 

SUMMARY: All that is left to get this skillet cooking is for you to tell us you agree with our vision by pledging to support the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We would like to give a HUGE thank you Everyone for all the support throughout this project!! Miss the Kickstarter Project? Its ok! Check out Hexflex.com and order yours today!
We have spent months developing the ultimate adventure tool to be carried with you on and off the beaten path. The Hexflex was originally designed to be a snowboarding multi-tool and that is still its key function. However, while carrying the prototypes around on our keychains, in our pockets, and attached to our back packs we found it is useful for so much more than just tightening bindings while on the slopes. 
The perfect combination of Design and Functionally
We have taken every aspect of the design, tools, size and weight into consideration while constructing our prototypes. This multi-tool was built with the user in mind. Compact. Portable. And a solid set of tools. These were the key points of our design. After many 3D prints and countless sketches later, we have decided on a final product. 
Inspired by Nature | Designed to last
Black Oxidized
Now all we need is you Kickstarter. 
The Hexflex Multi-tool features an incredible 15 tools in only 2.3 ounces and just over 2" in diameter, and this is just the first prototype. 
(Order: clockwise, outside to inside)
Flathead Screwdriver
#3 Phillips Screwdriver
#2 Phillips Screwdriver
4mm Allen Wrench
5mm Allen Wrench
6mm Allen Wrench
Box Cutter

Bottle Opener

9/16in End Wrench
15 tools and counting!
METRIC VERSION
(Order: clockwise, outside to inside)

Box Cutter

12mm End Wrench
14mm End Wrench
The unique snowflake shaped design of the Hexflex has allowed us to creatively use natures perfect shape to combine functionality and design in our compact multi-tool. This is a great addition to any keychain for its beauty and wide variety of tools it offers the user. 
The perfect addition to any keychain.
Paracord splice and Guy Line
Bottle Opener
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already contacted a well qualified machine shop to produce our tools and have been using them to obtain prototypes which we are very pleased with.
In the event that production quantities exceed their capacity we have a secondary facility which will aid in ensuring on-time delivery of the HexFlex tools.

 Of course there is always the chance of setbacks during production or shipping but we promise to work tirelessly until any problems are resolved. 

Also, we will continuously be providing updates to keep all our loyal backers informed of any problems that may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update on the Stainless Tools
updates.update_content:
The balance of the tools are en route to us in California.  We expect them to arrive on Thursday.  At this point we have shipped out all of the tools that we had on hand. (about 450 pcs)
Okay, back to printing shipping labels so that we can start sending out the remaining tools the moment we receive them.  We will be shipping out Thursday-Friday!
Thanks Guys! Happy Tuesday.  Please email hexflextool@gmail.com with any questions.

Hey Guys,
New Stainless tools have arrived!  We have just unpacked the tools and they are looking great! We have begun shipping out what we received today (150 tools) and will be receiving another shipment this week to send out.
Also wanted to post about the Black Oxide tools and the oily residue. This is the sealing agent for the black oxidation and unfortunately it was not completely washed off. We have since corrected the issue for future tools and have been getting them further washed before packaging. If you receive a tool with oil residue please wash off in the sink before using and this will eliminate the black oxide rubbing off. We have been doing this with the tools we have on hand and it has been working well. However, if you have a tool that is excessively coming off, please send us an email at hexflextool@gmail.com so we can remedy the situation. At this point all of our Metric and Standard rewards for the black oxidized have been mailed out.

Update- When we received the initial shipments of the tools a few weeks ago they were not up to par- there were some issues with the finishing. The tools are very functional as we had hoped; however the shape of the tool makes them difficult to polish. We are working to get back on track with our manufacturers to remedy the final steps of production so that the tools are what you all (and we) are expecting. Unfortunately, I am learning that until I have the tools in my hand and can give them the final ok, any projected shipping dates I give you are not dependable. I will know a lot more about the status of the stainless steel versions in the next week or so and will try to project a shipping date. I am very sorry for all of the delays.

updates.update_userinfo: HexFlex Tools are COMING! Are you Ready?
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
     
We are excited to announce that ALL tools have been cast and trimmed! And as of this post, About 1400 of the tools have been through the polishing process and are moving their way onto the final steps before shipping. These steps include acid wash and oxidation (for the Black Oxidized version). After this, they'll be ready to be placed in their individual shipping packages. We are then having them air freighted to us in Northern California so we can ship them out to you! WooHoo!

Happy Friday HexFlex Backers –
At this time all single Titanium rewards have been shipped. Please note: If you added a stainless or black oxidized version to your order, we are waiting to ship out the entire order together.
We’ve received new casted samples! These are the samples created after the changes to the tooling have been made and the are looking great! February 7th is one week away so we expect to receive the finalized versions of the metric and Black oxidized versions soon after. Then it’s onto the full-scale production, packaging assembly, and sending them our way so that we can ship them out to our Kickstarter backers.

Shipping update!
Titanium orders are currently being shipped out! You can expect to get your Titanium HexFlex in your mailbox soon. Please remember that international shipping can take a 2-4 weeks, but let us know in the comments section when you receive yours. We're still working on the Stainless Steel and Black Oxide tools but are looking forward to getting these out to our backers as soon as we can. IMPORTANT: We are shipping complete orders - if your order contains both a Titanium and Stainless Steel or Black Oxide tool, they will be shipped out once we have your entire order.

This update is in response to the many comments and thoughts about the previous update. We would like to start off by clarifying that we have not changed the manufacturing process, casting the tools was what we planned from the get-go. Casting is the best process for a tool of this type and price point. The Hexflex design cannot be done cost-efficiently through other methods such as cutting, milling, or water jetting. There are several steps involved that make it very labor intensive. 
Specifically, the center wrench and Phillips screw drivers are very difficult to create on a large scale production run. I’m not saying it cannot be done, but to fall within our $20 price point we opted for Stainless Steel Casting.

STANDARD VERSIONS and METRIC VERSIONS: MARCH 1
TITANIUM VERSIONS: FEB 15
T-SHIRTS and STICKERS: FEB 15
Information regarding the shipping updates: So how did we go from a Christmas delivery to these dates? I'll do my best to explain, as I am still trying to figure this out myself.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE: CHRISTMAS DELIVERY; A BIT OF BAD NEWS
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone.
To say that we have learned a lot is an understatement. It’s been 13 days since our last update and 31 days since the project was funded and we have experienced quite a bit. With this being our first time launching a product, we were a bit optimistic (to say the least) on our delivery times. I knew it would be a tight schedule to keep, and even planned for a few bumps along the way, but never expected that the delays and tweaks of launching a new product were so extensive and “typical”. I hoped I’d have this thing streamlined and ready to place under your tree a week ahead of time. I’m sorry to say that this will not be the case, and please believe me when I say that no one is more disappointed in this than myself.

Hello Kickstarters!
I hope you all had a great weekend! Unfortunately, this was a pivotal weekend for us as we learned of some issues that have come up with the manufacturing process.  We have rearranged our approach, but have not been able to overcome the setback against our biggest enemy- time.
Due to some minor issues with the tooling, we regret to inform our backers that the METRIC version of the HexFlex will be shipping a little later than the standard version. While we're crossing our fingers that we may be able to create some magic, most likely the METRIC HexFlex will not be in your stockings by Christmas.

"Phillips drivers have an intentional angle on the flanks and rounded corners so they will cam out of the slot before a power tool will twist off the screw head. The Pozidriv screws and drivers have straight sided flanks."

Just an update for the Posidriv instead of the Phillips. Most bindings on skis are european and use Posidriv screws. Car top carriers are either Torx or Posidriv, not phillips. The problem with using phillips head screwdrivers in these is that they will strip out more often than using a Posidriv. I am an avid skier and I cannot and WILL NOT use a phillips head screwdriver on my bindings. If this tool is being marketed for the snow-sports community, it would be more useful to have a Posidriv tip.
Just brilliant. The snowflake shape is genius!
I also like the idea Sam Ringwaldt presents. A molded plastic cover would help protect the pocket linings. I usually carry around so much tools'n stuff, the lining is the first to go.
It could then be stored in this essentially making it like a smooth disc in your pocket rather than a jagged metal snowflake.
Good luck with the project.

   The new minimalist leather wallets. With ShamRockWallets, you will experience the style, speed and comfort, all at an affordable price.
What is ShamRock Minimalist?
The ShamRock Minimalist is a modern leather wallet designed for a streamlined lifestyle. All ShamRockWallets are equipped to sleekly store our everyday cards and keep cash organized neatly.
The ShamRock Minimalist wallet barely weighs anything!!! ( .35g )
Genuine Leather
Shamrocks Wallets do not only feel soft but count on it's lasting leather durability. It's made with reinforced stitches for added wear protection and the pockets perfectly lined for smooth easy card storage.
Product Designs:  A design that is admired both for its beauty and for its functionality.
The Shamrock Minimalist offers three slots, two front exterior slots, one back exterior slot and hidden cash slot in the middle. The Minimalist external slots can hold up to 5 cards.
The Shamrock Slim offers three slots, two interior pocket slots, an interior pocket and an outside easy access slot for your preferred card and interior band to hold cash bills.
Thin from start to finish!  Dimensions: 10 cm X 7.3 cm X 0.4 cm
Upgrade your Shamrock Minimalist to include RFID protective coating within the lining of the Shamrock Minimalist ensuring your protection and security against RFID identity theft.
Dimensions: 10 cm X 7.3 cm X 0.4 cm
The Minimalist Style Options: Pick from five different styles, Glossy black, Black, Navy Blue, Brown,Tan.
So here is where you come in
Help Kickstart to success, we have been designing and crafting Shamrock wallets for a many months now and we finally have the perfect leather wallets. We are very fortunate in having a family heritage in manufacturing in the U.S, all we need to the go ahead from you. Your funding will go directly towards helping us satisfy the production costs, and to help us sort out other issues like brand packaging and product distribution & logistics. Additional funds will be put for property registration and ideas surrounding this project.
Thanks for taking the time to visit our page. We, at ShamrockWallets™ , look forward to making more unique wallets and products in the future.
We would appreciate your support and pledge that will help us launch ShamrockWallets™ .
The Minimalist: $14 will later retail for $17 (Early birds will receive minimalist at $12)
The Perfect Slim: $17 will later retail for $24.
The Shamrock Slim offers three slots, two interior pocket slots, an interior pocket, outside easy access slot for your preferred card and interior band to hold cash bills.
Upgrade your Shamrock Slim to include RFID protective coating within the lining of the Shamrock Slim ensuring your protection and security against RFID identity theft.

Join The Team:
This is where Kickstarter come in. We need your help to transform this idea into a reality and then transport it into your pockets. We are raising funding for manufacturing, packaging, and logistics.
Traditional wallets are too bulky Shamrock Wallets are slim & requires less effort from you than any other wallets.
The Shamrock Slim
Our goal is simple- To make better products and make people happy with our products. All Shamrock Wallets have been tested and used by our team.

 With or without easy thumb card withdraw.

The Passport Slim Travel Wallet enables you to keep all of your important documents, cards & cash in one place while fitting comfortably in your pocket.
Feel secure! No cards or cash will fall out in case of accidental wallet drop
The Minimalist Drop Test
The Shamrock slim stairs drop
 The Minimalist stairs drop
From a vision to reality: Prototype
It all started with an idea, a vision of how Shamrock Minimalist and Perfect Slim design should be. Before we made the cutting molds for the wallets, we first needed to put something together. That’s when we grabbed some tape and began to make our prototype wallet designs.
Production Plan
Production of the wallets will take 15-20 days from the day we give the final go ahead (for a minimum order quantity). That will give us 3-4 weeks to ship product to our backers at the beginning of December 2013.
With your support and backing, we expect to have the wallets in your hands by December, just in time for the holidays. Please share this link (http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1914225045/shamrockwalletstm-the-perfect-slim-leather-wallets) with any of your friends and family that might be frustrated with their current wallet situation; or better yet, gift them a Shamrock wallet.
Follow along and check out a graph of our Kickstarter's progress.
Press // Contact info@shamrockwallets.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The most basic risk and challenge if funded are making sure delivery is expedited and shipped when scheduled. Manufacturing is ready to start, production will begin immediately after project closes. Our team will personally be in charge of assembling and shipping all of the pledge rewards as soon as we reach our goal. Protocols are in place for expedited mass production. We will do our best and hope to have the wallets in your hands as soon as we can.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Congratulations!!! YOU did it! we have just reached our previous 40k milestone and successfully passed 2,290 backers!!
We are down to the final week, 4 DAYS LEFT! I hope all of you get to enjoy a nice and relaxing weekend. It has been a mind-blowing experience and we’re extremely overwhelmed to see how far this project has gone in such a short amount of time. I can't thank you all enough for the ongoing support. Without you, this project does not exist. I thank you for believing in this project and together, bringing life to the Shamrock wallets.

Hello Kickstarters,
CONGRATULATIONS! Not only did this campaign meet the 20k milestone and successfully passed 1,800 motivated backers!
We just reached 1000% funded! Absolutely phenomenal and great news!!!
I want to thank each and every one of you for not only supporting and believing in this campaign, but for going that extra mile to help spread project awareness. There is currently less than 2 weeks left in the campaign and we are approaching the next milestone of $. Can we hit ? With 15 days left, let's see how high we can get! Simply sharing this project on your some friends can make all the difference in the world!

updates.update_userinfo: The Shamrock Passport Slim RFID protection upgrade!
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters,
I hope everyone has had an amazing week so far!
Congratulations!!! as we have just reached a new 20k milestone and successfully passed 1300 backers!! What an amazing journey it's been up to this point. The response has been truly overwhelming. What an amazing campaign so far!

Hello Kickstarters,
Let's quickly start off by congratulating you all, as we have just reached $10,000 in pledges and unlocked our first Stretch Goal! What an amazing journey it's been up to this point. The response has been overwhelming. We are now adding the Shamrock Passport Slim is an ADDITIONAL option that can be purchased for a pledged of $24.
BACKERS: If you like to upgrade your pledge to include your Shamrock Passport please increase your pledge by $24 (Example: Shamrock Slim $17 plus $24 Shamrock Passport Slim.)

Hello Kickstarters,
Congratulations! We just reached 240% funded!
First off, we would like to thank everyone for there suggestions, requests, comments and support!
At your request we now announce:

Hello Kickstarters,
Success!
CONGRATULATIONS! Not only did this campaign meet it's goal within the first few days, but are currently 215% of goal. We want to hear from you! You guys are the only reason this project is possible and now you are apart of the team. Would you like to add RFID blocking to the minimalist? Have another idea? Have a recommendation? There are endless possibilities, let me know what you would like to see for a Stretch Goal by simply messaging me here on Kickstarter or emailing me directly at info@shamrockwallets.com

updates.update_userinfo: The Shamrock Slim RFID protection upgrade!
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters,
Happy Saturday! Hope everyone has a relaxing weekend! We have reached 165% of goal funded in just 5 days! Congratulating you all! Since we have reached our goal in such a short amount of time, many have asked about RFID blocking possibilities. I now announce The Shamrock Slim RFID protection upgrade!
We are now adding the Shamrock Slim (RFID blocking) is an ADDITIONAL option that can be purchased for a pledged of $22

You did it, Congratulations! What an amazing start to the campaign, the SHAMROCK wallets has been successfully funded in just 3 days! We cannot thank you enough for your support! This whole process has been an overwhelming experience and I couldn't be more excited.
Your referral continue to make way 58% of funds came from your amazing efforts at spreading the word. Thank you again!
Next Step?

Hello Backers,
What an amazing first day! Just a bit over 50% funded! We would like to thank all backers for giving this project a boost start to a successful campaign.
You support has been truly overwhelming. Just about 48% of funds have been from your referrals! Thank you for sharing this project. (Our short URL for easy sharing: http://kck.st/GHZPnM )

Hello,This is a message from Kickstarter’s Trust & Safety team. We’re writing to notify you that theShamrockWallets™ The Perfect Slim Leather Wallets project has been suspended, and your $17.00 USD pledge has been canceled. A review of the project uncovered evidence of one or more violations of Kickstarter's rules, which include:Offering purchased items and claiming to have made them yourselfPresenting someone else’s work as your ownMisrepresenting or failing to disclose relevant facts about the project or its creatorAccordingly, all funding has been stopped and backers will not be charged for their pledges. No further action is required on your part.We take the integrity of the Kickstarter system very seriously. We only suspend projects when we find strong evidence that they are misrepresenting themselves or otherwise violating the letter or spirit of Kickstarter's rules. As a policy, we do not offer comment on project suspensions beyond what is stated in this message.Regards, Kickstarter Trust & Safety

campaign.story:
A multi-purpose kitchen tool designed to mix, fold, sauté, and stir foods at any temperature.
We're out to create the perfect spatula. A spatula made from a single piece of silicone, heat resistant to 464°F, with weight and balance that make it easy to whip up a quick batch of pancakes, and fun to stir your grandma's spaghetti sauce for six hours on a Sunday afternoon. Nothing fancy here. No gimmicks. Just the best spatula you've ever used.
THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING CAMPAIGN!
This was a lot of fun - thanks for the support. We're wrapping up on Kickstarter, but the GIR Spatula is here to stay! Visit our website at productofgir.com to get your hands on the Spatula and keep track of the latest from GIR.
THE STORY BEHIND IT ALL
It started with a common spatula… or more accurately, with a drawer of spatulas. For a tool that's so simple it's nearly two-dimensional, but integral to any cook's toolkit, we felt let down by every model we put in our hands.
Wooden handles burned on the edge of the pan and warped in the dishwasher. Metal handles were hot to the touch. Detachable blades and superfluous nooks and crannies trapped oil and food particles, which made cleaning a chore. Some were floppy, others so inflexible they couldn't scrape a bowl. And anything but a silicone blade had us worried that we'd ruin nonstick pans or be eating plastic out of the skillet if we turned around for more than a few seconds. Out of a collection of over a dozen, not a single one "got it right."
We figured it was time for a change. So we designed a spatula that solved every one of those problems. Our small improvements to otherwise run-of-the-mill utensils have added up to an innovative, multi-purpose kitchen tool. And after several months of testing and prototype design, we're ready to rock and happy to introduce the patent-pending GIR Spatula: a single piece of molded silicone, heat resistant to 464°, easy to clean and easy to hold, flex- vs. structure-optimized.
CORE DESIGN HIGHLIGHTS & KEY BENEFITS
SAFE & HEAT RESISTANT
The Spatula does not get hot to the touch and it does not melt or burn: its heat resistant silicone withstands temperatures to 464°F (and you can deep freeze it to -40°F if you're in the mood).
AN INCREDIBLY VERSATILE KITCHEN TOOL
The heavy-duty silicone rubber and strong but flexible blade make it easy to maneuver food, liquid, dry mixes, wet batters... you name it. Suitable for containers of all sizes: bowls, pots, hot pans, and plates.
FOR HOME & PROFESSIONAL USE
We like to think of the Spatula as the ultimate kitchen tool, friendly and approachable enough for beginners at home, as well as super sanitary and multipurpose enough to serve as the go-to tool for experienced chefs at work. Lightweight but sturdy, non-slippery with a comfortable handle and grip, the Spatula was designed with both the occasional cook and seasoned chef in mind.
CLEANS THOROUGHLY & EASILY
The Spatula’s solid body construction doesn't trap food or oil particulates. It's quick and easy to clean by hand, so you can get right back to cooking. And of course, it's dishwasher safe. We put it through hundreds of cycles to make sure it didn't degrade or wear over time. And it performed just beautifully.
ECO-FRIENDLY & LONG-LASTING
Made of eco-friendly, non-toxic material, the Spatula is designed to spend a lifetime in your kitchen.
PATENT PENDING
The Spatula's novel design and construction make it a one-of-a-kind kitchen implement. So we can add another cool item to its highlight reel: Patent Pending.
WITH YOUR SUPPORT
We've come a long way. The Spatula graduated from idea to prototype, and now it's ready for the big time. We're gearing up to launch a full-scale manufacturing run, and we can't do it without your help.
So where are we now? We've:
- Finalized the Spatula's design, from handle to blade
- Tested a range of material combinations
- Built and tested five generations of silicone prototypes
- Tested a production run of units in every color
By supporting this effort, you'll be the first to get your hands on a game-changing spatula unlike any other.
We're on track to deliver the first batch to our Kickstarter backers by early December 2012. We think they belong in every kitchen in the world, starting with yours.
WHAT WILL YOURS LOOK LIKE?
We bet you have a drawer or bucket of subpar (or uninspiring) spatulas just like we did. If we may be so bold: throw them all away, and get the Ultimate Spatula. We wouldn't blame you if your next purchase was a trophy case.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We spent the better part of a year designing, developing, prototyping, testing, and beating up the GIR Spatula. If we were going to claim it as the "ultimate," it HAD to stand up to the wear and tear of daily use… as well as some more extreme treatment.

Here were some of the biggest challenges:
• Refining the design of the polymer core so that we'd hit the optimal flex level
• Selecting the appropriate food-grade silicone to use 
• Running test batches of silicone in each Pantone color until they looked right
• Testing each color's durability with 7+ hours in simmering tomato sauce 
• Finding a manufacturer willing to work with us to produce smaller prototype orders so that we could get our models in the kitchen and test them (and test them, and test them…) 
• Destroying almost every other spatula we owned to uncover any weaknesses we'd overlooked (RIP, stainless steel pan with melted plastic spatula all over it)

What we came up with was unique enough to merit an application to the USPTO. So our intrepid little spatula is Patent Pending.

We're really proud of the amount of design, brainpower, and cooking that have gone into this project. We've put up some real investment dollars of our own to get it to this stage, and nothing would be a better reward than seeing you (and your friends) try it out for yourselves. Who knows - it could be love at first sight.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New from GIR: Mini | Skinny | Pro
updates.update_content:
Our Kickstarter campaign just launched! Check it out at:
http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/productofgir/gir-spatula-mini-skinny-pro
We've got a full month to reach our funding goal of $50,000, and we'd love your support - even if that means simply sharing a link to the campaign with some friends and wishing us good luck.

updates.update_userinfo: Get ready... we're at it again.
updates.update_content:
Hi GIR Kickstarter backers!
We are launching something quite exciting this Thursday on Kickstarter at 12:00noon EDT. 
We'll send an email to all our supporters Thursday morning, but we wanted to share a preview before the rest of the universe finds out what we've been working on for the past few months. We've come a long way in the past year, and we hope you love what we've come up with. It may have something (okay, everything) to do with more spatulas, and we also have a lot of fun stuff in store for this campaign if we reach our funding goal with some time to spare. Thank you for your ongoing support and interest - it's been so cool to receive messages from backers who have been anticipating our next product launches, and we hope this makes everyone smile.

Over 90% of our Ultimate Spatula Kickstarter rewards have been mailed out!
Special Delivery
Hope you all have a blast using your spatulas and/or surprising family and friends for the holidays. This has been an amazingly fun campaign, and totally worth the December rush to get everything into your hands NOT fashionably late. We can't wait to hear what you all think. Please let us know, via comments, twitter @productofgir, facebook.com, email, snail mail, or high-fives if you see us all bundled up on the streets of NYC.

Now that the Thanksgiving rush is over (fun as it was), we wanted to send another update to keep everyone in the loop. We've moved on from stuffing turkeys to stuffing envelopes!
Here's where we're at (and it's really, really good):
Spatulas are stocked in the warehouse and ready to go.
Everything else we needed for shipping (from wristbands to labels and envelopes) is in our hands. Lots of moving parts, but they've come together very quickly. Go team!

campaign.story:
The Press Is Impressed!
Impress Coffee is a patent-pending design that helps you brew your perfect cup of coffee in just 3 minutes. The one-cup-at-a-time handcrafted brewing process (without paper filters, electric mechanisms, risky balancing acts or fussy coils and plungers) results in a clean, yet full-bodied cup that has captured all the flavor of the beans and nothing else.
The Impress Coffee design is almost complete. We just need to make a few final revisions from our last prototype, invest in tooling and get moving on a pilot run. To thank you for joining in on the fun and being one of the first people in the world to own an Impress, we'll throw in some incentives, like Impress Coffee brewers, delicious coffee beans - and stickers!! 
3 Easy Pieces - No Mechanical Plungers & No Mess!
The Impress is a 2-piece nested press with a to-go cup lid that brews a full-flavored great cup of coffee in 3 minutes or less. After placing fresh grounds in the outer cup and pouring in hot water, you let it brew to your taste—we suggest 3 minutes (our coffee experts have tested it and we agree). Then,  simply push the inner cup (reverse-flow filter inspired by the portafilter) all the way down, and clean full bodied coffee flows up into the vessel as the grounds get pushed down. That's it - you're done! Put a lid on it and go. The grounds stay at the bottom and out of your coffee until you are ready to pull the inner cup filter back out to clean it. The filter technology keeps the grounds from brewing any further after the coffee is pressed, so you only get the 3 minute brew you intended, even if the coffee stays put for a while longer!
Insulated Outer Vessel, Nesting Inner Filter, To-Go Lid
The Specs
• PIECES: double-walled outer cup, nesting inner cup with removable filter basket, to-go lid
• SIZE: 6" tall, 3.375" diameter (approximate)
• VOLUME: recommended 13 oz (max = 14 oz)
• MATERIALS: 304 Stainless Steel, food-grade Silicone
• MICRO-FILTER: 304 Stainless Steel, removable for washing
• CARE: Top-rack dishwasher safe
Hot Forever
The outer cup is double-walled stainless steel for maximum heat retention while remaining cool to the touch. Early testers have consistently been impressed by how long their coffee stays hot – many of them pour their coffee into their favorite mugs just so they can cool it off.
Insulated Outer Cup Keeps Coffee Hot
Micro-Filter
The inner stainless steel cup is designed as a reverse flow filter that is pressed down after the appropriate brewing time and nests inside the outer cup. It is inspired by the portafilter, so it allows you some flexibility with the grind size.
Tiny Filter Holes Inspired by the Portafilter
Clean & Full Flavored Coffee
The Impress is uniquely designed so that brewing stops completely once the inner and outer cups are fully nested. The tiny filter holes work well with any grind size, and the filter traps the grounds below the finished coffee so it can’t overbrew or let sediment in. No more overbrewed bitterness or muddy sediment of traditional press pots! With a stainless steel construction and filter, you can rest assured you will only be tasting the flavor of the coffee itself.
Take It To-Go
Because of the double-walled outer cup and nested inner cup, the Impress is a triple-insulated to-go vessel full of delicious coffee. Arrive at work and coffee is still as hot, clean and full flavored as when you left home. You might even decide to share some of your coffee with a co-worker. The Impress makes 14oz of coffee, enough for 2 people to share.
Drink Straight Out of the Vessel - Coffee Hot, Fingers Not.
Cleaning is Easy 
Because the Impress is made of simple parts rather than intricate coils, filters, mechanisms and plungers, the grounds and oils can't get trapped in little crevices. Just knock out the grounds and give a quick rinse to be ready for your next delicious cup.
The Idea
A few years ago, we found a bit of time to dive into the world of fine tea and explore the need for a good one-cup tea infuser. After a few years worth of tea times, we were able to bring The Teastick, a one-cup tea infuser, to market. We were simply floored, and humbled, at how well received the design was and how much people loved the simplicity, as well as the great cup of tea The Teastick infused. Since the day it was released, we have been asked if we could create a one-cup-at-a time coffee maker.
Of course, coffee and tea are very different, so a coffee product had to be a brand new concept. It took us a few more years after the Teastick to find the time to dedicate to coffee, but we LOVE coffee, so it was a sacrifice worth making.
Being very regular coffee drinkers, we naturally had a number of different coffee brewers at the office, from electric drip brewers to pour-over options to press pots, and various inventer-versions of all of the above. Although many of them made a nice cup of coffee, there was still something missing. Press pots are known to overbrew the coffee and get muddy as it sits there. They are also difficult to clean when finished. Pour-overs have to work with a different mug and need a paper filter. And most of the inventer versions just felt, well, too inventery. AND, none of them kept the coffee insulated or worked as a brewer and to-go vessel in one. These points became our design criteria. With the prototype of Impress Coffee, we now know (if we didn't before) that there's nothing better than a clean, full-flavored cup of piping hot coffee that stays clean, full-flavored and piping hot all day long.
Launching with Kickstarter
We are community-minded and community-driven people. To find an online tool that cultivates and grows our community is exciting and intriguing to us. We see Kickstarter as a great way to help us launch the Impress. If we are fortunate enough to realize our goal, we will quickly move forward with a pilot run of the Impress Coffee brewer. If we are even more fortunate and surpass our goal, we will increase our production quantity, add new colorways and patterns to the outer cup and get started on a multi-cup version. Please help us make the world a better coffee place one Impress at a time. Thank you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The major challenges of any pilot run of a product is finalizing the product and working with the manufacturer to make sure the production is as the design intended. Fortunately, we do this every day for our clients. Aly Khalifa, the owner of Gamil Design and designer of Impress Coffee, is not only a product designer, but an engineer as well, with 20+ years of experience working with factories on tooling, sampling and manufacturing. We have already determined an appropriate factory and have received prototypes and samples from them to prove that they are equipped to handle the job. We have also worked with client product launches as well as with our own product, The Teastick, to launch, process and fulfill orders at first adopter stage, regular every day times and media blitz bumps. We will be ready and excited to fulfill the awesome rewards from this kickstarter campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Seventh Generation Acquires the Impress Coffee Brewer and Teastick!
updates.update_content:
Hi Kickstarter friends!
We are excited to share the news that the business of Gamila Products, including the Impress Coffee Brewer and The Teastick, has been acquired by Seventh Generation, the nation’s leading brand of sustainable, non-toxic and renewable household and personal care solutions.
This acquisition is due, in large part, to the overwhelming support you all gave us through our Kickstarter launch just over a year-and-a-half ago. After reaching our initial funding goal within the first week, and ending the campaign at almost three-times that goal, the success of the Impress was immediate and exponential and is now sold throughout the United States and in 10 countries around the world.

This makes the best cup of coffee and I've sent a note to the inventors praising the thing but I wanted to post here on a few things I've found that might be helpful to others. First, you really do need to disassemble the filter portion to clean it. Some who are unhappy might find that the problem is the grounds and sediment gets caught in the filter threads and that might be the issue so always take the extra 30 seconds to unscrew the filter and clean it. If you still have a bitter taste, try some CLR for cleaning (but make sure you do a completely thorough cleaning after use). The CLR is what I've used in $9K commercial espresso and brewers for years and its always worked. As for burning your lip, well, the product was over-designed from an insulation standpoint which is a good thing but you need to exercise caution when dealing with boiling water. Lastly, boiling water for brewing is fine as long as you don't over boil (Time wise). Over boiling causes oxygen depletion in the water that will affect the taste. Just let it come to a gentle boil and stop, pour and enjoy. Mope this helps. I'm planning on ordering a bunch of these for holiday presents for family and business associates. Couldn't be happier.

One tip for cleaning the lid... lemon juice and hot water. It works as a really good grease-cutting agent to remove any potential manufacturing residues.

I have also not had any issues with grinds getting through the filter as some others have reported. My guess is that they have a high amount of fine dust with their grinds. I use a good burr grinder [conical] and get very little fine dust as a result. I won't say that I don't get any grinds/sediment through, as inevitably some dust does exist, but it seems to be less than with any other press I've used, and appears to be finer in consistency. I wouldn't say this is a fault with the Impress, but rather a side-effect of the brewing/filtering method. [the finer the filter the more you catch... so paper/fibre is going to work the best, but it's also messy and inconvenient] Unlike other presses, the advantage to the Impress design is that everything must pass through the filter to get into the drinking compartment. With conventional presses the grinds can slip around the sides, resulting in more, and larger, grit getting into your coffee. [unless you pour that last bit very carefully]

Just want to add my praise for the Impress. My major issue with the lid is not the positioning of the hole but the plasticy taste it adds to the coffee. Not sure whether it will improve over time, but it spoils an otherwise excellent cup of coffee.

I wouldn't suggest this mod to everyone, but if you consider the lid to be useless, you might want to give it a go. Just be sure to use a sharp blade, and keep it parallel to the back of the lid, so you only remove the baffle, and don't cut into the lid itself.
Reading all the positive comments below, I really wish that I also could write how pleased I am with my Impress Coffee Brewer. But unfortunately, I'm far too busy enjoying my delicious coffee :)
I love my Impress and co-workers want to know how to get one. Please let me know what to tell them.
Excellent product, makes very good coffee. Thanks.

A slightly smaller diameter would be good too, as it does not fit the cup-holders in my car. [as others have reported as well] I think it would be more comfortable in the hand too, if it was 1/4" - 1/2", or so, less in diameter.
Why not a titanium version that can be used over open fire as well....

Suggestion: The only thing that I would reconsider doing is the lid. I literally seared my upper lip the first time I took a sip (part of that is because it is so well insulated.....don't change that). There is something funky about the way the liquid comes out. I have pretty much resolved to just removing the lid when I drink.

Got my new Impress Coffee Brewer and absolutely LOVE it!!!! The best part is that I live across the street from a Dunkin Donuts where I USED to get my coffee from. USED TO! Who needs them when you have an Impress Coffee Brewer? The directions were very easy to follow, and I find that one level filter cup full of grounds gets me the results I'm looking for. Can't say enough good stuff about it. Thanks guys. You all rock!
I would also love a similarly styled 3-4 oz canister to put cream into, since I will usually put a few scoops of coffee in, and brew it once I get to work.
Thanks again Aly & Beth! Fun so far!
Will those orders be shipping soon?
Woohoo mine arrived today... can't wait to try it out! Looks awesome in black!!
Has anyone heard anything from project creators in regards to the lid?

In terms of timing, and build quality though, this is one of the best Kickstarter projects I've supported! Would love to pay for an "upgraded" lid. (Are replacement lids available for those of us who might pay to experiment on a few???)
I am surprised how the guys at Gamila Company have been drinking their coffee from the Impress without scalding their mouth.
I'm using the Impress for brewing green tea. It works great with loose-leaf teas.

What I did was stopped comparing the coffee made with an Impress to pour-over coffee. I can live with the knowledge that some small grounds are in my coffee given the convenience of the Impress. Have to drink with lid off though to avoid burning.

I notice a bit of grind left in the cup, but only because I see it when I'm done drinking the coffee. I do not feel it/taste it. I use a fairly medium grind, so I imagine it is merely some of the finer bits getting through. Can't get over the burning of the lip thing, though; not sure how this was missed in testing. I've given up and now simply transfer the coffee to another mug, which seems like a bit of a waste.
However I burn my lip due to the poor lid design and I get a lot of leftover grind within the cup(!). It does not matter how large the grind size is. I am very dissapointed.

I use quite a coarse grind, my second brew this morning had only a small amount of fine coffee dust at the bottom of the mug that I probably drank yesterday. Much better than my cafetiere. I'll keep experimenting. Maybe different roasts grind differently? Been using Taylor's rich Italian.

@Mike Manning: You mentioned no grounds in your coffee, absolutely none? I noticed my first cup of impress was cloudy so filtered it with a paper filter and was surprised how much grounds were in my drink. I then made several more cups, increasing the size of my grinds, but same results - grounds in my coffee. Hummm.

One question though: how does everyone grind their beans for the Impress? No matter how large my grinds are I always seem to get some coming through into my drink. Am I being too fussy? Do all metal filters have this issue?

Pleased to say I also received my Impress in the UK with no customs charges, though it had been opened. Thanks for putting the value at $20. A definite plus. I love how easy making the coffee is and no grounds in my drink. I though I would be able to drink without burning my lip...No such luck first sip ouch and resorted to taking the lid off. Coffee tasted great though. Was thinking if anyone had modified the lid to remove the bottom oval part of the drinking hole as I think this may help but don't want to write the lid off just yet. Also fits nicely in an Audi A4 cup holder but just a bit to big for a Subaru as mentioned in another post. Hopefully people will find a work around to the lid issue. Thanks
I would love to see a whole lid revamp.

Just to say that I am an international backer (UK) and I've just received the Impress. Sent via USPS so no tracking number (just in case you are waiting for one), customs value declared at $20 (so no additional charges). :-)

Received my Impress , makes really good coffee that stays hot a long time. I'm glad I supported your project. Like numerous other commenters, I'm sorry to say the Lid needs a major redesign, spout placement is awkward and silicone lid is a poor fit. It requires a bit of manoeuvring to place on cup, especially tricky trying not to spill hot contents or get burned lips while drinking. Perhaps mine is not made to spec. Like Michael C , I cannot recommend this product because of the lid design and poor functionality. Because the rest of the design is excellent, I have confidence that you will overcome this shortfall in the next version redesign.
Love everything about it except the hole placement on the lid.

When I opened the box and saw my impress I was really impressed by the level of finish and attention that had gone into the product presentation. The impress brews a great cup of coffee and I really like that the filter cup doubles as a measuring cup for ground beans. Unfortunately, I have the same problem as everybody else... The design of the cap means I have to actually create suction to get coffee to come out of the opening, which makes it come screaming out and burn my upper lip. The other main concern is that in my Subaru, which I always thought had cup holders that were too large, the impress only fits down about inch into the holder and wedges there. It's a matter of millimeters, but I feel like the diameter of the mug is maybe 3 mm too wide? It's truly a great product, but I'm finding myself brewing the coffee at home, using it as a travel thermos that I can't drink from during my commute, and then pouring the coffee into a ceramic mug at work so I can drink from it without incident...

For those who think their coffee is too hot, what you can do is to leave the lid ajar and let the coffee cool for 15-30 minutes, sip straight from the cup and if it's the right temperature, seal lid and enjoy.

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter project was a great success, but it ended on October 22, 2012. If you missed it but still want to donate to the Sacramento Taiko Dan, you can contribute online at our website: www.sactaiko.org.

Now that we've reached funding status, we can grow our repair order!! We're shooting for $12,000 now!  Help us take this project to the next level!
  Wow!  We reached our goal early, which means we can expand our project now.  Our initial goal was to repair the drums in the most critical shape, but there are many more that need repair.  Now that we are officially funded, any extra pledges will help us add more drums to our project. If we can raise $12,000 by the end of this pledge drive, we can add additional shime and chu daiko to our repair order.
  We have tons of rewards still available, like tee-shirts, bachi, workshop passes and many more.  Our pledge drive is open until October 22nd, so join us today.  We have an amazing team at the Sacramento Taiko Dan, and we want you to be part of it!  (As an added incentive, we're changing our $100 reward tier to include an optional tee-shirt with the bachi.  This is a great deal!  Make a $100 pledge before the drive ends!) 
  To everyone who has backed us already, we are extremely excited about getting funded!  An Odaiko-sized thank you to all of you!  We are beyond appreciative!  Thank you so much!
  Great Performances Depend On Great Drums
Since 1989, we at the Sacramento Taiko Dan have dedicated ourselves to bringing amazing taiko performances to the Sacramento area.  We take great pride in our shows, combining awe-inspiring drumming with carefully crafted movement to bring our fans an experience they will remember for years to come.  The Sacramento Taiko Dan performance drums are an integral part of this experience, providing the foundation from which Sacramento Taiko Dan shows are built from.  This fall, we are trying to raise money to repair these drums.  Properly maintaining these drums will help us continue the work we do and enable many more years of great performances.
The Sacramento Taiko Dan Performance Drums Are In Need Of Essential Repairs
Our goal with this fundraiser is to raise money for much needed repairs to our performance drums. Gradual wear from many years of use has begun to deteriorate the drum heads. Some of the skins have formed holes, and a few of our drums have been temporarily decommissioned until their skins can be properly replaced.
These drums are provided to us through the generous support of Asano Taiko in Japan. Based in Ishikawa Prefecture, Asano Taiko has been hand crafting beautiful, high quality drums since 1609, passing on their skill and knowledge from generation to generation. To honor Asano Taiko's support, properly maintaining these drums is our due responsibility.
If we meet our Kickstarter project goal this fall, you will help us pay to have staff from Asano Taiko replace the heads of these drums.  Sacramento Taiko Dan will host an Asano technician here in Sacramento while the repairs are made, (this option is less expensive than shipping our drums to their shop Japan).  Your contributions will also help us pay for the raw materials needed for the repairs, such as the tacks and skins prepared by the Asano Taiko shop.
Who We Are And What We Do
For the past 23 years, Sacramento Taiko Dan has been an important non-profit arts and cultural resource for the Sacramento metropolitan community.  Our mission is to study, preserve and promote traditional and contemporary styles of taiko drumming.  We seek to provide the people in the Sacramento area with opportunities for greater cultural awareness and understanding of this traditional Japanese art form through performances, classes, and public education programs.
Performances are the mainstay of Sacramento Taiko Dan.  We average sixty to eighty performances each year at cultural events throughout the Sacramento and Bay areas, including the Sacramento Pacific Rim Festival, the California State Fair, local Obon festivals and bazaars, art expositions, and many others.  We produce two major showcase concerts each year in Sacramento, and take part in the Annual International Taiko Festival each fall with the San Francisco Taiko Dojo. Our performance drums are an essential part of every one of these shows, (this is why these repairs are so important to us). 
Sacramento Taiko Dan also teaches classes year round for people interested in learning and playing taiko.  We provide youth and adult classes for all skill levels, from beginning to advanced.  Students learn traditional songs and rhythms, as well as basic music and performance skills, and develop self-discipline and confidence through learning to perform on stage.  
We also reach a few thousand local K-12 students each year through our Taiko In Schools outreach program.   With our Taiko In Schools program we bring highly interactive assembly programs to Sacramento area schools, where children learn about traditional Japanese culture and folk music.  This program is free to participating schools through our coordination with the California Arts Council’s Exemplary Arts program.
Your Help Today Is Important to Us
Like many other arts programs around the country, Sacramento Taiko Dan has been adversely affected by the recent events of the economic downturn.  In the past, Sacramento Taiko Dan has received critical grant support from the Sacramento Metropolitan Arts Commission and the California Arts Council.   In the last few years however, these organizations have been hit hard by the recession, and as a result our grant funding has diminished significantly.  This year we received only 18 percent of the funding we were awarded just three years ago. 
Despite this setback, Sacramento Taiko Dan is committed to continuing its work in the local arts and cultural communities.  We invite you to join us as we continue forward in our mission.  By contributing to this Kickstarter Project today, not only will you help Sacramento Taiko Dan pay for essential repairs to its performance drums, you will be backing an invaluable arts and cultural program in the Sacramento area.  We have many exciting rewards available for all levels of support, so please make your contribution today!
Domo Arigato!
Rewards Gallery
Below are selected images from our reward tiers. Please see all our rewards in the sidebar, and feel free to contact us if you have any questions!
$75 - 23rd Anniversary Tee-Shirt (Special yellow and black print for Kickstarter donors).
$25 - Any contributions for $25 and above will receive our sticker package.
