updates.update_content:
Hi Folks,
Sacramento Taiko Dan is holding their annual Summer Concert this Saturday, June 15th.  If you pledged on concert tickets last fall, your vouchers are good for this show! (You can use them for either this show or the 24th anniversary Concert in September).
Just present your vouchers at the door to get in.  Thanks again, and hope to see you there!

Hi everyone,
Just a quick announcement, Sacramento Taiko Dan is participating in the Arts Day of Giving event here in Sacramento today.  This fundraising event will last one day, (from 4:29am Monday morning until 4:29am Tuesday morning, PST), and donors can pledge money through the Arts Day of Giving website:
http://artsdayofgiving.kimbiaservices.com/npo/sacramento-taiko-dan
All the money that is pledged will be matched by Sacramento Metropolitan Arts Commission. They have $100,000 worth of matching funds that they will split based on how much each organization raises, so the more we earn, the more matched funds we get. Matching also means that if you donate today, your money will go a little farther than usual!

We are excited to announce that tee-shirts and bachi have begun shipping out.  Many of you may have received yours already!
For those of you who requested autographs on your bachi, a few of our members have been out of town for the holiday, but we expect to have everyone's packages shipped by the end of January. Otherwise, please let us know if you have any other problems with your gifts.
Once again, thank you all for you generous support!

Some of you should receive a little surprise in the mail this week.  We spent a full Friday afternoon after Thanksgiving packing up a big stack of stickers, thank you cards, concert tickets, and workshop passes.  These all went out Saturday, so keep an eye on your mailbox!
We have also put in our tee-shirt order for everyone who pledged on shirts.  Getting everyone's shirt size took longer than expected, but we're hoping to get them out in early December.  As soon as they come in, we'll be packing them up for shipping.  Bachi production are still on schedule for December.

updates.update_userinfo: We Are Successfully Funded. Thank you!
updates.update_content: Once again, a big thank you to all our backers!  We are incredibly humbled by the amazing amount of support we’ve received over the last six weeks. Thanks to your efforts, we have raised $11,340 that we can now put toward our repair project. Your generous contributions will extend the life of our drums for many more years to come, will help us further our dedication to performing arts and cultural diversity in our community, and will help us continue our mission for the preservation and development of the music we all love.  Thank you!

updates.update_userinfo: Please Share Our Project Before It Ends!
updates.update_content:
We are now into our final week of our fund drive and our cutoff date is Monday, October 22nd.  If you have time this week, we need your help encouraging others to pledge before our deadline.  Share our project on Facebook or send a friendly email out to your friends and family.  Your efforts this week will make a huge difference!
A number of people have also inquired about the possibility of getting both the tee-shirt and bachi together in one reward.  We know these are two great reward, so as an extra thank you we're updating the $100 tier to include a tee-shirt as well.  If you pledged on the tee-shirt, but were thinking about the bachi too, you can upgrade your pledge to $100 now, and get both.  (Kickstarter locks in the reward descriptions at the begining of the campaign, but this update will serve as official notice.)

updates.update_userinfo: You are all amazing! Thank you!
updates.update_content:
Whoa, did that just really happen? Yes, it did! We just got funded!  Wow, we don't even know what to say! We are absolutely blown away by all the support we've received in the last few weeks!  A gigantic thank you to all our backers!
  Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

We actually have three more weeks remaining in this fund drive, and we can keep collecting pledges through October 22nd. We have a number of additional drums we would like to add to our repair order, and any excess contributions will now go toward adding these drums. We have plenty of rewards available still, including concert tickets, tee-shirts, bachi, workshop passes and more, so please, if you know someone who hasn't contributed yet, encourage them to pledge and get themselves an awesome reward!

Once again, thank you to everyone who has backed us already!  We have an amazing set friends and family out there and we sincerely appreciate your incredible generosity.  You are awesome!  Thank you!

The Sacramento Taiko Dan

Wow! We were not expecting the amazing level of response we received here in just one week.  Thank you to everyone who pledged early.  Your generosity helped us exceed our weekly goal by three times and we are already past the halfway mark towards our final goal!   
We think there is a good chance that we will go over our funding goal now.  If that happens, we could have additional repair work done on some of our drums that we excluded from our initial project budget.  We have two odaikos and a number of shime daikos that could use attention as well.  Extra funding would help us add these drums into our work plan.  Help us get there!

campaign.story:
Top FAQ
- Why Pre-Order / Pledge?          - ... but I don't have an iPad/iPhone :(
- Airbridge vs AppleTV- Support iPhone5 & New iPad

"AirBridge out-streams AirPlay for impromptu iPhone sharing"
~ SlashGear
"file and screen sharing done right on your iOS device"
~ Mind Of The Geek
here is a bit of the future that has always seemed out of reach ... we are getting a little closer to that ideal thanks to AirBridge. ~ Mashable
"[AirBridge] doesn’t rely on cables, power sources, or special configurations to mirror content" ~ PadGadget
"airbridge marks the beginning of a new era ..." ~ BSG
The Missing Link
Imagine a world where you only have a limited time to setup a presentation. Imagine a world where you don’t have to send your files through the network-of-tubes that is the internet – imagine that you could just “give” the files to others, even if you just met them on the street. Imagine a world where you can do these things when there is no TV, no WiFi or no power outlet. We're here to solve these problems
Meet airbridge
This is airbridge. It’s a plug-n-play device that allows cordless iOS mirroring. In English, that means that when you snap the airbridge handheld piece to your iPhone or iPad, and plug the base station into a TV or projector – your screen will show exactly what’s happening on your device. No app or setting configuration. No networks. No power needed. No wires keeping you tethered to a screen. That simple. And you don’t even have to be giving a presentation to use airbridge – imagine killing pigs, chopping fruit, racing F1 cars, or creating content in your favorite app – all in Full HD, lossless sound, no lagging and on-the-go.
What if there is no TV or projector, or somebody in your audience wants to view your presentation on their device without having to squint or crane their neck? There’s an app for that. airbridge devices can stream your presentation over WiFi (AirBridge Pro will even make one when there’s none) to other iOS devices, with or without a screen connected. App users can take a snapshot and write out some notes if they want to, and store those snapshots for later review; or even record the presentation to a video file. Pretty handy, huh?
Want to share a worksheet or data file to go along with your presentation? That app we just talked about also does that, without even needing the device. The app will detect who is close by, and you can just drag a file to the face of the person you want to give it to. Or if you want to give it to multiple people, just drag it to the “dropzone.” It's as easy as that. You don’t even have to be connected to the same network to share files.
Want to dig deeper? Check out the following FAQs:
Who is airbridge for?
What are the in-depth features of airbridge?
Just the Facts
If we get funded, and barring a zombie apocalypse, we’ll be offering two editions of airbridge: airbridge Pro, and airbridge Lite for iOS devices. Both editions will be made for people who want things to simply work. airbridge Pro is the complete version of our innovation. It’s made for everyone, including professional users and serious presenters. Airbridge Lite has one feature less (it does not group broadcast) than the Pro and is made for everyday casual users. Check out this FAQ for a full breakdown between Pro & Lite - airbridge Pro vs airbridge Lite
The Dream & The Passion
Our dream: We want technology to play effortlessly well with other technology. We want it to act like a silent servant – reliable, durable, and making lives easier, and in a way that's not frustrating, unnecessarily difficult or complicated to use.
Our passion: We want to help our local economy by creating jobs in the US. Airbridge will be produced in the US, and put food on families’ tables. We want to be a pioneer in local economic growth by starting a movement that will help rejuvenate other nations by inspiring other innovators and entrepreneurs to step up and step out and make a like difference in their countries. If curious, see FAQ - How and where will airbridge be made?
We need you
------------ Magnetized cover for seamless closing and easy carrying ------------
In order to see our dream and passion come into reality we need you. Though we have prototypes built, we want to make the final version sleeker looking and more compact. Additionally, in order to complete the development and make the project production ready, we still need to finish app development, work out fabrication, design circuit boards for the final product, perform final testing, etc. Sounds like a mouth full, but all these things can be done in a matter of 4 months or less. Yet, without financial backing, none of these things can happen.
Like our dream and passion? Awesome. We love you. But we’d love you more if you helped our dream and passion become a reality by sharing this kickstarter campaign with your social network and funding our project. Considering getting an airbridge for yourself? Pick one up now before anybody else.
Pioneer Your World
The Pioneer Your World t-shirt and wristband rewards are more than just a fashion statement. It’s a call to all who want to impact the world around them. We want you to confidently and boldly pioneer your life in a direction that you never thought possible. Are you a designer? Use these to encourage yourself to pioneer new and inventive ideas that change the world around you. Are you a teacher? Use these to encourage yourself to lead your students into new ground. Are you a businessperson? Use these to … well, you get the idea. So snag a t-shirt or wristband and start affecting positive change – you pioneer, you.
Meet the Team
Artifex Touch is a team of passionate, visionary, and experienced developers, designers, and entrepreneurs whose dream is to change the world through innovation. We have a varied skill set and experienced group of people onboard, including 20+ years in I.T. and software development, 15+ years of design, branding, and marketing, 10+ years of business administration with multi-million dollar companies, etc. One of our team members is also currently the I.T. director of an Inc. 5000 business.

campaign.story:
IF YOU ARE MAKING A PLEDGE...
Please remember to look to the bottom of this page and add the shipping cost appropriate for your order. Thank you!
_____________________________________________________________
PROJECT UPDATES:
8.23.12 - We've just been notified that the iClip's™ PATENT has been allowed!  It's great to know that our product is one of a kind and protected.
9.01.12- The team has just decided to develop and produce an iClip™ for the coming iPhone 5 concurrently with the iPhone 4/4S model.  Please check out our READY FOR THE IPHONE 5? pledge level!
_____________________________________________________________
PRESS/BLOG FEATURES:
bitemyapple.co:  Under "Favorite Kickstarter Projects"
materialicious: "A New Versatile Way to Hold the iPhone"
intomobile.com: "The multi-use iClip can do much more than hold your iPhone"
geeky-gadgets.com
gadgetsin.com
_____________________________________________________________
Hi there.  Ben, Devin, and Nand here.
Thank you so much for checking out our first Kickstarter project!  We believe the iClip™ is an innovative product that will find a number of uses in your everyday life.  We truly appreciate your interest and support.
While driving one day, the idea came to Nand for a simple, inexpensive product that would allow someone to clip their iPhone to the visor of their car. After doing some research, he came to find that no one had yet made a product that met his criteria.
When Nand approached Ben and Devin with his vision, they immediately saw the potential for much more.
The team has been diligently working on the design and detailing of the iClip™ for several months at this point, and has produced dozens of rapid prototypes to flesh out the iClip's™ simple yet versatile design.  Two months ago a limited run of 1500 iClips™ was produced from a temporary mold.
So far, everyone who has had the chance to test an iClip™ has said the same thing: "Where can I get one of these?"
Early on in the process it became apparent that we were onto something with true potential, a product that they had never seen before.  Naturally we wanted to protect it, and have recently filed applications for both utility and design patents.
At this point, all of the front work is done, but the team can't finish the race without your help. With the funds raised through Kickstarter, we can purchase permanent molds to begin production and international distribution.
What exactly does the iClip™ do?
Well, obviously, the iClip™ clips.  
The integrated clip allows you to attach your iPhone to a variety of objects that are less than 5/8" (16mm) thick.  The driving force behind its design was for use on you cars sun visor to make hands-free calls.
And the iClip™ stands.
The patent pending arm design allows the iClip™ to hold your phone vertically and horizontally in a standing position without using any moving parts.
The iClip™ also reclines. 
The patent pending design allows the iClip™ to hold your phone vertically and horizontally in a reclined position.
The iClip™ even helps to keep your headphones tidy.
The clips arm features an integrated wire catch which allows your headphones to be neatly stowed.
In how many colors is the iClip™ available?
The iClip™ will be available in five colors during it's Kickstarter campaign. We think they're pretty sweet.
Where can the iClip™ be used?
In our time with the iClip we've found a multitude of uses for it, here are some of our favorites.
In the car; for hands-free calling.
On a plane; the two horizontal reclining positions are perfect for watching downloaded content or reading your favorite E Book.
At home; the vertical standing position is great for facetime.
In the office; the vertical standing position keeps your phone in plain sight so you catch all of your important updates.
At home; as an alarm clock stand and charging station.
The iClip™ is awesome for air travel.
Tray tables are less than 5/8"!
Where will the iClip™ be produced?
From the very beginning of this project, manufacturing and packaging the iClip™ in the USA has been a top priority.  The team is very proud to say that this product was designed and will be manufactured in Southern California.
Does the iClip™ support any other devices?
This model will only hold an iPhone 4/4S.  However, after this project is successfully funded, we have plans to produce iClips™ for many other devices.  We have already designed and prototyped  iPhone 3G/3GS and iPod Touch models of the iClip.  We have plans in the future to expand our line to support the iPhone 5, iPod Touch 2, the iPad, the Samsung Galaxy S2 and S3, and several HTC smartphones.
How will the iClip™ ship?
Please be sure to add the shipping costs below when making your pledge.  All iClip™ orders will ship via USPS priority mail within the US and First-Class Mail International Parcel when shipping internationally. 
.  
1-4 iClips™ will ship anywhere in the US for $6 and internationally for $9. 
5-28 iClips™ will ship anywhere in the US for $12 and internationally for $16.

campaign.story:
HUGE thanks to all of you! This level of support is just mind-blowing.
Update #4 is up.
** stretch #1 already met: Silicone cap added
** stretch #2 already met: Rare Tea Cellar sample
** stretch #3 already met: The big one! Set of custom glasses at $300k
** please read our full update page here
The Porthole is a simple, beautiful infusion vessel designed by Martin Kastner of Crucial Detail design studio. The Porthole can be used to create striking cocktails, oils, teas, dressings, lemonade, coffee, or any other type of infusion.  
Nick's Lemonade
The Story:
The idea for the Porthole was born during a conversation with bar chefs preparing for the opening of the Aviary. We were discussing "fast infusions" -- cocktails evolving during the course of the time it takes to serve them -- and it occurred to me that what we're really looking for is a window into another world, space, and time. An image of the submarine porthole in Karel Zeman's 1958 movie 'The Fabulous World of Jules Verne' came to my mind and the design direction was set.
Submarine Porthole in The Fabulous World of Jules Verne.
A small batch of the Porthole vessels was hand-crafted at Crucial Detail design studio. At the Aviary, it is used to create, display, and serve a variety of time-lapse infusions for seasonal cocktails. 
Tequila Ginger Apricot cocktail at the Aviary.
Since its debut a little over a year ago, the Porthole has gained significant attention.  Aviary cocktails displayed in the Porthole have been featured in dozens of magazines and blogs, including the cover of Food Arts magazine. 
Many Aviary guests have requested to purchase the vessel, including some who, when told they couldn't buy one, have taken it upon themselves to ‘liberate’ them from the lounge. That's when I realized that the design and functionality of the Porthole resonates strongly with people. The enthusiastic response to the piece has driven our decision to adopt the Porthole for production. 
Adaptation:
The technology used to produce the original small batch revolved around our in-house capabilities, utilizing methods suitable for small-scale production. The cost of each unit in the initial batch was over four hundred dollars. In order to make the Porthole more accessible, we have sought higher volume manufacturing technologies and have completely redesigned the components to achieve our target price of less than $100 dollars. The finished Porthole is dishwasher safe, durable, and easy to use. We have gone through a rigorous manufacturer selection process and identified a partner with the capacity and experience to produce the Porthole to our high standards.
We are now ready to pull the trigger. We've gone a long way towards our goal of bringing the project to life outside the Aviary but we're still facing a $ 28,500 investment for molds, first batch manufacturing, and associated expenses. By pre-ordering your Porthole, you help us get it off the ground.
Please check out the backer rewards on the right and help us make it possible to bring this artful service piece to your home.
Specs:
The Porthole holds 390ml (13 fl oz) of liquid.
It is made of precision ground and tempered Low Iron Glass, food grade Delrin,  food grade Silicone, and Stainless Steel.
What is Included:
One Porthole.
Three photo-etched stainless steel filter screens of varying densities.
One flexible silicone cap to seal the contents for longer term infusions.
A set of thumbscrews that can be used as an alternative to the countersunk screws for faster assembly.
Porthole use tips:
Thank you!
Martin Kastner and the Crucial Detail team
Special Thanks:  Lara Kastner, Grant Achatz, Nick Kokonas, Micah Melton, Christian Seel, and everyone at the Aviary in Chicago.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone.
I hope you’re enjoying your Portholes. For the holiday season, we’ve created a new recipe to share with you:

Hi everyone,
Replacement screws arrived in Chicago today. Our warehouse will need a few of days to reassemble the Portholes and prepare them for shipment. The final wave of Black Portholes is scheduled to ship on Wednesday, September 18. If you pledged at one of the Black Porthole levels and are still waiting for your rewards, your Porthole(s) will be in this shipment. A tracking notice will be sent by UPS once the shipments have been processed.
If you pledged for White Portholes or added on to your initial pledge after the original Kickstarter campaign ended, your rewards kits will ship at the end of September. We will send an address survey closer to the shipping date.

Hi everyone,
The vast majority of Kickstarter rewards have been shipped. If you backed by August 28, your Portholes should be in your possession or en route to you. If you backed prior to that date and have not received a tracking notice from UPS, please check your spam folder. A small number of backers have not given us their shipping address. We've sent multiple messages requesting it. If you're an early backer without a Porthole or tracking notice, please check that you've filled out the Kickstarter address survey.

Hi everyone.
Third wave of Porthole reward kits is now being assembled and those slated to receive them have been sent an email survey. This includes our Canadian and European backers. If you haven't received our survey yet, your rewards will be shipping in one of the subsequent waves and you will be hearing from us several days prior to shipping. 
The Kickstarter edition Porthole manufacturing is done and the last ones are en route to Chicago. We will be shipping the remaining rewards in three additional waves roughly two weeks apart.

Hi everyone.
I really appreciate the patience of those of you who are still waiting for your Portholes, allowing us to work out the supply chain issues. Thank you!
We finally have a firm production schedule that the suppliers not only promised but also have been able to stick to over the past month. At the end of this week, the assembly line will hit a 5000 porthole mark and the entire Kickstarter edition production of well over 8000 will be complete at the end of June. The last Kickstarter rewards should be en route to backers at the end of July.

Hi everyone.
Our 2nd US shipment has ben released by US customs and should be delivered to the warehouse for kit assembly and fulfillment after the weekend. It will take a couple more days from there to process all of the outgoing rewards. This weekend, we will send a heads-up email notification to those who will be receiving their Portholes in this wave just in case there are any address changes etc.

Hello everyone,
The next batch of Portholes is scheduled to make a landing in Chicago April 20th. Unless there are delays in customs processing, we should be able to turn them around and ship to backers within a week after that. The following wave of Portholes should arrive in Chicago in mid-May.
Unfortunately, the production has not been continuing as smoothly as we had hoped. The glass manufacturer did not deliver the subsequent round of side glasses on time and we learned that they lost a huge number of parts to micro-fractures caused by a new tool. The cracks were not apparent until after the parts came out of the tempering bath, leading to thousands of glass sides produced between those steps that are not usable. The factory has identified the problem, corrected it, and has restarted production this week, causing a roughly 3-4 week delay in assembly.

Hi everyone,
Production update: The glass process changes were successful, yield has improved, and the factory ramped up production. The assembly line is completing 2000 Portholes this week and plans to continue at roughly that rate until the Kickstarter edition is complete. We expect to receive the 2000 in five weeks and in about another week, they should be in backers' hands. The rest should follow in two more bi-weekly waves.

Hello everyone,
The first small shipment of Portholes is in Chicago. After inspection, they will be transferred to a warehouse for the complete Kickstarter kit assembly and fulfillment - initial 160 kits should be en route to the first backers by the end of the week.

Hi everyone.
The first small shipment of Portholes is en route to us now and our early backers will receive them before the end of this month. The glass production is still not progressing quite as fast as we anticipated, a relatively high reject rate caused a production halt and process tweaks. In light of this we changed our plan from a single large container to multiple smaller shipments in order to get the Portholes to at least some of you faster. Once both factories resume production in the second half of February, the production will continue and with it our rewards fulfillment. We will be shipping rewards in the order in which the project was backed.

campaign.story:
triHOLD:  The No-Compromise Front-Pocket Wallet
triHOLD is for people that refuse to compromise between convenience and style.  triHOLD gives you all the features you demand in a wallet, plus unique ones you never knew you wanted!  Keep your two favorite cards easily available by sliding them out at your convenience.  Keep all your cards organized exactly where you want for quick and easy access.  But unlike most cardholders, you can keep bills and receipts in a full-size billfold.  And it all folds up and fits easily in your front pocket.
triHOLD Features
Modern and compact design 
Easy access to your two favorite cards 
High-quality Napa leather and stainless steel clasp
Six pockets for cards plus one ticket holder
Full-size billfold that fits all major currencies plus receipts
With six cards and cash, the triHOLD is 16mm thick. (iPhone not included)
Check Out Our Original Promotional Videos to See triHOLD in Action:
What is triHOLD made of?
We use the finest Napa leather and a stainless steel clasp in triHOLD.  The wallet is designed to feel compact and secure in your hand and pocket.  The inside of triHOLD is specially designed to make it easy to slide cards out, though the wallet is built to keep the cards securely in place when not in use.
(Note: This advertisement is intentionally boastful)
When will I get my triHOLD wallet?
The first batch will ship in September 2012 with the second batch (which will fill all the rewards) shipping in October 2012.  Our factory is ready to go and there should be no delays.  Guaranteed to be there in time for the holidays as a gift... or to hold your credit cards for the holiday shopping season.  (It's the perfect gift for the person who has everything... because they don't have a triHOLD yet.  Think about it!)
Each triHOLD comes in a gift box (even if the gift is for yourself!)
How is the triHOLD wallet going to be made?
Despite a merit badge in leather work 20 years ago, we were not comfortable making the product ourselves.  We found an outstanding partner in China to create the triHOLD wallet. Our manufacturing partner has 12 years of leather manufacturing experience and a staff of 200 people that will hand-craft each triHOLD wallet using genuine Napa leather.  We have everything ready to go, and have received the final manufacturing samples that show exactly how triHOLD will be for customers.  Based on the quality and craftsmanship of the first batch, we are thrilled to start the manufacturing process if we can achieve the minimum order level necessary to get going.  That's where Kickstarter can save the day!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We took a gamble and ordered our first batch of triHOLD wallets from the factory.  I just got an e-mail that they are all done!  Below you can see what 1,500 completed triHOLD wallets look like all packaged up and ready to hit our distribution centers.  Once the campaign ends here on Kickstarter, it'll take us a couple days to get things organized with distribution.  But it should be only a short period of time before everyone has their triHOLD in their front pocket... or back, if you prefer.
Thanks to everyone for their support.  Despite the setbacks mentioned in our last update, this has been a great experience!  We hope you're all satisfied.

We are extremely appreciative and humbled by of all the support from backers around the world.  Unfortunately, we hit a roadblock that will prevent us from shipping triHOLD wallets to backers in Europe.  In this age of patent wars, small companies like ours have no choice but to comply with the demands of larger ones.  Otherwise, legal fees will drain our bank account before we can get off the ground.
Because of this, we are unable to ship triHOLD wallets to countries in the European Union and Norway.  We are working with Kickstarter to make this process very painless.  After the campaign ends, we will issue an apology and refund to backers in the following countries:

Hello, Backers!
First of all, here at triHOLD global headquarters (my house), we are all very excited to have shot past our goal of $15,000.  What an incredible journey... and we're only half-way to the finish line. 
Just got an e-mail from the factory, and the first batch of triHOLD wallets is flying off the production line.  Such great news!  We couldn't have done that without your support and we're totally psyched about getting them to you as soon as humanly possible.

campaign.story:
When Greg Louganis hit his head on the diving board at the 1988 Seoul Games, it was an unforgettable moment of the Olympics.  But when, despite his injury, he earned the highest single score for his next dive and went on to win the Gold medal, it was among the most incredible feats in sports history.
Olympic Champion Greg Louganis is considered by many to be the greatest diver of all time.  We are making a feature-length independent documentary about Louganis to highlight his heroic personal story. We're here on Kickstarter because we need your help to finish shooting our film!  Our goal is to get our film finished and released by 2013 -- the 25th anniversary of Greg's incredible performance in the 1988 Olympic Games.
We will be shooting with Greg in London in August during the Olympic Games and for a few more months this fall. We need to raise $50,000 to finish shooting. We ultimately need to raise over $300,000 to finish the film, but raising $50,000 now will allow us to keep going towards the finish line! You can be a part of this exciting project by pledging whatever you can afford.
BACK ON BOARD GREG LOUGANIS is an engrossing story about an American legend on the cusp of a comeback. This film reveals Louganis’ evolution from childhood diving prodigy to Olympic champion, and from pioneering openly gay athlete with HIV to a sometimes forgotten sports icon. His recent return to diving as a mentor to US Olympic divers competing at the 2012 London Games provides an exciting new chapter to his life-story.
Our film is an independently-produced project.  We don’t have the backing of a production company, a TV channel, or a big film studio.  We're counting on donations from people like YOU who are willing to help us bring this important story to the screen.
WHY ARE WE MAKING THIS FILM
Greg Louganis’ story is so inspiring and his life so extraordinary -- we really wanted to watch a documentary about him to learn more. But that film didn't exist. We are in the process of changing that with BACK ON BOARD GREG LOUGANIS.  
Greg's story is connected to so many important moments in American history including the Olympics, the AIDS epidemic, the gay rights movement, and even the recent housing crisis. His return to diving, after a long absence, gave us a natural way to tell his unique story and explore his enduring legacy. What is really great about Kickstarter is that we can share the experience of the making the film that tells this important story with others.
OUR GOAL FOR THE FILM
This is a film with a message of hope and against-the-odds courage. It is a story that will inspire all those who see it.  In order to make this film a reality, we are looking to involve many of Greg’s fans, documentary film aficionados, divers, athletes, and members of the LGBT community. 
We are confident that Louganis’ legacy will become even more powerful as this film travels throughout the world affecting the lives of the next generation. Louganis’ life has touched, and been touched, by so many of today’s important social issues; LGBT issues; HIV/AIDS; bullying; the housing crisis; dyslexia; adoption; depression; and domestic violence, to name a few. As filmmakers, we are committed to using this film to do educational outreach in connection with the distribution of the film.
WHAT WILL THESE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
The funds will go directly toward the making of BACK ON BOARD GREG LOUGANIS. Expenses include: 
air travel for crew and production team to shoot with Greg at events in late summer and early fall of 2012
camera equipment rental
sound package rental
hiring a camera person
hiring a location sound recordist
transferring rare archival clips of Greg from his personal home video library
archival research
hard drives to store and back-up our footage
paying the editor to work her magic with our extraordinary footage
HOW YOU CAN HELP
Finishing this film is only going to be possible with your help.
Support our Kickstarter Campaign! 
Spread the word! Email your friends! Post to Facebook! Tweet it!
Check us out on the web: Facebook / Twitter / Email list
Help us get press about this movie and our Kickstarter campaign! Share this news w bloggers, journalists, etc!
WHEN WILL THE FILM BE FINISHED? WHERE CAN I SEE THE FILM?
We are currently still in production on the film. Our goal is to submit to film festivals and secure a wide release in 2013 - the 25th anniversary of the 1988 Seoul Olympics. We will explore all distribution options including theatrical and broadcast. We plan on taking the film to film festivals around the country and beyond.  If all of our filmmaker dreams came true we'd also have a theatrical release and a national TV broadcast!  Eventually we will release the film on DVD and digitally (e.g. iTunes, Netflix, etc.). 
IS MY DONATION TAX-DEDUCTIBLE?
Donations made via KICKSTARTER are NOT tax-deductible.  To make a tax-deductible donation to support the making of BACK ON BOARD you may donate through our 501(c)(3) non-profit fiscal sponsor the CENTER FOR INDEPENDENT DOCUMENTARY (CID).  All donations made to CID on behalf of BACK ON BOARD are tax-deductible.  Click here to make a tax-deductible donation BY CREDIT CARD. Click here to make a tax-deductible donation BY CHECK.
I WANT TO DONATE MORE THAN $10,000!  I WANT TO BE THE EXECUTIVE PRODUCER!  I WANT TO BROADCAST AND/OR DISTRIBUTE  THIS MOVIE!   I HAVE SOME GREAT OLD FOOTAGE OR PHOTOS OF GREG THAT YOU MIGHT WANT TO USE IN YOUR FILM!    I WANT TO CONTACT THE FILMMAKERS!
GREAT IDEA!  We want to hear more!  Please get in touch with Will Sweeney at will@louganisdoc.com or Cheryl Furjanic at cheryl@louganisdoc.com and and let's get to talking!

campaign.story:
Recent Media Coverage
Former CU Buff basketball player identifies as 'third gender'
What is Gender Blending?
Fund This!: A New Film About Third Gender

The bravest thing to do is to be yourself…
Let us explore an extraordinary journey of self. A self that has been suppressed for many — and by many — for ages. Together, we can experience the beauty of  being who you truly are.
About The Film
GENDER BLENDER: A FILM ABOUT GENDER DIVERSITY follows the life of Lauren, a person who identifies as “gender neutral,*” as well as the life of others who exist outside the binary gender structure of female and male. Take an intimate journey through the physical, emotional, and spiritual changes Lauren and others undergoes just to be themselves.
See how simple things like choosing which public restroom (or changing room) to use is a challenge and part of every day life.
This positive and empowering film will highlight what individuals must go through to fulfill their ultimate life-long dream: to feel comfortable and natural in their own skin. Intimately travel with Lauren and others through their extraordinary journeys and witness the beautiful lives of gender diverse individuals.
After hearing “our truth”, you will never look at gender the same way.

Please note that there are gender neutral pronouns, such as hir/ze. These will be addressed in the film. Lauren does not mind being referred to by male, female, or neutral pronouns, although other genderqueer people have different preferences…
*Please also note: There is little consensus over the difference between terms such as agender, genderless, non-gender, gender neutral and neutrois. These terms are often used interchangeably or defined differently by individual writers in ways that do not necessarily match the self definitions of others using those terms.
Aren't there only two genders?
We have been conditioned to only recognize two genders: male and female (this is known as the gender binary). There are, in fact, many more genders. There are a spectrum of various gender expressions that exist beyond the binary.
Everything in life exists on a fluid continuum… and gender is no exception.
What will the money be used for?
Your funds will go towards getting the film made and seen, from pre-production all the way to submitting it to film festivals and marketing it around the world.
We have assembled a talented, accomplished team that we will be introducing to in the coming weeks. It is important that this documentary be shot with broadcast quality equipment and crewed by professional camera operators, sound mixers and editors, so that it is seen by as many people as possible, used in educational settings, and presented at film festivals. Every penny of your money goes directly to the funding and distribution of this film, including:
Shooting with a professional crew
Editing and post-production, including professional sound mastering and mixing
Closed Captioning
Licensing the rights to news footage and music
Legal and production insurance
Film festival and registration fees and filing
Marketing and distribution
How Kickerstarter Works
Kickstarter is an "all or nothing" platform. Therefore, each donation plays an intricate role in the making of this entire project. If we do not raise the full amount, we receive no funding... and we will be unable to document this process that we believe so strongly in. If you wish to pay with PayPal (which Kickstarter does not currently accept), click here. PayPal payments will not be added to the Kickstarter total, but we will make sure that you still receive the rewards listed for your contribution level.)
How Will We Use Extra Money?
If we raise money above our goal, we will use it to help with extra marketing and distribution. Our goal is to get this seen by as many people as possible.
Film Festivals
We intend to enter this film into the major indie and LGBT film festivals. We believes its subject matter is unique, powerful, and extremely provocative. Very few (if any) movies have documented the journey of one "female's" transition to become third-gender. If you are able to help with the marketing and distribution of this film, please get in contact with us at hello@genderblendermovie.com.
Final Words From Lauren
I wish to share my story, experiences and life with others like me and unlike me. I wish to educate others about a population of us who have been misunderstood and often times rejected... simply because we fail to see someone beyond the labels we place upon each other.
It is a privilege and an honor to be who I am, but most importantly to share this love with all. Feel free to write me at lauren@genderblendermovie.com with any questions or comments.

updates.update_content:
Dear Supporters,
We would like to extend our deepest gratitude for all of your contributions and support over the past two months. Our project has taken off far greater than we ever anticipated, and we are excited to begin the next stages of the creative process.
Although the Kickstarter campaign has ended, this is just the beginning for us! We garnered so much success with the Kickstarter platform—international media, funds, and support— that now it is time to take it to the next level.

updates.update_userinfo: Gender Blender Featured in Queer Magazine Online!
updates.update_content:
Gender Blender has just been featured in Queer Magazine Online! The magazine writes:
"Gender Blender - The Natural Order of Things. You read the title of this interview and now you’ve got to be asking yourself is there actually gender diversity out there? We have men or the male gender of our species and we have women or the female gender of our species, right? Are there sexual categories? Does each person fit neatly into one preconceived slot, meaning male or female?" (8/1/12)

We had a phenomenal turnout and evening at our fundraising event the other night. We have garnered over $20,000 so far! 
 A BIG THANK YOU to all of you backers for your contributions and support. Please continue to help us spread our cause and raise money by sharing the link to our Kickstarter page. 
Great work so far, let's keep it up!

It's only been a few days since we have raised our last $1,000, and things continue to move forward quickly because of backers like you!
Today we broke the $3,000 mark! Let's continue to forge ahead! We have just over a month to really focus on driving pledges to this project and making it a reality. 
We have more exciting news to share with you shortly!

Team Gender Blender is pleased to announce that we have received over $2,000 in generous donations! There is a way to go, but things are really starting to heat up! We all must be diligent, spread our message, and continue to drive donations! This momentum is incredible. 
This is our story. Let's make it happen!
Much love,

updates.update_userinfo: Gender Blender Featured in Curve Magazine!
updates.update_content:
Curve Magazine, the nation's leading Lesbian Magazine, just featured our campaign. They write, "Journey with Lauren Lubin as she pioneers ultimate gender awareness for the LGBT community and herself—transitioning from female to gender neutral."
In just a matter of days, we have started to create quite a buzz! This could not be done without the amazing support that the LGBTQ community has provided for us. It is humbling to see how quickly and actively the LGBTQ has responded. We deeply thank you all, and we ALL must remain diligent to keep this momentum going!

campaign.story:
CHECK OUT A REVIEW OF OUR CHIPS IN SF WEEKLY'S FOOD BLOG: "They're great on their own, but we can't wait to try them with ice cream, salad, and sprinkled over cereal." 
http://blogs.sfweekly.com/foodie/2012/08/dang_foods_toasted_coconut_chips.php
FOOD N' RECIPE's FEATURE STORY ON DANG: 
Part 1: "See Why We're So Excited for "Dang Coconut Chips" [Kickstarter of the Day]"
http://www.foodnrecipe.com/articles/2094/20120906/see-why-excited-dang-coconut-chips-kickstarter.htm
Part 2: "Good Sh*t Alert: New Guilt-Free Toasted Coconut Chips from Dang Foods and the Young Genius Behind Them"
http://www.foodnrecipe.com/articles/2097/20120907/good-sh-t-alert-new-guilt-free.htm
Why Dang?
Dang is my Mom’s name. It means “red” in Thai.
“Dang, that’s good!” often comes out of people’s mouths after they try our coconut chips. 
What are Coconut Chips?
Coconut chips are a healthy snack with all the benefits of coconut oil. They're made from the copra (coconut meat), sliced out and toasted with sugar and salt. 
The coconut chips are: Vegan, Gluten Free, No Cholesterol, No Dairy, No MSG
They’re versatile – they can be used as a topping for yogurt, salads, ice cream, baked goods, cereal, pancakes, and more.
Who carries Dang?
Currently about 15 stores in SF, NYC, and Seattle carry our chips. See our website for a store near you.
We have Whole Foods waiting to get some. Chobani uses it as a yogurt topping at their retail store in Manhattan.
When did Dang begin?
A year ago we came up with the concept at the SF Underground Farmer's Market. We set out to make a recipe for Thai Lettuce Wraps, and found the toasted coconut to be irresistibly delicious! Since then, we’ve designed packaging and contacted suppliers, arranged shipping from Thailand, and struck up relationships with buyers. Now we need your help to pull the trigger on our first large shipment. Up until now, we’ve sold small batches to select stores, but it’s time to grow!
We need to get a container full of chips.
The money will be used for:
-       Paying for the production run
-       Packaging, Boxes, Shipping, Warehousing
-       Attending events to spread word about Dang 
About the Dang family:
Sprawled across the world, we have bases in San Francisco, New York, and Bangkok. We love food and we have multiple generations working to bring the best food in Thailand into your kitchen. 
We believe in the 3 Cs and 4 Fs:
Family - We are a family company, and as such we support each other to the fullest.
Friends - We treat our partners and customers as we would treat our friends…with respect.
Fun - We're happy and we know it!
Food - We live to eat and we love to share what we eat.
Culture - We're aware of those things that are ingrained by one's upbringing and value the richness of diversity that exists in this wonderful world.
Community - We think community is the best way to live a fulfilling life on this earth so we strive to create beautiful communities and give back to our community.
Creativity - We're into trying new things. We take risks, we experiment, we prototype and iterate…and we'll continue to do so always and forever.
Special thanks to: Brock Cady for his video editing magic, Cathleen Li, Andrew Kitirattragarn, Colt Fulk, Sheyen Ikeda, Allison Doyle, Sam Yang, Tim Seward, and everybody else who has helped us out along the way!
-Vincent Kitirattragarn, Founder and Chief Culinary Officer
Be sure to like us on Facebook for the latest updates: www.facebook.com/dangfoods
www.dangfoods.com

campaign.story:
View Video in HD
                        Heading Towards the Finish
We would like to extend an enormous "Thank you!" to everyone that has backed and shared this project so far.  We had a very successful period during pledge matching that helped bring us closer to our our $15,000 stretch goal.  With just minutes left to go in the campaign for Nekko, we would love to make it all the way to the stretch goal so that we can bring enhancements to the project like a live score and superior quality camera lenses.  Please continue to spread the word, make sure to enter our Facebook giveaway, and be sure to check out the latest update to hear a bit from all of us!
What is Nekko? 
Nekko is a short film being developed by a tight knit group of talented young filmmakers with experience ranging from feature films to music videos and commercials. The title of the film, “根っこ”, pronounced “nekko”, is a Japanese translation of the English word “roots” that captures the important role that both physical and familial roots play in the film. The story, which has been in development for nearly a year, has blossomed into a passionate tale that appeals to all ages. 
Story:
 Set on a remote farm in Feudal Japan, nine-year-old Kue wishes to be free from the strict regimen of manual labor imposed by her widowed mother. When strange roots begin to overrun their crops, Kue’s mother mysteriously disappears, leaving Kue to revel in her newfound freedom. She finds an unlikely friend in a magical origami hummingbird, but when the sinister roots steal her new companion, Kue decides to attempt a rescue. Descending into a subterranean world below the roots, Kue is confronted by a reality that is more complex than she ever could have imagined.
Production:
 The ambitious nature of this project is matched with a talented team of creatives and careful planning has gone into researching the best way to tell this story with as little artistic compromise as possible. Three sets (the house, garden, and underground lair) have been designed to be historically accurate and are currently being built. Principal photography will take place at the Marion Knott Studios using these sets. A separate mountainside location in Northern California has already been chosen as the virtual “setting” for the film. By building the sets to match the exact dimensions of the Northern California location, wrapping those sets in blue screen, and then shooting footage (or “’plates”) of that mountainside after-the-fact, the visual effects artists will be able to composite the actors and sets shot in Orange County with the photography of the mountainside in Northern California. The mountainside footage will be digitally enhanced with Japanese details to fully realize this fantasy world. 
 In addition to creating the setting, visual effects play a large role in other areas of the project. Kue’s friend, the hummingbird, as well as many other origami creatures will be entirely computer generated and are currently in production. Bringing these original CG characters to life will require 3D modeling, animation, and compositing to be done in entirety from the ground up. These characters will seamlessly interact with live actors to produce a cohesive visual language. 
One unique aspect of the film is an entirely animated segment which transitions Kue from the normal world to the dark and magical world of the paper roots. The animation and textures will be highly stylized to emphasize the rush of emotion that Kue feels in this sequence. We are excited to be using this mixed medium approach in order to create a more abstract and impressionistic sequence within the film. 
 The production has already obtained a significant amount of resources. Access to a soundstage, camera package, lights, grip supplies, and electrical equipment, as well as insurance will be fully provided by Marion Knott Studios in September and October. On the digital side, visual effects artists are hard at work already designing characters on state-of-the-art computers utilizing the latest hardware and software. 
While much of the production is accounted for, there are significant costs that we do not currently have the funds to cover. First, we do not have the money to cast or compensate any of our actors. Second, without over 2000 square feet of chroma-key bluescreen, we will not be able to place our actors and sets into a virtual environment. Though the funds needed for blue screen and cast are not insignificant, the vast majority of our budgetary need is due to the high cost of materials needed for building our historically accurate and elaborate sets. Creating the physical sets for the farm, home, and underground root caves from scratch will be a massive undertaking, and though we have a full production design team consisting entirely of unpaid volunteers, the simple cost of materials is daunting. We want to create an immersive environment for the viewer, but doing so practically will not be feasible without help from the Kickstarter community.
From The Director:
When I was first shown an early draft of the script, what interested me the most about the story was the striking relationship between Kue and her mother. Hidden in the heart of this crazy-cool Japanese fantasy adventure was a simple story about the way our relationships change during childhood and the difficulties of growing up. After a great deal of research, we chose to set the film in Feudal Japan. I have had a fascination with Japanese culture since a young age. My parents worked for a Japanese company while I was growing up, and as a teenager I was lucky enough to do a Japanese exchange program which gave me the opportunity to live with a Japanese family on the island of Kagawa. Though my time there was brief, the value of respect and the aesthetics of simplicity left lasting impressions on me. 
On their small farm in Feudal Japan, with no man and little money, Kue and her widowed mother are barely able to scrape by. In those times, a season's harvest could be the difference between life and death and because of this, Kue is forced to work constantly by her mother. Simultaneously, Kue’s mother tries to teach Kue the skills and behaviors that will enable her to marry up out of her situation. Kue loathes what she feels is a double standard imposed by her mother and it is this resentment that burns at their relationship. It is very important to me that the film not only be universal in its message, but authentically Japanese in its content. For that reason, all of the dialogue in the film will be in Japanese and we are working with translators and advisors to ensure accuracy and artistry.
As both a director and cinematographer, my passion in film has always been for visual storytelling. Whether it's in the performance, framing, or editing, the magic of watching a story unfold without words or explanation is what for me separates cinema from all other media. For this reason, screenwriter Dag Shapshak and I chose to rarely utilize dialogue, focusing on progressing the story nonverbally. Dag and I have been constant collaborators for over six years now, and this project is the culmination of our work up until now. 
It is impossible for me to discuss collaboration without introducing the incredibly talented team of young creative professionals who will be helming this project beside me. At the center of the project from its inception have been Hunter Schmidt and Phil McGuire, the visual effects supervisors. Both prodigies in the fields of 3D modeling, animation, and compositing, the two of them are responsible for bringing the magic in the story to life. Production designer Alex Lubow has an equally daunting task: building both the environments of Fuedal Japan and an entirely fantastical underground world through physical sets and props. Composer Trevor Doherty, who just recently finished his undergraduate degree in music composition from The Juliard School has collaborated with me on every film I’ve ever directed. A music scholar as well as a composer, Trevor’s knowledge of Japanese music combined with his talent for composing for film will be a fundamental asset to the emotional resonance of the film. As a cinematographer myself, I’m looking forward to be teaming with Brian White, the most dedicated DP I've ever met. Esther Sokolow, the film’s editor was on the project even before I was and she has had her finger on the story’s pulse since the original inception of the concept. Finally, at the head of this beast, is producer Brandon Padveen who is responsible for making sure everything gets done (even things like this director statement for Kickstarter). As you can see, he's doing an amazing job so far. 
I couldn't be more excited to share this story and with your help I know that we can bring these paper pages to life. 
                                                                           -Mishka Kornai

updates.update_content:
Dearest Kickstarter Backers, 
I could not be more proud to present the completed version of our film! 
The genesis of this project has been the longest and most laborious process I myself, or any of the other key creatives, have ever undertaken. Inordinate amounts of time and energy was contributed by countless people to ensure that what made it to your screen today (and soon to your mailbox) was something we, as well as all of you contributors, can be proud of. From months of writing, more months of pre-production, weeks of fundraising, more weeks of building, even more weeks of rehearsing, to a grueling 9 days of shooting, all before embarking on a post-production journey lasting more than eight months and consisting of an amalgam of editing, sound recording, and scoring, not to mention the seemingly limitless quantity of compositing, animation, and color correction; we have finally arrived here. Phew! Not just at the end of a run-on sentence, but at the moment where the life of the film really begins: with you. There were numerous challenges, set-backs, and even missteps along the way, and one of the largest has been the long overdue completion and delivery of this project. I apologize for the delay and all I can hope is that you feel your experience was worth the additional wait. As for perk delivery, DVDs, Blu-Rays, as well as all other physical perks will be mailed in the next week.

Hey Kickstarter backers!
I just posted something similar in the comments section but I figured it was better served with an update.
My deepest apologies for the late delivery as well as lack page activity recently. The project is now in the FINAL stages of completion (inclusion of subtitles and the final sound mix, specifically). The project is also in no way dead. If any of you is interested in watching the 'work-in-progress' version in it's entirety (the version that was physically screened) send a private message to this page, or email me directly at mkornai@gmail.com for a link. This project had a great deal of setbacks in post production, and small tweaks turned into extended ordeals, lasting longer than expected. We are all extremely excited for you to watch the film and physical perks will still be going out to backers that signed up for them.

Hello everybody. Many apologies for the length of time since the last update. Allow us to bring you up to speed.
In short: Nekko is in its very final stages. At the time of our last update we believed the film to be all but completed. We had screened at our film school to a very positive reception (we won for VFX and production design!), and were making what we thought to be the last tweaks.

Kickstarter Backers!
The Nekko team has a very important update that we would like to share with you.
As announced in our last update, we had our first public screening of Nekko at Chapman University's Dodge College of Film and Media Arts on May 2nd. The screening was an overwhelming success and we are excited to share the film with all of you.

Hi everybody! 
We wanted to let you know that Nekko is almost complete! You will be receiving your well-deserved rewards over the next two or so months.
Nekko will be screening at:
Dodge College
283 N Cypress St Orange, CA 92866
in the Folino movie theater

Hey all! Thanks for your patience. We have a small update for you to appease those appetites for Nekko.
What are these photos, you might ask? Well...
Here we have some in progress textures, to give you a tiny taste of what they visual effects are building towards. You can also see the texture that will be wrapped around an origami butterfly.

Hello dear friends! Our team wanted to extend a quick line, and let you all know that post-production  is now well under way, and that we are working very hard to bring you our completed picture as soon as possible. We are nearing the finalized edit of Nekko, and every day new visual effects are being designed or completed. There is a long road ahead, but a lot of progress is already behind us.
Do stay tuned! We'll have a whole slew of new content to show you very soon.

First of all, we wanted to say THANK YOU! With the help of each and every one of you, we were able to turn this dream into a reality. I mean it when I say that every dollar honestly made a difference in the creation of this project. We are all wrapped with filming and moving on to the post-production phase of our film.

I would like to remind you all to fill out your surveys that have been sent out, so we can send the perks out to you when we complete the film. Also, if you'd like to view pictures and a behind the scenes look of what we accomplished on set, please like us on Facebook at:

Once again, we couldn't have done this without you and we are eternally grateful for your donations and continued support. どうも　ありがとう ございます
Check out this neat time lapse showing the construction process behind the house and garden sets.  The production design team has been working tirelessly to make a truly incredible set!

Everything is coming together!  The house is standing, actors are rehearsing, digital content is being developed, and schedules are being created.  Here are some photos showing a bit of what has been going on.

campaign.story:
Hi Kickstarters, Thanks for checking out our project! We hope you had a little bit of fun with our animation.
After I purchased my iPad, I had to put up with missing cables, missing chargers, and having no access to my cool gadgets when I needed them the most. There was no way to organize everything in one place. I finally reached my tipping point (and my tolerance level is usually very high), so I determined that I must come up with a solution.
From that point, I started prototyping an iPad pouch that could safely keep and organize all my iPad accessories and personal belongings while having the best protection for my iPad.
Introducing tabu tablet Pouch 
360 view of the Pouch
Memory Foam for Maximum Protection
Some may ask, what is it? It is high-density foam that has incredible shock absorbency. Invented by NASA to protect astronauts during rocket takeoff, now it is more widely used in beds and pillows. Are you wondering, “Memory foam beds? The foam must be thick.” The answer is, “Nope.” Our pouch is light and thin, with the perfect amount of foam that protects your iPad against drops and bumps.
have fun with the unique memory foam texture
Water Resistance 
The body of the Pouch is made with polyurethane fiber which makes the Pouch durable and water resistant. It keeps the gadgets safe from rain drops and splashes. Great for beach side visits.
Translucent Zipper Pocket 
It secures all your accessories in the front of the Pouch. No more digging inside your bag and searching for your small items (a hair clip, USB flash drive, or anything small). You can see them at a glance.
Magnetic Closure for Convenience and protection
Six industrial grade magnets secure your iPad safely inside the Pouch. The magnets are covered with memory foam, and microfiber lining protects your iPad from zipper scratches when you insert or remove the iPad from the Pouch.
Auto screen cleaning 
Your iPad screen will be cleaned automatically by the microfiber lining when your iPad goes in and out of the Pouch. No more dirty finger prints on your screen!
Slim design
Back Cases and Smart Cover compatible 
We designed the Pouch so that it will fit even if you have a back case and Smart Cover on your iPad
Works with Smart Cover and Back cases
This very simple solution saves you from a lot of hassels! Our goal is to improve everyone’s experience with their iPad and accessories without sacrificing desk space and wasting precious time.
Colors
You can choose from two colors: blue or grey. We would love to come up with more colors for the Pouch and that’s why we need your help, Kickstarters.
Fundings
Funding Your funding is very important for us to pay for the initial manufacturing and mass manufacturing cost. We have received quotations from several different factories. It takes $5000 to order material and manufacture the Pouch at a reasonable price. In addition, we also want to expand our color collection, so all of you can be happy with a wide range of colors in the future. 
Why can’t you just buy a small pouch for your accessories? 
Why waste money buying two carriers when you can pay a good price for just one? Also, our tabu tablet Pouch is a lot more convenient and safe to use with the extra memory foam protection. It not only gives mobility to your iPad, but it also keeps your crazy fun accessories together!
Thank You for Supporting Us! 
Thank you very much for your time and money, Backers! We will start manufacturing once the project is funded. For more ways to simplify your experience with your tablets please find us on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/TABUproducts) and DON’T forget to “Like” our page, Kickstarters =b

Dear all backers!

Hi Backers!
This is a regular update for the Pouch project.  The pouch production will be done by Sept 26th, and we are looking into different ways to get the Pouch ship to you as soon as possible. campaign.story:
My first album, Precious Time, will be possible ONLY through the support and love from family, friends, fans and lovers of good music.  Just a year ago I never would've even dreamed of doing this.  I would not have had the confidence to pursue this dream of mine.  I am so thankful and grateful that, with YOUR support, I will have the opportunity to share my music with the world. 
I will be recording in Louisa with amazing producer, Chris Keup (Jason Mraz, Sanders Bohlke), for a week starting August 24th!
*The goal I've set is a minimum I HAVE to raise in order to receive any of it!  So please please post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networking sites! EVERY GIFT MATTERS! Thanks ya'll!!
Michael

campaign.story:
High Fiction, the popular music webzine, is hosting its first ever Battle of the Bands. Six bands will compete in a no-holds-barred deathmatch. You decide who survives! 
The Battle of the Bands takes place over 5 nights as a part of the Boulder International Fringe Festival in August at the legendary Broker Inn.  Every show is different as the audience decides who stays and who goes.  But wait!  That's not all--it's also a limited edition EP from the bands themselves.  Now who would you betray to get your hands on those tickets or those recordings?  I'm guessing your own mother.
As you know, producing theatre and recording music are both expensive prospects.  We're only asking for a small portion of the actual costs, but we sure could use your help in getting this project off the ground.
The bands need you.  High Fiction needs you.  Britney needs you.
Written and conceived by Gary Grundei and Amy Shelley with Amanda Berg Wilson, Meridith Crosley Grundei, and Eryc Eyl. Directed by Amanda Berg Wilson.
Want another taste of High Fiction?!?  Help yourself to our first single.  It's a FREE DOWNLOAD!:  http://thisishighfiction.com/archives/117

updates.update_content:
Well, my friends, we didn't reach our goal and so the pledges will not go through and the rewards will not be sent.  I'm sad about this and maybe you are, too.  But I have some good news.
First, I am so very, very grateful to all of you who showed such amazing support of our project.  I hope you'll come see our Boulder Fringe Show, and like our Facebook page, so you can be kept informed of our recordings, live performances and videos.  And, of course, please visit our website at thisishighfiction.com where you can, for a limited time, download No More Mistakes, our first official single, for free.  It's under the "Yes Wagon" story.

Friends, we're coming down to the last 24 hours of the HIgh Fiction Kickstarter, so if any of you were thinking about raising your pledge at the last minute to help us reach our goal, now would be the time!  Notice that we now have amazing High Fiction GRANOLA at the $50 level and don't forget about the option of an original song for that special someone at the $1K level.
Thank you so much for your support and if you know of anyone else who might want to kick in this last day, please pass this along!  You are rock stars.
